description: This tremendous 100% varietal wine hails from Oakville and was aged over three years in oak. Juicy red-cherry fruit and a compelling hint of caramel greet the palate, framed by elegant, fine tannins and a subtle minty tone in the background. Balanced and rewarding from start to finish, it has years ahead of it to develop further nuance. Enjoy 2022–2030.
Refined-description: This tremendous 100 varietal wine hail Oakville aged three year oak Juicy redcherry fruit compelling hint caramel greet palate framed elegant fine tannin subtle minty tone background Balanced rewarding start finish year ahead develop nuance Enjoy 2022–2030

description: Ripe aromas of fig, blackberry and cassis are softened and sweetened by a slathering of oaky chocolate and vanilla. This is full, layered, intense and cushioned on the palate, with rich flavors of chocolaty black fruits and baking spices. A toasty, everlasting finish is heady but ideally balanced. Drink through 2023.
Refined-description: Ripe aroma fig blackberry cassis softened sweetened slathering oaky chocolate vanilla This full layered intense cushioned palate rich flavor chocolaty black fruit baking spice A toasty everlasting finish heady ideally balanced Drink 2023

description: Mac Watson honors the memory of a wine once made by his mother in this tremendously delicious, balanced and complex botrytised white. Dark gold in color, it layers toasted hazelnut, pear compote and orange peel flavors, reveling in the succulence of its 122 g/L of residual sugar.
Refined-description: Mac Watson honor memory wine made mother tremendously delicious balanced complex botrytised white Dark gold color layer toasted hazelnut pear compote orange peel flavor reveling succulence 122 gL residual sugar

description: This spent 20 months in 30% new French oak, and incorporates fruit from Ponzi's Aurora, Abetina and Madrona vineyards, among others. Aromatic, dense and toasty, it deftly blends aromas and flavors of toast, cigar box, blackberry, black cherry, coffee and graphite. Tannins are polished to a fine sheen, and frame a finish loaded with dark chocolate and espresso. Drink now through 2032.
Refined-description: This spent 20 month 30 new French oak incorporates fruit Ponzi Aurora Abetina Madrona vineyard among others Aromatic dense toasty deftly blend aroma flavor toast cigar box blackberry black cherry coffee graphite Tannins polished fine sheen frame finish loaded dark chocolate espresso Drink 2032

description: This is the top wine from La Bégude, named after the highest point in the vineyard at 1200 feet. It has structure, density and considerable acidity that is still calming down. With 18 months in wood, the wine has developing an extra richness and concentration. Produced by the Tari family, formerly of Château Giscours in Margaux, it is a wine made for aging. Drink from 2020.
Refined-description: This top wine La Bégude named highest point vineyard 1200 foot It structure density considerable acidity still calming With 18 month wood wine developing extra richness concentration Produced Tari family formerly Château Giscours Margaux wine made aging Drink 2020

description: Deep, dense and pure from the opening bell, this Toro is a winner. Aromas of dark ripe black fruits are cool and moderately oaked. This feels massive on the palate but sensationally balanced. Flavors of blackberry, coffee, mocha and toasty oak finish spicy, smooth and heady. Drink this exemplary Toro through 2023.
Refined-description: Deep dense pure opening bell Toro winner Aromas dark ripe black fruit cool moderately oaked This feel massive palate sensationally balanced Flavors blackberry coffee mocha toasty oak finish spicy smooth heady Drink exemplary Toro 2023

description: Slightly gritty black-fruit aromas include a sweet note of pastry along with a hint of prune. Wall-to-wall saturation ensures that all corners of one's mouth are covered. Flavors of blackberry, mocha and chocolate are highly impressive and expressive, while this settles nicely on a long finish. Drink now through 2024.
Refined-description: Slightly gritty blackfruit aroma include sweet note pastry along hint prune Walltowall saturation ensures corner one mouth covered Flavors blackberry mocha chocolate highly impressive expressive settle nicely long finish Drink 2024

description: Lush cedary black-fruit aromas are luxe and offer notes of marzipan and vanilla. This bruiser is massive and tannic on the palate, but still lush and friendly. Chocolate is a key flavor, while baked berry and cassis flavors are hardly wallflowers. On the finish, this is tannic and deep as a sea trench. Drink this saturated black-colored Toro through 2023.
Refined-description: Lush cedary blackfruit aroma luxe offer note marzipan vanilla This bruiser massive tannic palate still lush friendly Chocolate key flavor baked berry cassis flavor hardly wallflower On finish tannic deep sea trench Drink saturated blackcolored Toro 2023

description: This re-named vineyard was formerly bottled as deLancellotti. You'll find striking minerality underscoring chunky black fruits. Accents of citrus and graphite comingle, with exceptional midpalate concentration. This is a wine to cellar, though it is already quite enjoyable. Drink now through 2030.
Refined-description: This renamed vineyard formerly bottled deLancellotti You find striking minerality underscoring chunky black fruit Accents citrus graphite comingle exceptional midpalate concentration This wine cellar though already quite enjoyable Drink 2030

description: The producer sources from two blocks of the vineyard for this wine—one at a high elevation, which contributes bright acidity. Crunchy cranberry, pomegranate and orange peel flavors surround silky, succulent layers of texture that present as fleshy fruit. That delicately lush flavor has considerable length.
Refined-description: The producer source two block vineyard wine—one high elevation contributes bright acidity Crunchy cranberry pomegranate orange peel flavor surround silky succulent layer texture present fleshy fruit That delicately lush flavor considerable length

description: Elegance, complexity and structure come together in this drop-dead gorgeous winethat ranks among Italy's greatest whites. It opens with sublime yellow spring flower, aromatic herb and orchard fruit scents. The creamy, delicious palate seamlessly combines juicy white peach, ripe pear and citrus flavors while white almond and savory mineral notes grace the lingering finish.
Refined-description: Elegance complexity structure come together dropdead gorgeous winethat rank among Italy greatest white It open sublime yellow spring flower aromatic herb orchard fruit scent The creamy delicious palate seamlessly combine juicy white peach ripe pear citrus flavor white almond savory mineral note grace lingering finish

description: From 18-year-old vines, this supple well-balanced effort blends flavors of mocha, cherry, vanilla and breakfast tea. Superbly integrated and delicious even at this early stage, this wine seems destined for a long and savory cellar life. Drink now through 2028.
Refined-description: From 18yearold vine supple wellbalanced effort blend flavor mocha cherry vanilla breakfast tea Superbly integrated delicious even early stage wine seems destined long savory cellar life Drink 2028

description: A standout even in this terrific lineup of 2015 releases from Patricia Green, the Weber opens with a burst of cola and tobacco scents and accents. It continues, subtle and detailed, with flavors of oranges, vanilla, tea and milk chocolate discreetly threaded through ripe blackberry fruit.
Refined-description: A standout even terrific lineup 2015 release Patricia Green Weber open burst cola tobacco scent accent It continues subtle detailed flavor orange vanilla tea milk chocolate discreetly threaded ripe blackberry fruit

description: This wine is in peak condition. The tannins and the secondary flavors dominate this ripe leather-textured wine. The fruit is all there as well: dried berries and hints of black-plum skins. It is a major wine right at the point of drinking with both the mature flavors and the fruit in the right balance.
Refined-description: This wine peak condition The tannin secondary flavor dominate ripe leathertextured wine The fruit well dried berry hint blackplum skin It major wine right point drinking mature flavor fruit right balance

description: With its sophisticated mix of mineral, acid and tart fruits, this seductive effort pleases from start to finish. Supple and dense, it's got strawberry, blueberry, plum and black cherry, a touch of chocolate, and that underlying streak of mineral. All these elements are in good proportion and finish with an appealing silky texture. It's delicious already, but give it another decade for full enjoyment. Drink now through 2028.
Refined-description: With sophisticated mix mineral acid tart fruit seductive effort plea start finish Supple dense got strawberry blueberry plum black cherry touch chocolate underlying streak mineral All element good proportion finish appealing silky texture It delicious already give another decade full enjoyment Drink 2028

description: First made in 2006, this succulent luscious Chardonnay is all about minerality. It's got a rich core of butterscotch and the seemingly endless layers of subtle flavors that biodynamic farming can bring. It spends 18 months on the lees prior to bottling. Drink now through 2028.
Refined-description: First made 2006 succulent luscious Chardonnay minerality It got rich core butterscotch seemingly endless layer subtle flavor biodynamic farming bring It spends 18 month lee prior bottling Drink 2028

description: This blockbuster, powerhouse of a wine suggests blueberry pie and chocolate as it opens in the glass. On the palate, it's smooth and seductively silky, offering complex cedar, peppercorn and peppery oak seasonings amidst its dense richness. It finishes with finesse and spice.
Refined-description: This blockbuster powerhouse wine suggests blueberry pie chocolate open glass On palate smooth seductively silky offering complex cedar peppercorn peppery oak seasoning amidst dense richness It finish finesse spice

description: Nicely oaked blackberry, licorice, vanilla and charred aromas are smooth and sultry. This is an outstanding wine from an excellent year. Forward barrel-spice and mocha flavors adorn core blackberry and raspberry fruit, while this runs long and tastes vaguely chocolaty on the velvety finish. Enjoy this top-notch Tempranillo through 2030.
Refined-description: Nicely oaked blackberry licorice vanilla charred aroma smooth sultry This outstanding wine excellent year Forward barrelspice mocha flavor adorn core blackberry raspberry fruit run long taste vaguely chocolaty velvety finish Enjoy topnotch Tempranillo 2030

description: Coming from a seven-acre vineyard named after the dovecote on the property, this is a magnificent wine. Powered by both fruit tannins and the 28 months of new wood aging, it is darkly rich and with great concentration. As a sign of its pedigree, there is also elegance here, a restraint which is new to this wine. That makes it a wine for long-term aging. Drink from 2022.
Refined-description: Coming sevenacre vineyard named dovecote property magnificent wine Powered fruit tannin 28 month new wood aging darkly rich great concentration As sign pedigree also elegance restraint new wine That make wine longterm aging Drink 2022

description: This fresh and lively medium-bodied wine is beautifully crafted, with cherry blossom aromas and tangy acidity. Layered and seductive, it offers a crisp mix of orange peel, cherry, pomegranate and baking spice flavors that are ready for the table or the cellar.
Refined-description: This fresh lively mediumbodied wine beautifully crafted cherry blossom aroma tangy acidity Layered seductive offer crisp mix orange peel cherry pomegranate baking spice flavor ready table cellar

description: Heitz has made this stellar rosé from the rare Grignolino grape since 1961. Ruby grapefruit-red, it's sultry with strawberry, watermelon, orange zest and salty spice flavor, highlighted with vibrant floral aromas.
Refined-description: Heitz made stellar rosé rare Grignolino grape since 1961 Ruby grapefruitred sultry strawberry watermelon orange zest salty spice flavor highlighted vibrant floral aroma

description: Alluring, complex and powerful aromas of grilled meat, berries, tea, smoke, vanilla and spice cover every base. An intense palate is concentrated but still elegant. Blackberry, molasses and mocha flavors finish with chocolaty oak notes, fine tannins and overall cohesion. Drink this special Rioja from 2020 through 2035.
Refined-description: Alluring complex powerful aroma grilled meat berry tea smoke vanilla spice cover every base An intense palate concentrated still elegant Blackberry molasses mocha flavor finish chocolaty oak note fine tannin overall cohesion Drink special Rioja 2020 2035

description: Tarry blackberry and cheesy oak aromas are appropriate for a wine of this size and magnitude. In the mouth, this Tinta de Toro is expansive and grabby, with bullish tannins. Slightly salty earthy accents come with core blackberry flavors and notes of baking spices and chocolate, while on the finish this is long, chocolaty, delicious and not too hard or tannic. Drink through 2023.
Refined-description: Tarry blackberry cheesy oak aroma appropriate wine size magnitude In mouth Tinta de Toro expansive grabby bullish tannin Slightly salty earthy accent come core blackberry flavor note baking spice chocolate finish long chocolaty delicious hard tannic Drink 2023

description: The apogee of this ambitious winery's white wine efforts, this bottling of just two barrels of Clone 5 shows focused marzipan, marcona almond and white peach notes on the nose. The palate sizzles with saltiness and a lemony acidity that cuts through its brown butter richness with finesse. The finish is luxurious and long.
Refined-description: The apogee ambitious winery white wine effort bottling two barrel Clone 5 show focused marzipan marcona almond white peach note nose The palate sizzle saltiness lemony acidity cut brown butter richness finesse The finish luxurious long

description: San Jose-based producer Adam Comartin heads 1,100 feet up into the mountains to source fruit for this tremendous wine, which offers wild cherry, sage, and eucalyptus scents on the nose. Ripe black plum and strawberry fruit lead the palate, followed by acid-driven waves of juniper, pine and bay leaf, finishing with a menthol-like sensation.
Refined-description: San Josebased producer Adam Comartin head 1100 foot mountain source fruit tremendous wine offer wild cherry sage eucalyptus scent nose Ripe black plum strawberry fruit lead palate followed aciddriven wave juniper pine bay leaf finishing menthollike sensation

description: Yields were down in 2015, but intensity is up, giving this medium-bodied, silky wine the potential to drink well through at least 2025. Hickory smoke outlines white peach before ending in a long flurry of lime zest.
Refined-description: Yields 2015 intensity giving mediumbodied silky wine potential drink well least 2025 Hickory smoke outline white peach ending long flurry lime zest

description: Bergström has made a Shea designate since 2003, intent on showcasing a “pretty” style of the vineyard. Here are lovely aromatics, with grape jelly, rose petals and plum in the nose, and a complex run of red fruits in the mouth. Streaks of cola, brown sugar and more come up in a generous finish.
Refined-description: Bergström made Shea designate since 2003 intent showcasing “ pretty ” style vineyard Here lovely aromatics grape jelly rose petal plum nose complex run red fruit mouth Streaks cola brown sugar come generous finish

description: Focused and dense, this intense wine captures the essence of ripe raspberries. Aged in 50% new French oak, it's got a strong vein of coffee and mocha. The flavors broaden out and penetrate, finishing with highlights of cedar, cinnamon and dark chocolate. Drink now through the 2020s, but decant if you want the full expression.
Refined-description: Focused dense intense wine capture essence ripe raspberry Aged 50 new French oak got strong vein coffee mocha The flavor broaden penetrate finishing highlight cedar cinnamon dark chocolate Drink 2020s decant want full expression

description: Cranberry, baked rhubarb, anise and crushed slate aromas show on the nose of this always-excellent bottling from the Franscioni family. The palate abounds with energy, driving black raspberry fruit accented with earthy loam, fennel, oregano and juniper through a compellingly round midpalate.
Refined-description: Cranberry baked rhubarb anise crushed slate aroma show nose alwaysexcellent bottling Franscioni family The palate abounds energy driving black raspberry fruit accented earthy loam fennel oregano juniper compellingly round midpalate

description: This standout Rocks District wine brings earth shaking aromas of black-olive brine, tapenade, green olive, stargazer lilies, orange peel and crushed gravel. The smoked meat, charcuterie and blue-fruit flavors don't hold back, bringing a lovely sense of texture and detail. It's an intense wine that completely demands your attention.
Refined-description: This standout Rocks District wine brings earth shaking aroma blackolive brine tapenade green olive stargazer lily orange peel crushed gravel The smoked meat charcuterie bluefruit flavor nt hold back bringing lovely sense texture detail It intense wine completely demand attention

description: This Bulgarian Mavrud presents the nose with suggestions of dried cherry, black plum, freshly ground black pepper and a whiff of eucalyptus. In the mouth it is balanced with soft tannins mingling with dried cherry, cassis and black plum.
Refined-description: This Bulgarian Mavrud present nose suggestion dried cherry black plum freshly ground black pepper whiff eucalyptus In mouth balanced soft tannin mingling dried cherry cassis black plum

description: Steely and perfumed, this wine sees only 20% new French oak, remaining vibrantly fresh. Baked apple and lemon pith veer into grapefruit on the palate, with spiciness to the finish that's both brash and loud.
Refined-description: Steely perfumed wine see 20 new French oak remaining vibrantly fresh Baked apple lemon pith veer grapefruit palate spiciness finish brash loud

description: Underbrush, scorched earth, menthol and plum steeped in spirits are some of the aromas that unfold on the glass. The big, chewy palate doles out ripe wild cherry, raspberry jam, ground pepper and licorice alongside firm, velvety tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the finish.
Refined-description: Underbrush scorched earth menthol plum steeped spirit aroma unfold glass The big chewy palate dole ripe wild cherry raspberry jam ground pepper licorice alongside firm velvety tannin You also detect warmth alcohol finish

description: Pale in color, this is nutty in character, with a warm and rounded hint of red fruits. The wine has a soft, while still fresh, aftertaste. It is aged in cellars in Saumur on the Loire river.
Refined-description: Pale color nutty character warm rounded hint red fruit The wine soft still fresh aftertaste It aged cellar Saumur Loire river

description: The aromas entice with notes of wet stone, honeysuckle, chamomile and stone fruit. The palate is generous in flavor and feel, showing a fine sense of balance.
Refined-description: The aroma entice note wet stone honeysuckle chamomile stone fruit The palate generous flavor feel showing fine sense balance

description: Forest floor, tilled soil, mature berry and a whiff of new leather combine on this. The ripe palate offers fleshy black cherry, dried aromatic herb and tobacco, while fine-grained tannins give the finish some grip. Drink 2018–2023.
Refined-description: Forest floor tilled soil mature berry whiff new leather combine The ripe palate offer fleshy black cherry dried aromatic herb tobacco finegrained tannin give finish grip Drink 2018–2023

description: Gingery spice notes accent fresh pear and melon fruit in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It's round on the palate but not flabby, with a warm, spicy finish. Drink now.
Refined-description: Gingery spice note accent fresh pear melon fruit medium fullbodied wine It round palate flabby warm spicy finish Drink

description: Aromas of forest floor, violet, red berry and a whiff of dark baking spice unfold in the glass while wild cherry, black raspberry, ground pepper and star anise drive the palate. Framed in firm, fine-grained tannins, this is a classic Tuscan red. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: Aromas forest floor violet red berry whiff dark baking spice unfold glass wild cherry black raspberry ground pepper star anise drive palate Framed firm finegrained tannin classic Tuscan red Drink 2020

description: This has a charming nose that boasts rose, violet and red berry while the juicy, easy-drinking palate offers ripe wild cherry, chopped mint, white pepper and a hint of star anise. There isn't much complexity but it is savory and balanced, with fresh acidity and supple tannins.
Refined-description: This charming nose boast rose violet red berry juicy easydrinking palate offer ripe wild cherry chopped mint white pepper hint star anise There nt much complexity savory balanced fresh acidity supple tannin

description: This bright, savory wine delivers aromas and flavors of juicy wild cherry, black raspberry, violet, white pepper and mocha. Polished tannins provide the framework. Enjoy through 2020.
Refined-description: This bright savory wine delivers aroma flavor juicy wild cherry black raspberry violet white pepper mocha Polished tannin provide framework Enjoy 2020

description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas score points for being clear and direct. The palate on this varietal Mencía is round, smooth and just right. Lightly briny, earthy plum and cherry flavors hold steady on the finish, with a dash of saltiness.
Refined-description: Earthy plum cherry aroma score point clear direct The palate varietal Mencía round smooth right Lightly briny earthy plum cherry flavor hold steady finish dash saltiness

description: This comes across wide and expansive as it lazily exudes oily aromas of hazelnut and toffee. A plump palate is not overly cutting or demanding, while flavors of lightly salted nuts and buttered toast end with toffee and peanut flavors.
Refined-description: This come across wide expansive lazily exudes oily aroma hazelnut toffee A plump palate overly cutting demanding flavor lightly salted nut buttered toast end toffee peanut flavor

description: This is an aromatic brooder with aromas of scorched earth, plum, dried flowers and green herbs. It's full in feel with dense, dark-fruit flavors, tightly coiled tannins and tart acids—a pleasing example of the variety.
Refined-description: This aromatic brooder aroma scorched earth plum dried flower green herb It full feel dense darkfruit flavor tightly coiled tannin tart acids—a pleasing example variety

description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, rose and wild herb lead the nose. The round, juicy palate doles out ripe black cherry, fleshy raspberry, white pepper and clove while polished tannins provide a smooth, velvety framework. Enjoy through 2019.
Refined-description: Aromas darkskinned berry rose wild herb lead nose The round juicy palate dole ripe black cherry fleshy raspberry white pepper clove polished tannin provide smooth velvety framework Enjoy 2019

description: Dark in color and in flavor profile, this medium-bodied Cornas boasts aromas and flavors reminiscent of chocolate fudge, espresso and plummy fruit, all framed by soft, dusty tannins. Drink now–2025.
Refined-description: Dark color flavor profile mediumbodied Cornas boast aroma flavor reminiscent chocolate fudge espresso plummy fruit framed soft dusty tannin Drink now–2025

description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of violet, mature plum, espresso and a whiff of forest floor. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper, toast and clove while packed, fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: A blend 90 Sangiovese 10 Canaiolo open aroma violet mature plum espresso whiff forest floor The firm palate offer dried black cherry ground pepper toast clove packed finegrained tannin provide support Drink 2020

description: Sunbaked earth, ripe berry, baking spice and a whiff of menthol meld in the glass. The juicy palate offers red cherry, pomegranate, star anise, mocha and a hint of tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins.
Refined-description: Sunbaked earth ripe berry baking spice whiff menthol meld glass The juicy palate offer red cherry pomegranate star anise mocha hint tobacco alongside finegrained tannin

description: Blended with 9% Malbec, 9% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, this is a perennial classic for the winery, the sister brand of Cuvaison. Juicy in cherry and cassis, it sustains big, pillowy tannins and tar, suggesting more time for the fruit to match up with the structure. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: Blended 9 Malbec 9 Cabernet Franc 5 Petit Verdot perennial classic winery sister brand Cuvaison Juicy cherry cassis sustains big pillowy tannin tar suggesting time fruit match structure Drink 2020

description: Ripe dark-skinned berry, forest floor and cooking spice aromas lead the nose along with a whiff of new leather. The chewy palate offers fleshy black cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and a hint of tobacco while polished tannins provide the framework. This is already accessible so no need to cellar it for years. Best through 2021.
Refined-description: Ripe darkskinned berry forest floor cooking spice aroma lead nose along whiff new leather The chewy palate offer fleshy black cherry cinnamon vanilla hint tobacco polished tannin provide framework This already accessible need cellar year Best 2021

description: The aromas of blue fruit, herbs and spice are initially under tight restraint. The flavors are full, with the tannins simultaneously firm and fine grained. It shows good length.
Refined-description: The aroma blue fruit herb spice initially tight restraint The flavor full tannin simultaneously firm fine grained It show good length

description: This robust red opens with aromas of espresso, plum cake, toast and dark spice. The hearty palate offers blackberry jam, licorice, vanilla and mocha alongside firm fine-grained tannins. A coffee note closes the finish.
Refined-description: This robust red open aroma espresso plum cake toast dark spice The hearty palate offer blackberry jam licorice vanilla mocha alongside firm finegrained tannin A coffee note close finish

description: This structured, complex Chardonnay is packed with minerality and considerable weight. The tight texture and almost tannic character will soften over the next few months. Full of potential, it's drinkable now but will be so much better from 2017.
Refined-description: This structured complex Chardonnay packed minerality considerable weight The tight texture almost tannic character soften next month Full potential drinkable much better 2017

description: This ripe, full-bodied wine has ripe green fruits that are lifted by lime and made richer by apricot. Still young, with a concentrated structure, it's going to develop into a full, beautifully fruity wine. The name of the wine means the size of a parcel that demands the work of seven men for a day. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: This ripe fullbodied wine ripe green fruit lifted lime made richer apricot Still young concentrated structure going develop full beautifully fruity wine The name wine mean size parcel demand work seven men day Drink 2017

description: With its light color and cool feel, this well-balanced wine comes from a parcel of 30-year-old vines. The smoky tannins and intense acidity give a wine that will develop well and slowly. It's still young with its red-berry fruits and fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: With light color cool feel wellbalanced wine come parcel 30yearold vine The smoky tannin intense acidity give wine develop well slowly It still young redberry fruit fresh aftertaste Drink 2018

description: There's a lot to like in this nicely priced white, a blend of several regional vineyards. A taste of hazelnut expands on the palate to meet creamy Tahitian vanilla. Approachably round, this crowd-pleasing wine finishes in measured, integrated oak.
Refined-description: There lot like nicely priced white blend several regional vineyard A taste hazelnut expands palate meet creamy Tahitian vanilla Approachably round crowdpleasing wine finish measured integrated oak

description: A blend of Cabernet from Grand Ciel (31%), Ciel du Cheval (30%), Upchurch (28%) and Klipsun (11%) vineyards, wood spice aromas start out up front. The cherry flavors are light and elegant, with the tannins bringing some grip.
Refined-description: A blend Cabernet Grand Ciel 31 Ciel du Cheval 30 Upchurch 28 Klipsun 11 vineyard wood spice aroma start front The cherry flavor light elegant tannin bringing grip

description: Delicious while also young and textured, this wine comes from biodynamically grown grapes. It has a strong sense of minerality as well as intense citrus and green fruits. It's tight at the moment and needs to round out, so drink from 2018.
Refined-description: Delicious also young textured wine come biodynamically grown grape It strong sense minerality well intense citrus green fruit It tight moment need round drink 2018

description: While exuberantly fruity, almost tropical on the nose, there's a crystalline edge to this dry Riesling that renders it especially refreshing. It's vibrant and light footed, brightened by a lingering honey note on the finish.
Refined-description: While exuberantly fruity almost tropical nose crystalline edge dry Riesling render especially refreshing It vibrant light footed brightened lingering honey note finish

description: Cabernet makes up just over half of this blend. Aromas of black cherries, herbs and minerals are followed by plush-feeling dark-fruit flavors and backed by firm tannins. Drink now.
Refined-description: Cabernet make half blend Aromas black cherry herb mineral followed plushfeeling darkfruit flavor backed firm tannin Drink

description: This savory blend of 40% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 5% Syrah opens with aromas of roasted coffee bean, leather, tobacco and dark woodland berry. The chewy palate offers juicy plum, cassis and clove alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2019.
Refined-description: This savory blend 40 Merlot 30 Cabernet Sauvignon 25 Cabernet Franc 5 Syrah open aroma roasted coffee bean leather tobacco dark woodland berry The chewy palate offer juicy plum cassis clove alongside polished tannin Drink 2019

description: Concentrated, ripe blackberry and cassis aromas come with peppery spice and cedary oak notes. This is big and generous on the palate, with roasted, well-oaked blackberry flavors. A touch of heat lends sizzle to the finish. Drink through 2020.
designation: The Apple Doesn't Fall Far From The Tree
Refined-description: Concentrated ripe blackberry cassis aroma come peppery spice cedary oak note This big generous palate roasted welloaked blackberry flavor A touch heat lends sizzle finish Drink 2020

description: Moorooduc's estate Pinot Noir is a solid value among the boutique offerings from the Mornington Peninsula. There's a supple cushioning of flesh wrapped around a firm backbone of acid, while the flavors run from black cherry and mint through earthier notes of brown sugar and roasted parsnip. Drink now through 2020.
Refined-description: Moorooduc estate Pinot Noir solid value among boutique offering Mornington Peninsula There supple cushioning flesh wrapped around firm backbone acid flavor run black cherry mint earthier note brown sugar roasted parsnip Drink 2020

description: Smoky aromas of fresh-cut wood blend with berry and cassis form a welcoming, generous bouquet. This feels lively on the palate, albeit tartaric. Oaky plum, cassis and vanilla flavors finish full and agreeable. Drink through 2019.
Refined-description: Smoky aroma freshcut wood blend berry cassis form welcoming generous bouquet This feel lively palate albeit tartaric Oaky plum cassis vanilla flavor finish full agreeable Drink 2019

description: L'Homme Mort is a northern extension of the Fourchaume Premier Cru vineyard, so called because this was where a local lord dispensed justice by death. It often produces cooler wines such as this. It is tight, with toasted bread hints and with a strongly tangy character. It does need to develop and shouldn't be drunk before 2018.
Refined-description: LHomme Mort northern extension Fourchaume Premier Cru vineyard called local lord dispensed justice death It often produce cooler wine It tight toasted bread hint strongly tangy character It need develop nt drunk 2018

description: This is a super-ripe, still very young wine. It's showing all its concentrated fruits, wood aging flavors and dense texture as well as the firm tannins that will allow it to age. With its combination of black plum skin, blackberry and dark concentration, leave the wine until 2018.
Refined-description: This superripe still young wine It showing concentrated fruit wood aging flavor dense texture well firm tannin allow age With combination black plum skin blackberry dark concentration leave wine 2018

description: Fresh boysenberries and a blueberry sorbet character mix with notes of minty tarragon, dill and hot gravel on the nose of this wine, from an area between Gilroy and Morgan Hill. Peppercorns are prominent on the relatively light palate, along with tobacco, espresso and boysenberry.
Refined-description: Fresh boysenberry blueberry sorbet character mix note minty tarragon dill hot gravel nose wine area Gilroy Morgan Hill Peppercorns prominent relatively light palate along tobacco espresso boysenberry

description: The steely character of a young Chablis is very apparent in this wine. It is crisp, lemon flavored and with a mineral edge. The wine has a juicy freshness, still young at heart and needing to age. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: The steely character young Chablis apparent wine It crisp lemon flavored mineral edge The wine juicy freshness still young heart needing age Drink 2018

description: From the producer's monumental Atlas Peak vineyard, this is a tightly wound, solidly constructed mountain Cab, blended with a handful of Petit Verdot. Tobacco, black tea and a sliver of coconut intermingle around a medium-bodied whole that will benefit from cellaring, through 2021.
Refined-description: From producer monumental Atlas Peak vineyard tightly wound solidly constructed mountain Cab blended handful Petit Verdot Tobacco black tea sliver coconut intermingle around mediumbodied whole benefit cellaring 2021

Best after 2020.

It shines in moderate acidity and tropical flair.

Cool climate Albariño has much promise in the state.
