description: Red-cherry and strawberry aromas meld with rich fruit and warm baking-spice flavors to make this full-bodied wine hard to resist. The style is in the ripe, pastry shop mode, and soft tannins and acidity complete the picture.
Refined-description: Redcherry strawberry aroma meld rich fruit warm bakingspice flavor make fullbodied wine hard resist The style ripe pastry shop mode soft tannin acidity complete picture

description: This is an exuberantly fruity, spicy and robust wine, speckled with 2% Petite Sirah. Dark and full of red berry flavor, the palate is dusted in brown sugar and black pepper. Ripe and concentrated, it drinks smooth and elegant despite its serious power.
Refined-description: This exuberantly fruity spicy robust wine speckled 2 Petite Sirah Dark full red berry flavor palate dusted brown sugar black pepper Ripe concentrated drink smooth elegant despite serious power

description: Aromas of white flowers, stone fruits and lees are typical of well-made Albariño. A juicy, elegant palate with a mix of citrus and stone-fruit flavors is lasting, with a hint of pithy character coming up on the finish.
Refined-description: Aromas white flower stone fruit lee typical wellmade Albariño A juicy elegant palate mix citrus stonefruit flavor lasting hint pithy character coming finish

description: Quite vibrant and floral on the nose, this shows deep blackberry and both dried and fresh purple-flower elements as well as a baked berry pastry. The flavors are well integrated on the palate, where cooked blackberries in a vanilla pie crust combine with juicy strawberry, peppercorns and rosemary spice.
Refined-description: Quite vibrant floral nose show deep blackberry dried fresh purpleflower element well baked berry pastry The flavor well integrated palate cooked blackberry vanilla pie crust combine juicy strawberry peppercorn rosemary spice

description: This most intriguing white grape, which the Larners grow as an ode to their Italian past, shows a sweet nose with a bone dry palate. Sugary citrus scents of orange blossoms and peach syrup give way to a brisk palate full of honeysuckle, night jasmine and a nearly pine needle bitterness that cuts dynamically through it all.
Refined-description: This intriguing white grape Larners grow ode Italian past show sweet nose bone dry palate Sugary citrus scent orange blossom peach syrup give way brisk palate full honeysuckle night jasmine nearly pine needle bitterness cut dynamically

description: Reflecting the vintage, this Pinot is light and lithe in style. It shows tart cherry fruit and suggestions of chocolate, with bright acidity and a thin finish.
Refined-description: Reflecting vintage Pinot light lithe style It show tart cherry fruit suggestion chocolate bright acidity thin finish

description: This wine is a conversation starter, with its nose of mandarin orange, lemon peel and vanilla. On the palate, white flowers, citrus and lush tropical fruits mingle well. Pair with salmon and poultry.
Refined-description: This wine conversation starter nose mandarin orange lemon peel vanilla On palate white flower citrus lush tropical fruit mingle well Pair salmon poultry

description: Dusty, leesy aromas of apple and vanilla are sturdy. This brut Cava is fresh and modestly elegant on the palate, with lime, apple and tarragon flavors. A dry, confident finish offers apple and citrus flavors and a sense of ease.
Refined-description: Dusty leesy aroma apple vanilla sturdy This brut Cava fresh modestly elegant palate lime apple tarragon flavor A dry confident finish offer apple citrus flavor sense ease

description: Bright aromas of citrus and tropical fruit give this easygoing white an easy appeal. Balanced and fresh, it's an elegant wine that will pair well with grilled fish and salads.
Refined-description: Bright aroma citrus tropical fruit give easygoing white easy appeal Balanced fresh elegant wine pair well grilled fish salad

description: Peach, pear and lemon on the nose start this cheerful white from Alpha Estate. On the palate, it offers some complexity of exotic fruit and with a vein of acidity. Soft overall in profile, this wine is easygoing and enjoyable.
Refined-description: Peach pear lemon nose start cheerful white Alpha Estate On palate offer complexity exotic fruit vein acidity Soft overall profile wine easygoing enjoyable

description: Lightly herbal, horsey aromas of blueberry, black plum and cardamom are ripe by Carmenère standards. Hailing from a hot vintage, this is a bit flabby in feel, with soft tannins. Chunky plum and blackberry flavors finish with notes of licorice and mint along with a chewy, syrupy feel.
designation: Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate
Refined-description: Lightly herbal horsey aroma blueberry black plum cardamom ripe Carmenère standard Hailing hot vintage bit flabby feel soft tannin Chunky plum blackberry flavor finish note licorice mint along chewy syrupy feel

description: This well-balanced, fruity wine allows space for some solid dry tannins that also show wood aging. Berry fruits shine through the structure to give a juicy character that is underlined by the fresh acidity at the end.
Refined-description: This wellbalanced fruity wine allows space solid dry tannin also show wood aging Berry fruit shine structure give juicy character underlined fresh acidity end

description: In this fruit-forward vintage, it's not surprising to find that what shines here are the bright, spicy and tart flavors of strawberries, raspberries and cherries. The Sangiovese was co-fermented with 7% Syrah, and aged in 30% new American oak. As the wine breathes open the flavors of oak and char come up, and the tannins show some extra grip.
Refined-description: In fruitforward vintage surprising find shine bright spicy tart flavor strawberry raspberry cherry The Sangiovese cofermented 7 Syrah aged 30 new American oak As wine breathes open flavor oak char come tannin show extra grip

description: Aromas of leather, roast plum and compost are challenging and not immediately inviting. In the mouth, this shows rubbery tannins and juicy acidity. Saucy, herbal plum and currant flavors ride on a beam of acidity toward an earthy, tomatoey finish with a lightly leafy aftertaste.
Refined-description: Aromas leather roast plum compost challenging immediately inviting In mouth show rubbery tannin juicy acidity Saucy herbal plum currant flavor ride beam acidity toward earthy tomatoey finish lightly leafy aftertaste

description: Staunch berry, cassis and spice aromas are friendly and congruent. This Malbec-led blend is jammy in feel, a bit hollow in the middle, and easy to like as a whole. Blackberry and blueberry flavors finish fleshy, with soft tannins.
Refined-description: Staunch berry cassis spice aroma friendly congruent This Malbecled blend jammy feel bit hollow middle easy like whole Blackberry blueberry flavor finish fleshy soft tannin

description: Winemaker Billy Wathen blends 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Franc into this blend that's named after the U.S. Geologic Survey's name for Happy Canyon. A nose of dried oregano and thyme has a Bing cherry backdrop, with a palate of green peppers, blackberries and tomato leaf.
Refined-description: Winemaker Billy Wathen blend 60 Merlot 40 Cabernet Franc blend named US Geologic Survey name Happy Canyon A nose dried oregano thyme Bing cherry backdrop palate green pepper blackberry tomato leaf

description: A blend of fruit from three Rogue Valley sites, this is a fine example of the style of Pinot made in Southern Oregon. The estate vineyard sits at 2,100 feet on a steep, east-facing slope, with densely planted vines. It's a big, blocky, full-bodied wine, loaded with flavors of black cherry, black coffee and barrel toast. Tannins are substantial, but the flavors are full and forward. What it lacks in elegance it makes up for in immediate likeability.
Refined-description: A blend fruit three Rogue Valley site fine example style Pinot made Southern Oregon The estate vineyard sits 2100 foot steep eastfacing slope densely planted vine It big blocky fullbodied wine loaded flavor black cherry black coffee barrel toast Tannins substantial flavor full forward What lack elegance make immediate likeability

description: Dense, tarry aromas of asphalt and rubbery boysenberry are hefty but also a bit flat. This has a tannic mouthfeel to go with blackberry, prune and raisin flavors. Toast, bitter chocolate and full-bodied weight push the finish on this oaky, ripe Rioja. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: Dense tarry aroma asphalt rubbery boysenberry hefty also bit flat This tannic mouthfeel go blackberry prune raisin flavor Toast bitter chocolate fullbodied weight push finish oaky ripe Rioja Drink 2020

description: This medium-bodied wine shows an array of smoky, meaty aromas, along with ripe plum and tart blackberry flavors. Not at all overripe, but made with some restraint, it allows savory flavors like tarragon and anise to peek through. The blend includes 9% Cabernet Sauvignon.
Refined-description: This mediumbodied wine show array smoky meaty aroma along ripe plum tart blackberry flavor Not overripe made restraint allows savory flavor like tarragon anise peek The blend includes 9 Cabernet Sauvignon

description: The grape's usual peachy aromas show on this wine from regional pioneer Gary Eberle, along with lemon juice, honey and a touch of minerality. There is a nice mineral-driven tension on the palate, with flavors of apple and pear cider. It's a solid, down-the-middle take on the grape—not too ripe, not too thin.
Refined-description: The grape usual peachy aroma show wine regional pioneer Gary Eberle along lemon juice honey touch minerality There nice mineraldriven tension palate flavor apple pear cider It solid downthemiddle take grape—not ripe thin

description: Tightly focused, as is often true of single-vineyard bottlings, this matches spicy berry fruit to light barrel flavors of milk chocolate. It's smooth and accessible, but finishes a bit short.
Refined-description: Tightly focused often true singlevineyard bottlings match spicy berry fruit light barrel flavor milk chocolate It smooth accessible finish bit short

description: Crushed plum, espresso, tobacco and cedar aromas unfold in the glass. A blend of 90% Merlot and 10% Alicante, the straightforward palate offers blackberries, red currants, clove and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins.
Refined-description: Crushed plum espresso tobacco cedar aroma unfold glass A blend 90 Merlot 10 Alicante straightforward palate offer blackberry red currant clove licorice alongside finegrained tannin

description: Aromas of wild berries, violets and a whiff of spice lead the nose on this blend of Sangiovese and 15% Merlot. The savory, easygoing palate offers mature black cherry, clove and black pepper alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2016.
Refined-description: Aromas wild berry violet whiff spice lead nose blend Sangiovese 15 Merlot The savory easygoing palate offer mature black cherry clove black pepper alongside lithe tannin Drink 2016

description: Structured and firm, this is a dry wine with the potential of fine fruit in the future. Acidity cuts through the texture promising the freshness of black currants and berries. It's a perfumed wine that can still age. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: Structured firm dry wine potential fine fruit future Acidity cut texture promising freshness black currant berry It perfumed wine still age Drink 2016

description: This has a light yellow color with a touch of green and a subtle smell of crisp green apples. Flavors that are richer than expected, like poached pears, butter and fig. The texture is rich, the body full and the ripe flavors linger on the finish.
Refined-description: This light yellow color touch green subtle smell crisp green apple Flavors richer expected like poached pear butter fig The texture rich body full ripe flavor linger finish

description: Rhubarb, cola and pencil shavings emerge from the glass on this appellation blend from the longtime Santa Rosa Road winery, today owned by the Terlato family. Deeply earthy aromas of beet juice, root beer and dried berries arise on the palate, showing the region's typical blend of soil minerality and dark fruit.
Refined-description: Rhubarb cola pencil shaving emerge glass appellation blend longtime Santa Rosa Road winery today owned Terlato family Deeply earthy aroma beet juice root beer dried berry arise palate showing region typical blend soil minerality dark fruit

description: Dark, charred, lemony aromas of graphite, licorice and blackberry are horsey and baked. This blend of 85% Cab Sauv and 15% Cab Franc has an intense, blocky, pinching palate and heavy flavors of black fruits, resiny oak, spice and salt. A woody, tannic, raw feel to the finish creates a bumpy landing. Drink through 2021.
Refined-description: Dark charred lemony aroma graphite licorice blackberry horsey baked This blend 85 Cab Sauv 15 Cab Franc intense blocky pinching palate heavy flavor black fruit resiny oak spice salt A woody tannic raw feel finish creates bumpy landing Drink 2021

description: Aromas of leather, cherry and plum lead this balanced red from Boutari. Ripe cherry, cedar and cinnamon flavors carry the palate, with soft tannins giving a sultry feel.
Refined-description: Aromas leather cherry plum lead balanced red Boutari Ripe cherry cedar cinnamon flavor carry palate soft tannin giving sultry feel

description: Made from what Californians call the Pommard clone, this has a light, traditional garnet color. Fresh and lively fruit aromas resemble cranberries and red cherries, followed by tangy fruit and cinnamon flavors of medium intensity, supported by firm acidity and moderate tannins.
Refined-description: Made Californians call Pommard clone light traditional garnet color Fresh lively fruit aroma resemble cranberry red cherry followed tangy fruit cinnamon flavor medium intensity supported firm acidity moderate tannin

description: This is aged in oak, but the vessels are large casks, or foudres, so the impact isn't that noticeable. The wine is meaty and savory on the nose, but the palate shows more herb-garrigue flavors and superripe cherry fruit. Drink now–2017.
designation: Héritages Elevé en Foudres de Chêne
Refined-description: This aged oak vessel large cask foudres impact nt noticeable The wine meaty savory nose palate show herbgarrigue flavor superripe cherry fruit Drink now–2017

description: Pleasant red-fruit aromas of cherry and raspberry are low in octane for Toro. A fresh but not overly dense palate is lively and vital, with wild berry, plum and brown sugar flavors. A warm, heady, generous finish is fruity and bright. Drink through 2018.
Refined-description: Pleasant redfruit aroma cherry raspberry low octane Toro A fresh overly dense palate lively vital wild berry plum brown sugar flavor A warm heady generous finish fruity bright Drink 2018

description: Here's a sleek Sangiovese that opens with scents of toasted oak, vanilla, blue flowers and mature plum. The round palate is already accessible, serving up sweet black cherry, black raspberry, licorice and mint framed in assertive but fine-grained tannins.
Refined-description: Here sleek Sangiovese open scent toasted oak vanilla blue flower mature plum The round palate already accessible serving sweet black cherry black raspberry licorice mint framed assertive finegrained tannin

description: A robust blend of 70% Sangiovese and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers aromas of baked plum, mocha, menthol and oak-driven spice. The hearty palate initially opens with black fruit, chocolate, licorice and dried herb flavors but the heat of evident alcohol dominates the finish and the close.
Refined-description: A robust blend 70 Sangiovese 30 Cabernet Sauvignon offer aroma baked plum mocha menthol oakdriven spice The hearty palate initially open black fruit chocolate licorice dried herb flavor heat evident alcohol dominates finish close

description: Juicy and soft in blackberry and black cherry, this wine is nicely resolved in terms of tannin and oak structure,. These provide weight on the back palate, with enough heightened acidity on the finish to stay on balance. Strawberry and dried herb close things out.
Refined-description: Juicy soft blackberry black cherry wine nicely resolved term tannin oak structure These provide weight back palate enough heightened acidity finish stay balance Strawberry dried herb close thing

description: Aromas of latex, tire rubber, spice, cured meat and berry fruits are rugged and require patience to sift through. This Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend is big and grabby, but not precise, with loud, herbal, muscular flavors of stewed plum, licorice and peppercorn.
Refined-description: Aromas latex tire rubber spice cured meat berry fruit rugged require patience sift This Cabernet Sauvignonled blend big grabby precise loud herbal muscular flavor stewed plum licorice peppercorn

description: Focused streaks of high-acidity lemon and a low oak profile combine for a refreshing take on Chardonnay, the other components coming together in swathes of fennel and brine. The wine finishes with a hit of power.
Refined-description: Focused streak highacidity lemon low oak profile combine refreshing take Chardonnay component coming together swathe fennel brine The wine finish hit power

description: Oak aromas takes center stage with this wine by the Riboli family, with black cherry extract and a nearly Bourbon-barrel character on the nose. The rich, deep red fruit carries to the palate, which gains complexity from licorice and a tiny bit of tar.
Refined-description: Oak aroma take center stage wine Riboli family black cherry extract nearly Bourbonbarrel character nose The rich deep red fruit carry palate gain complexity licorice tiny bit tar

description: Super earthy, in the classic damp forest-floor way, this also offers hints of menthol, eucalyptus and tomato leaf. The wine begins light bodied, but builds up power and weight as it goes. Layered with black cherry and plum, it's dark and savory.
Refined-description: Super earthy classic damp forestfloor way also offer hint menthol eucalyptus tomato leaf The wine begin light bodied build power weight go Layered black cherry plum dark savory

description: Stainless-steel fermented and aged, this 100% varietal wine suggests kumquat, talc and wet stone. The flavor concentration is light with taut acidity the focus. It needs food; pair it with shellfish to see it shine.
Refined-description: Stainlesssteel fermented aged 100 varietal wine suggests kumquat talc wet stone The flavor concentration light taut acidity focus It need food pair shellfish see shine

description: Dark, minty, inky aromas of blackberry are rugged. Same for the palate, which is pinched and rubbery, with grabby tannins. Flavors of toasted, blackened berry fruits are chocolaty and well oaked. Raw heat and minty, coffee flavors rev up the finish on this Malbec-led blend.
Refined-description: Dark minty inky aroma blackberry rugged Same palate pinched rubbery grabby tannin Flavors toasted blackened berry fruit chocolaty well oaked Raw heat minty coffee flavor rev finish Malbecled blend

description: Merlot (57%) takes the lead on this lighter-colored wine that offers raspberries, cherries, herbs and woodspice. The fruit flavors are fresh and elegant, with lightly chalky tannins.
Refined-description: Merlot 57 take lead lightercolored wine offer raspberry cherry herb woodspice The fruit flavor fresh elegant lightly chalky tannin

description: This is a lush and powerful wine from a vineyard in the recently designated Paso Highlands district. Aromas suggest gingerbread topped with kirsch-soaked, chocolate-covered cherries. The palate is thick and heavy, with mocha, stewed plums, mashed cherries and black earth, which gain complexity from tannins and pencil lead.
Refined-description: This lush powerful wine vineyard recently designated Paso Highlands district Aromas suggest gingerbread topped kirschsoaked chocolatecovered cherry The palate thick heavy mocha stewed plum mashed cherry black earth gain complexity tannin pencil lead

description: Hailing from the recently designated Paso Highlands subappellation, this hearty wine shows earthy aromas of nutmeg, iron, hot rocks, loam and cherry extract. It's lush and ripe with cassis and black cherry fruit, yet shows a more elegant chalkiness on the palate as well, rounded out by cocoa powder.
Refined-description: Hailing recently designated Paso Highlands subappellation hearty wine show earthy aroma nutmeg iron hot rock loam cherry extract It lush ripe cassis black cherry fruit yet show elegant chalkiness palate well rounded cocoa powder

description: Apple, nectarine, lees and briny aromas steer this Godello toward a round, full palate. Slightly bitter flavors of melon and peach finish much like the wine starts—briny and leesy. This is also pithy tasting, like the inside of a grapefruit peel.
Refined-description: Apple nectarine lee briny aroma steer Godello toward round full palate Slightly bitter flavor melon peach finish much like wine starts—briny leesy This also pithy tasting like inside grapefruit peel

description: Coffee grinds, raisin and baked aromas suggest overripeness. This is heavy, broad and a bit clumsy on the palate. Berry and prune flavors are solid but not overly fresh, while the finish is full and raisiny as it improves over time.
Refined-description: Coffee grind raisin baked aroma suggest overripeness This heavy broad bit clumsy palate Berry prune flavor solid overly fresh finish full raisiny improves time

description: Dark-berry aromas are crisp and show a note of minerality as well as barrel char. This is firm, juicy and modest in structure, with flavors of blackberry and cassis touched up by some oak. A non-pushy finish with a hint of mocha is a good close.
Refined-description: Darkberry aroma crisp show note minerality well barrel char This firm juicy modest structure flavor blackberry cassis touched oak A nonpushy finish hint mocha good close

description: Bright fruit is allied to a more mineral structure to give a wine that shows the freshness of the vintage plus a more long-term view. It is cool with red fruits and some firm tannins that act as a background. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Bright fruit allied mineral structure give wine show freshness vintage plus longterm view It cool red fruit firm tannin act background Drink 2017

description: Owned by the Cruse family, one of the Bordeaux wine aristocracy, this rich wine is dominated by Merlot, giving it ample weight. The 18 months of wood aging shows in the smoky edge to the wine, although this will soften. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Owned Cruse family one Bordeaux wine aristocracy rich wine dominated Merlot giving ample weight The 18 month wood aging show smoky edge wine although soften Drink 2017

description: The smoky aroma and toasty wood character smothers the fruit. It is a tough wine at this stage although it does hint at some of the 2012 juicy fruit flavors. Drink this firm, solid wine from 2018.
Refined-description: The smoky aroma toasty wood character smother fruit It tough wine stage although hint 2012 juicy fruit flavor Drink firm solid wine 2018

description: Intensely tannic, this structured wine has layers of wood aging, along with juicy fruits and bright acidity. There's a strongly smoky element, the wine's fruitiness balanced by a dark, toasty aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: Intensely tannic structured wine layer wood aging along juicy fruit bright acidity There strongly smoky element wine fruitiness balanced dark toasty aftertaste Drink 2018

description: This is a smoky, obviously wood-aged wine. The burnt toast character is still dominant, waiting for the attractive black currant fruits to catch up. It will develop into a bright, fruity wine, so wait until 2017.
Refined-description: This smoky obviously woodaged wine The burnt toast character still dominant waiting attractive black currant fruit catch It develop bright fruity wine wait 2017

description: A creamy, buttery texture wraps around a core of bright lemon and apple flavors. This is balanced slightly toward sweetness as the luxurious viscosity carries the vivid flavors into the finish.
Refined-description: A creamy buttery texture wrap around core bright lemon apple flavor This balanced slightly toward sweetness luxurious viscosity carry vivid flavor finish

description: This saignée-style wine is pale salmon in color, showing some bricking. It drinks dry with rounded suggestions of cherry and watermelon providing easy-drinking enjoyment.
Refined-description: This saignéestyle wine pale salmon color showing bricking It drink dry rounded suggestion cherry watermelon providing easydrinking enjoyment

description: Zesty and mineral, this unoaked, citrusy Chardonnay would make a particularly refreshing apéritif. Flavors of Asian pear and quince are crisp and cutting on the palate. Enjoy now for it's vivacious style.
Refined-description: Zesty mineral unoaked citrusy Chardonnay would make particularly refreshing apéritif Flavors Asian pear quince crisp cutting palate Enjoy vivacious style

description: Smoke and violet perfume are seductive on this elegant off-dry Riesling. Fresh green apple and pear flavors are tart but concentrated, wrapping up tightly with a squeaky-clean, lemon-lime finish.
Refined-description: Smoke violet perfume seductive elegant offdry Riesling Fresh green apple pear flavor tart concentrated wrapping tightly squeakyclean lemonlime finish

description: Intense notes of crushed stone and slate permeate this stately off-dry Riesling. Pert lemon and tangerine flavors are zippy and fresh, but the wine is more a showcase for its brisk, stony style.
Refined-description: Intense note crushed stone slate permeate stately offdry Riesling Pert lemon tangerine flavor zippy fresh wine showcase brisk stony style

description: Figs and spice perfume this tawny Cabernet Franc ice wine. It's a bit rustic in style, evoking layers of fallen leaves and potpourri melding with dusty raisins and figs. But it's elegantly crisp and the exotic, uniquely spicy character is seductive.
Refined-description: Figs spice perfume tawny Cabernet Franc ice wine It bit rustic style evoking layer fallen leaf potpourri melding dusty raisin fig But elegantly crisp exotic uniquely spicy character seductive

description: This ripe, now soft wine has gentle red fruits and soft acidity. It's ready to drink with its rich texture and smooth structure. The end is rounded, only just hinting at tannins.
Refined-description: This ripe soft wine gentle red fruit soft acidity It ready drink rich texture smooth structure The end rounded hinting tannin

description: Owned by the same family as Château Talbot in Saint-Julien, this vintage of Sénéjac is now mature, showing signs of leather and a firm structure rather than fruit. It's unlikely to develop further, so drink now.
Refined-description: Owned family Château Talbot SaintJulien vintage Sénéjac mature showing sign leather firm structure rather fruit It unlikely develop drink

description: This is an aromatic wine with notes of rose water, pear and white flowers. It drinks medium sweet with abundant spice flavors throughout. Pair with spicy Thai dishes.
Refined-description: This aromatic wine note rose water pear white flower It drink medium sweet abundant spice flavor throughout Pair spicy Thai dish

description: The aromas of this wine suggest plum, herb and pencil eraser. It's full flavored with dark blue fruit and chalky, dry tannins. An affordable and approachable wine best enjoyed now.
Refined-description: The aroma wine suggest plum herb pencil eraser It full flavored dark blue fruit chalky dry tannin An affordable approachable wine best enjoyed

description: Though just four years old, this wine seems advanced with notes of dried cherry, vanilla, dried tobacco and blackberry. The dried cranberry and cherry flavors are rich and tart, backed by quite astringent tannins.
Refined-description: Though four year old wine seems advanced note dried cherry vanilla dried tobacco blackberry The dried cranberry cherry flavor rich tart backed quite astringent tannin

description: Tawny in color and wafting of potpourri and fallen leaves, this raspberry-inflected wine is already starting to show its maturity. Briskly concentrated and light on its feet, it makes an elegant sip to enjoy now before it loses its delicate, perfumed charms.
Refined-description: Tawny color wafting potpourri fallen leaf raspberryinflected wine already starting show maturity Briskly concentrated light foot make elegant sip enjoy loses delicate perfumed charm

description: The aromas on this wine are quite light, conveying wood, herbs and red fruit. This contrasts with the sweet, rich fruit flavors with a gentle grip of tannins.
Refined-description: The aroma wine quite light conveying wood herb red fruit This contrast sweet rich fruit flavor gentle grip tannin

description: A mix of smoke and toast blends with fresh, crisp citrus aromas on the nose. That's followed by a foamy, reactive palate with flavors of pink grapefruit, orange, pepper and caramel. This remains foamy on the finish, which is peppery and slightly bitter in flavor.
Refined-description: A mix smoke toast blend fresh crisp citrus aroma nose That followed foamy reactive palate flavor pink grapefruit orange pepper caramel This remains foamy finish peppery slightly bitter flavor

description: A big, ripe and spicy wine, this is packed with woody notes as well as powerful fruit. It has solid tannins and dark flavors of bitter chocolate and black cherries. It's rich and concentrated, with good aging potential. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: A big ripe spicy wine packed woody note well powerful fruit It solid tannin dark flavor bitter chocolate black cherry It rich concentrated good aging potential Drink 2018

description: Blue flower, ripe berry, baking spice and mint aromas lead the nose on this full-bodied, elegant wine. The palate delivers juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon, licorice and mineral alongside firm, ripe tannins. It's young but already displays a great combination of structure and finesse.
Refined-description: Blue flower ripe berry baking spice mint aroma lead nose fullbodied elegant wine The palate delivers juicy black cherry crushed raspberry cinnamon licorice mineral alongside firm ripe tannin It young already display great combination structure finesse

description: There is earthy darkness and a hint of the forest in this Zin, grown at high elevation in the rocky soils of the Rockpile appellation, these vines planted in 2001. The wine is magnificently structured with complex, ripe blackberry and cherry compote coming to the fore slowly and seductively.
Refined-description: There earthy darkness hint forest Zin grown high elevation rocky soil Rockpile appellation vine planted 2001 The wine magnificently structured complex ripe blackberry cherry compote coming fore slowly seductively

description: Crushed raspberry, blue flower, tilled soil and graphite aromas lead the nose on this firmly structured wine. It's still very young and needs to open up fully, but the palate already displays breeding and class. It offers ripe black cherry, ground black pepper, licorice and grilled sage alongside tightly wound but fine tannins. Drink 2018–2026.
Refined-description: Crushed raspberry blue flower tilled soil graphite aroma lead nose firmly structured wine It still young need open fully palate already display breeding class It offer ripe black cherry ground black pepper licorice grilled sage alongside tightly wound fine tannin Drink 2018–2026

description: The chalk soil of the Rosacker vineyard has produced a rich, intensely fruity wine that is shot through with steely minerality and a wonderful perfumed character. It's so crisp and fresh while also being densely textured and complex. The wine has a long future, drink from 2017.
Refined-description: The chalk soil Rosacker vineyard produced rich intensely fruity wine shot steely minerality wonderful perfumed character It crisp fresh also densely textured complex The wine long future drink 2017

description: Beautifully balanced, this conveys both rich fruit and a tense, intense minerality. Combining the two strands impeccably, it brings out tangy apple and pink grapefruit flavors and a steely, tight acidity. It's a structured wine that needs to age. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: Beautifully balanced conveys rich fruit tense intense minerality Combining two strand impeccably brings tangy apple pink grapefruit flavor steely tight acidity It structured wine need age Drink 2018

description: Tones of black cherry, toffee, tobacco, tar and violet show boldly on the nose and palate of this Moroccan red. Powerful tannins provide a suitable backdrop for fruit and spice flavors alongside an ever-present sense of brightness that lasts into the finish.
Refined-description: Tones black cherry toffee tobacco tar violet show boldly nose palate Moroccan red Powerful tannin provide suitable backdrop fruit spice flavor alongside everpresent sense brightness last finish

description: Intense aromas of dried rose, leather, truffle and crushed berry lead the nose. The ripe, forward palate offers crushed black cherry, wild raspberry, cinnamon white pepper and sage alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2015–2022.
Refined-description: Intense aroma dried rose leather truffle crushed berry lead nose The ripe forward palate offer crushed black cherry wild raspberry cinnamon white pepper sage alongside chewy tannin Drink 2015–2022

description: Paradis is a parcel within the Pfingstberg Grand Cru, giving particularly fine and rich Riesling. This ripe and full-bodied wine manages to preserve all the elegance and style of the grape while having full tropical fruits, juicy acidity and a warm, rounded aftertaste. It will certainly age, so drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Paradis parcel within Pfingstberg Grand Cru giving particularly fine rich Riesling This ripe fullbodied wine manages preserve elegance style grape full tropical fruit juicy acidity warm rounded aftertaste It certainly age drink 2017

description: This late release, aging for five years, has produced a majestic wine. Its breadth of flavor, with ripe fruits as well as intense structure, are gently transitioning from the first flush of youth to a more mature character. Intensely textured, tight, ready to spring, it shows the beauty of maturing Riesling. Drink now, although it will age many more years.
designation: Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Vieilles Vignes
Refined-description: This late release aging five year produced majestic wine Its breadth flavor ripe fruit well intense structure gently transitioning first flush youth mature character Intensely textured tight ready spring show beauty maturing Riesling Drink although age many year

description: Produced for Force Majeure by Syncline's James Mantone, this riveting wine is a blend of 47% Mourvèdre, 42% Syrah and 11% Grenache. Lush and redolent with wild berry and wet rock aromatics, it carries a thread of sweet grain along with bright, detailed berry fruit and balancing acidity. Delicious already, it can be enjoyed now through 2020.
designation: Collaboration Series VI Ciel du Cheval Vineyard
Refined-description: Produced Force Majeure Syncline James Mantone riveting wine blend 47 Mourvèdre 42 Syrah 11 Grenache Lush redolent wild berry wet rock aromatics carry thread sweet grain along bright detailed berry fruit balancing acidity Delicious already enjoyed 2020

description: More people would crave Mourvèdre if it were done in this style, with light rather than heavy leather scents alongside purple fruits. Once sipped, it hits the tastebuds with blueberry soda, tobacco, licorice, black pepper and wild game, all restrained and juicy rather than brooding and thick.
Refined-description: More people would crave Mourvèdre done style light rather heavy leather scent alongside purple fruit Once sipped hit tastebud blueberry soda tobacco licorice black pepper wild game restrained juicy rather brooding thick

description: Rounded, rich and full in the mouth, this offers swathes of flowery, aromatic fruit that is still young, still in its primary stage. With just a hint of steely texture, the wine does have structure and aging potential. For now, it is generous and delicious.
Refined-description: Rounded rich full mouth offer swathe flowery aromatic fruit still young still primary stage With hint steely texture wine structure aging potential For generous delicious

description: The winery's proprietary block of Zin grapes (planted in 1999) from the coveted Stagecoach Vineyards contributes to an intense wine. Juicy and oaky, it's dense in cherry and plum, a note of lavender and sage complementing the whole. A thick liqueur sense characterizes the texture, but the palate stays alive through the site's rocky minerality. This one'll age.
Refined-description: The winery proprietary block Zin grape planted 1999 coveted Stagecoach Vineyards contributes intense wine Juicy oaky dense cherry plum note lavender sage complementing whole A thick liqueur sense characterizes texture palate stay alive site rocky minerality This one age

description: Ripe and delicious, this starts off with aromas of fresh violet, rose, perfumed berry, exotic spice and tilled earth. It's still young but the palate already delivers a great depth of flavors including juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, clove and black pepper alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2016 to 2021.
Refined-description: Ripe delicious start aroma fresh violet rose perfumed berry exotic spice tilled earth It still young palate already delivers great depth flavor including juicy black cherry crushed raspberry clove black pepper alongside chewy tannin Drink 2016 2021

description: From one of the many recent exceptional years in Sauternes, this ripe, unctuous wine has balanced the rich honeyed fruit and the drier edge of botrytis. It's full in the mouth, with Seville orange and a light touch of ginger. Drink from 2019.
Refined-description: From one many recent exceptional year Sauternes ripe unctuous wine balanced rich honeyed fruit drier edge botrytis It full mouth Seville orange light touch ginger Drink 2019

description: A case study in cool-climate, estate-grown Syrah, the white pepper on the nose and palate is playful and exuberant, the acidity buoyant and lingering. The fruit takes on hushed tones of wild berry and bramble, with a soft texture inviting one in for more.
Refined-description: A case study coolclimate estategrown Syrah white pepper nose palate playful exuberant acidity buoyant lingering The fruit take hushed tone wild berry bramble soft texture inviting one

description: Chris Gorman is the winemaker for this pure, old vine Cabernet Sauvignon. Despite the high alcohol and the use of 100% new French oak, most of the old vine nuances are still there—a wild mix of heather and herb with berry and grain scents that weave together in the mouth. Brambly and tart, with strawberry and cherry fruit, it's a compelling wine that keeps you on your toes.
designation: Collaboration Series V Ciel du Cheval Vineyard
Refined-description: Chris Gorman winemaker pure old vine Cabernet Sauvignon Despite high alcohol use 100 new French oak old vine nuance still there—a wild mix heather herb berry grain scent weave together mouth Brambly tart strawberry cherry fruit compelling wine keep toe

description: Addictive aromas of hot blackberry pie laced with cinnamon, allspice, cola nut and a stewed cherry sauce reveal the promise of this popular Los Alamos Valley vineyard. Dark plum fruit, but with the acidity of the plum skin, meets with candied flavors of blackberry syrup and the freshness of soda water. A hedonistic Syrah.
Refined-description: Addictive aroma hot blackberry pie laced cinnamon allspice cola nut stewed cherry sauce reveal promise popular Los Alamos Valley vineyard Dark plum fruit acidity plum skin meet candied flavor blackberry syrup freshness soda water A hedonistic Syrah

description: Almost ready to drink, this wood-aged wine is packed with herbs, dark berry fruits and the first signs of secondary spice and leather flavors. The tannins are still powerful and need to soften further, so drink this complex, concentrated wine from 2016.
Refined-description: Almost ready drink woodaged wine packed herb dark berry fruit first sign secondary spice leather flavor The tannin still powerful need soften drink complex concentrated wine 2016

description: Somewhat light in color, this is an aromatically appealing wine that shows a complex assortment of coffee, vanilla, pencil lead, cherry, blueberry and high-toned herbal notes. It's exquisitely polished in its styling, with plush tannins and a long, lingering finish. A pretty expression of the variety that shows a great degree of elegance and deftness, it drinks well out of the gate but continues to improve with additional time to breathe.
Refined-description: Somewhat light color aromatically appealing wine show complex assortment coffee vanilla pencil lead cherry blueberry hightoned herbal note It exquisitely polished styling plush tannin long lingering finish A pretty expression variety show great degree elegance deftness drink well gate continues improve additional time breathe

description: From a seven-acre section of the vineyard, this offers plenty of saddle leather and cedar amidst spicy cardamom layers, a soft, juicy core and tingling acidity. The structure and weight suggest the ability to cellar comfortably through 2020.
Refined-description: From sevenacre section vineyard offer plenty saddle leather cedar amidst spicy cardamom layer soft juicy core tingling acidity The structure weight suggest ability cellar comfortably 2020

description: Pure Petit Verdot from Red Mountain's quintessential Bordeaux varietal vineyard—does it get any better? Big, deep and tannic, with lovely purity, this features ultraripe fig and plum fruit with a pleasing salinity. The finish is persistent and shows a streak of iron. Note the alcohol is pushing 16% however it is beautifully integrated.
Refined-description: Pure Petit Verdot Red Mountain quintessential Bordeaux varietal vineyard—does get better Big deep tannic lovely purity feature ultraripe fig plum fruit pleasing salinity The finish persistent show streak iron Note alcohol pushing 16 however beautifully integrated

description: Principally Klipsun vineyard fruit, this is a mass of black cherry and cassis, wreathed in smoke from aging in 80% new French barrels. Great balance and length carry it through into drying tannins. A perfect steakhouse Cabernet.
Refined-description: Principally Klipsun vineyard fruit mass black cherry cassis wreathed smoke aging 80 new French barrel Great balance length carry drying tannin A perfect steakhouse Cabernet

description: Structured and energetic, this has a balsamic nose that offers aromas of menthol, mint, fennel, ripe berry, leather and a whiff of violet. The palate delivers crushed red cherry, black raspberry, baking spices and licorice alongside assertive tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2017–2025.
Refined-description: Structured energetic balsamic nose offer aroma menthol mint fennel ripe berry leather whiff violet The palate delivers crushed red cherry black raspberry baking spice licorice alongside assertive tannin fresh acidity Drink 2017–2025

description: This ripe, full wine has both great minerality and rich white fruits that are aromatic as well as very fresh. The fruits are laced with citrus to give a complex wine that deserves aging. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: This ripe full wine great minerality rich white fruit aromatic well fresh The fruit laced citrus give complex wine deserves aging Drink 2017

description: Floral aromas lead into a rich, not quite dry wine that is beautifully ripe and perfumed. It is rounded and opulent while preserving the steely, mineral texture. Still young, it demands aging. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Floral aroma lead rich quite dry wine beautifully ripe perfumed It rounded opulent preserving steely mineral texture Still young demand aging Drink 2017

description: As its name implies, this wine comes from chalk soil, giving both a strongly mineral character and ripe tropical fruit flavors. It's rich, full in the mouth, dry but with such a ripe character there seems to be some sweetness. It's impressively full and ready to drink now.
Refined-description: As name implies wine come chalk soil giving strongly mineral character ripe tropical fruit flavor It rich full mouth dry ripe character seems sweetness It impressively full ready drink

description: Produced from old vines, this is an impressive wine, rich and dense. It brings together dark tannins and opulent black fruits that cushion the firm structure. A lively acidity and a silky character show that the wine is ready to drink.
Refined-description: Produced old vine impressive wine rich dense It brings together dark tannin opulent black fruit cushion firm structure A lively acidity silky character show wine ready drink

description: This opens with a pretty fragrance of violet, exotic spice and perfumed berry. The juicy palate doles out ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, freshly ground pepper, mocha and anisette. It's nicely balanced with fresh acidity and firm but polished tannins.
Refined-description: This open pretty fragrance violet exotic spice perfumed berry The juicy palate dole ripe black cherry crushed raspberry freshly ground pepper mocha anisette It nicely balanced fresh acidity firm polished tannin

description: Smoky and toasty, this is a structured wine. It has layers of black currant fruits, fresh acidity as well as firm tannins that overlay the juicy fruitiness. It needs to age. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: Smoky toasty structured wine It layer black currant fruit fresh acidity well firm tannin overlay juicy fruitiness It need age Drink 2016

description: While the wine is rich, it's also very crisp and fruity. Tight acidity and a chalky, steely texture are balanced by ripe apples and pink grapefruit. It's a wine for drinking this year, bright and fruity.
Refined-description: While wine rich also crisp fruity Tight acidity chalky steely texture balanced ripe apple pink grapefruit It wine drinking year bright fruity

description: A tight and herbaceous wine that is crisp, mineral and fresh. It shows a great potential for fruitiness, with natural juicy acidity as well as a bright, aromatic aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: A tight herbaceous wine crisp mineral fresh It show great potential fruitiness natural juicy acidity well bright aromatic aftertaste Drink 2016

description: Round and velvet smooth, it has blackberry fruits that are full in the mouth, giving freshness while also making the wine rich and generous. The tannins are already well-integrated into this soft wine. Drink from 2015.
Refined-description: Round velvet smooth blackberry fruit full mouth giving freshness also making wine rich generous The tannin already wellintegrated soft wine Drink 2015

description: Crisp and deliciously fruity, this is lively and bright. Acidity points up the lime and grapefruit flavors, leaving a fresh, juicy aftertaste. Drink now for maximum pleasure.
Refined-description: Crisp deliciously fruity lively bright Acidity point lime grapefruit flavor leaving fresh juicy aftertaste Drink maximum pleasure

description: Full-bodied and resplendent in ripe apple and brioche, this well-crafted wine is layered and smooth. It would pair well with grilled salmon or herb-roasted chicken.
Refined-description: Fullbodied resplendent ripe apple brioche wellcrafted wine layered smooth It would pair well grilled salmon herbroasted chicken

description: Toasty scents and flavors of the barrels (40% new) cloak tart raspberry fruit. It's clean and efficient, though for the moment at least, the barrel flavors outrun the rather light fruit. That can change over time, so give this one until 2015 or so in bottle.
Refined-description: Toasty scent flavor barrel 40 new cloak tart raspberry fruit It clean efficient though moment least barrel flavor outrun rather light fruit That change time give one 2015 bottle

description: This playful pink has fun aromas of cinnamon, red berry and bubble gum that lead to flavors of sour cherry and red plum on the palate. The finish is big, fruity and generous.
Refined-description: This playful pink fun aroma cinnamon red berry bubble gum lead flavor sour cherry red plum palate The finish big fruity generous

description: Bright orange juice, dill herbs and a slight whiff of vanilla bean lead the aromas on this un-oaked Chard. On the palate, flavors of apple cider come with a wash of fresh lime juice on the back end.
Refined-description: Bright orange juice dill herb slight whiff vanilla bean lead aroma unoaked Chard On palate flavor apple cider come wash fresh lime juice back end

description: This white combines 48% Roussanne with 35% Marsanne and 17% Viognier to creamy, tropical effect, its balance between ripe melon and pear fruitiness and spiced acidity well woven. From one of the few sources of some of these grapes in the Russian River Valley, this Rhône-inspired wine is ready to pair with lobster or a roast turkey dinner.
Refined-description: This white combine 48 Roussanne 35 Marsanne 17 Viognier creamy tropical effect balance ripe melon pear fruitiness spiced acidity well woven From one source grape Russian River Valley Rhôneinspired wine ready pair lobster roast turkey dinner

description: Taking time to come around aromatically, it opens up with plum and bright red cherry fruit that follow on the palate, a touch of savory tobacco suggested around the tannins. On the finish expect a balance of spice and sweet as black pepper and caramel compete for affection.
Refined-description: Taking time come around aromatically open plum bright red cherry fruit follow palate touch savory tobacco suggested around tannin On finish expect balance spice sweet black pepper caramel compete affection

description: Made for early drinking, this bright wine delivers red berry fruit lightly accented with sage and baking spices. It's not an ager so enjoy now through 2020.
Refined-description: Made early drinking bright wine delivers red berry fruit lightly accented sage baking spice It ager enjoy 2020

description: Sourced from the estate vineyard—the same vineyard that fuels the Private Stash reserve—this shows a dusty, somewhat charred character, presumably from the barrel aging. Along with the slightly burnt toast character comes plenty of black cherry fruit, and acids that leave a slightly chalky impression in the finish.
Refined-description: Sourced estate vineyard—the vineyard fuel Private Stash reserve—this show dusty somewhat charred character presumably barrel aging Along slightly burnt toast character come plenty black cherry fruit acid leave slightly chalky impression finish

description: The other realm of the coin from Brown Ranch, Toyon is leaner and lighter, its color even subdued, a study in wild strawberry and layered floral highlights, oak and cardamom spice. It bristles with acidity, pleasant to sip on its own or with bacon-wrapped figs.
Refined-description: The realm coin Brown Ranch Toyon leaner lighter color even subdued study wild strawberry layered floral highlight oak cardamom spice It bristle acidity pleasant sip baconwrapped fig

description: This is a frizzante style of Muscat, the pressure slight enough to allow for a screwcap seal. Off-dry, spicy and aromatic, it's a great sipping wine, with concentrated flavors of sweet orange-pekoe tea.
Refined-description: This frizzante style Muscat pressure slight enough allow screwcap seal Offdry spicy aromatic great sipping wine concentrated flavor sweet orangepekoe tea

description: This opens with aromas of black plum, oak, espresso, black pepper, balsamic notes and a whiff of barnyard. The bracing palate delivers crushed dark cherry alongside oak sensations of espresso, toast and vanilla. Aggressive wood tannins cut this short and give an astringent finish.
Refined-description: This open aroma black plum oak espresso black pepper balsamic note whiff barnyard The bracing palate delivers crushed dark cherry alongside oak sensation espresso toast vanilla Aggressive wood tannin cut short give astringent finish

description: The winery's signature widely distributed white is heady in flowery jasmine, with vibrant acidity and a sense of sweetness on the palate thanks to fresh fruit flavors of grapefruit, peach and nectarine. An ideal wine for summer or whenever one needs to recall a summer's day.
Refined-description: The winery signature widely distributed white heady flowery jasmine vibrant acidity sense sweetness palate thanks fresh fruit flavor grapefruit peach nectarine An ideal wine summer whenever one need recall summer day

description: Smells of rust, iron, tomato and untracked peppercorns rise to the nose. On the palate, the wine is quite light and racy, with a little boysenberry and more sanguine flavors. Hold onto this one until 2016 for maximum enjoyment, as more flavors will emerge.
Refined-description: Smells rust iron tomato untracked peppercorn rise nose On palate wine quite light racy little boysenberry sanguine flavor Hold onto one 2016 maximum enjoyment flavor emerge

description: Black plum, chocolate-covered cherry and mocha sensations come together alongside forceful tannins. It's rather ripe and forward for the vintage. Drink 2018–2025.
Refined-description: Black plum chocolatecovered cherry mocha sensation come together alongside forceful tannin It rather ripe forward vintage Drink 2018–2025

description: This is brilliantly purple in color, with jumpy, untamed black-fruit aromas. In the mouth, it is tannic and clawing, with a cheek-drilling mouthfeel. Syrupy blackberry flavors offer baking spice and clove accents, while the finish is showing unabsorbed oak and monster tannins.
Refined-description: This brilliantly purple color jumpy untamed blackfruit aroma In mouth tannic clawing cheekdrilling mouthfeel Syrupy blackberry flavor offer baking spice clove accent finish showing unabsorbed oak monster tannin

description: Dusty black cherry and dark plum aromas are ripe and friendly. This is a plump, modern-style red with a clean mouthfeel and weight. Berry fruits, spice and oak flavors blend well, while the finish is, in general, full, smooth and adequately fresh. Tempranillo with 10% Petit Verdot.
Refined-description: Dusty black cherry dark plum aroma ripe friendly This plump modernstyle red clean mouthfeel weight Berry fruit spice oak flavor blend well finish general full smooth adequately fresh Tempranillo 10 Petit Verdot

description: This fresh and fruity sparkling wine is crisp with apple skin and apricot flavors. Ripe and full in the mouth , it has a lightly creamy mousse. The blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay gives delicious fruitiness and tight final acidity.
Refined-description: This fresh fruity sparkling wine crisp apple skin apricot flavor Ripe full mouth lightly creamy mousse The blend Chenin Blanc Chardonnay give delicious fruitiness tight final acidity

description: Chalky earth, black pepper and clove comprise the nose on this wine, which gets a boost from 10% Merlot. The flavors are spicy and complex, with cedar, tea and a tiny bit of varietally distinct green pepper.
Refined-description: Chalky earth black pepper clove comprise nose wine get boost 10 Merlot The flavor spicy complex cedar tea tiny bit varietally distinct green pepper

description: Oso Libre ventures into the nonvintage category with this blend of 10 wines from the past five years, delivering a nose with blackberry and a pinch of pepper. The meaty wine really gets your attention once sipped, with boysenberry, cracked peppercorn, some iron and a lingering licorice flavors.
Refined-description: Oso Libre venture nonvintage category blend 10 wine past five year delivering nose blackberry pinch pepper The meaty wine really get attention sipped boysenberry cracked peppercorn iron lingering licorice flavor

description: Made from vineyards throughout the village of Serralunga d'Alba, this straightforward wine is still closed. It reveals black cherry, espresso, prune and subtle oak alongside a note of tire rubber. It's still extremely young, with aggressive tannins that dry out the finish.
Refined-description: Made vineyard throughout village Serralunga dAlba straightforward wine still closed It reveals black cherry espresso prune subtle oak alongside note tire rubber It still extremely young aggressive tannin dry finish

description: A lemon-scented, crisp wine, it's also full of ripe yellow fruits. It's a warm in style, rich with both fruit and an open texture. Almonds and acidity give a refreshing aftertaste.
Refined-description: A lemonscented crisp wine also full ripe yellow fruit It warm style rich fruit open texture Almonds acidity give refreshing aftertaste

description: This is a great sunny day wine, starting with aromas of honeydew melon, ripe nectarine and lemongrass. There is a slightly peachy, bubblegum character once sipped, with lemon-lime soda in the midpalate and a flinty, gunmetal finish.
Refined-description: This great sunny day wine starting aroma honeydew melon ripe nectarine lemongrass There slightly peachy bubblegum character sipped lemonlime soda midpalate flinty gunmetal finish

description: A brighter, more mineral- and acid-driven take on the often rustic Rhône grape, this kicks off with fresh smells of raspberry and rock. The palate brings tart cherry, followed by just-ripe black berry and really ripe raspberry on the midpalate, and a tartness on the finish.
Refined-description: A brighter mineral aciddriven take often rustic Rhône grape kick fresh smell raspberry rock The palate brings tart cherry followed justripe black berry really ripe raspberry midpalate tartness finish

description: There's a lot happening on nose of this wine from Sta. Rita Hills pioneer Richard Sanford's recently rejuvenated Alma Rosa label. Aromas suggest light butterscotch, baked pear, fresh pluot and jasmine. Once sipped, the flavors don't live up to the aromatic promise, but apple, pear and a sharper tangerine rind round out the flavors.
Refined-description: There lot happening nose wine Sta Rita Hills pioneer Richard Sanford recently rejuvenated Alma Rosa label Aromas suggest light butterscotch baked pear fresh pluot jasmine Once sipped flavor nt live aromatic promise apple pear sharper tangerine rind round flavor

description: Immediately this smells raisiny, but with time secondary scents of cinnamon and Middle Eastern spices come into play. The body is soft and extracted, with modest acidity. Flavors of baked black fruits, fig paste, chocolate and herbs follow the nose, as does a chocolaty, rich  finish. Drink through 2016.
Refined-description: Immediately smell raisiny time secondary scent cinnamon Middle Eastern spice come play The body soft extracted modest acidity Flavors baked black fruit fig paste chocolate herb follow nose chocolaty rich finish Drink 2016

description: Packed with tannin, it is not showing much sign of fruit yet. It is dark, brooding and very firm in texture, with just with a hint of juicy black cherry flavors. Wait until 2017 before drinking.
Refined-description: Packed tannin showing much sign fruit yet It dark brooding firm texture hint juicy black cherry flavor Wait 2017 drinking

description: A very fruity wine, it shows rich wood flavors as well as equally rich fruit. It is complex, very mineral in character, tight and nervy. The citrus fruit is matched by the apricot flavor, putting down layers of acidity. Don't drink before 2017.
Refined-description: A fruity wine show rich wood flavor well equally rich fruit It complex mineral character tight nervy The citrus fruit matched apricot flavor putting layer acidity Do nt drink 2017

description: The southern Napa Coombsville area is near San Pablo Bay, making it a cool area. In this vintage, it shows the acidity and mineraity of its terroir, but also the ripeness Chardonnay can achieve in a good vineyard, with orange and apricot flavors enhanced with oak. Drink now.
Refined-description: The southern Napa Coombsville area near San Pablo Bay making cool area In vintage show acidity mineraity terroir also ripeness Chardonnay achieve good vineyard orange apricot flavor enhanced oak Drink

description: From the estimable Shake Ridge Ranch, winemaker Rosemary Cakebread has fashioned a lovely blend from 53% Grenache, 31% Syrah, 14% Mourvèdre and 2% Viognier. Opening with leathery tannins, the rich and savory concoction imparts juicy dark plum, tobacco and especially coffee.
Refined-description: From estimable Shake Ridge Ranch winemaker Rosemary Cakebread fashioned lovely blend 53 Grenache 31 Syrah 14 Mourvèdre 2 Viognier Opening leathery tannin rich savory concoction imparts juicy dark plum tobacco especially coffee

description: The vintage was a great one not only for J's dry table wines but for its sparklers. This brut, a classic Chardonnay and Pinot blend, with a drop of Pinot Meunier, is dry, with complex lemon, orange, yeast, vanilla, cream and toast flavors. The bubbles are ultra-fine, raising the appeal.
Refined-description: The vintage great one J dry table wine sparkler This brut classic Chardonnay Pinot blend drop Pinot Meunier dry complex lemon orange yeast vanilla cream toast flavor The bubble ultrafine raising appeal

description: This is such a good Pinot, and so reflective of the Sonoma Coast, that its price makes it a steal. With low alcohol and brisk acidity, it's translucent in color, with a gleaming ruby hue. The mouthfeel is silky and delicate, yet the raspberry, cola and buttered cinnamon toast flavors are intense. Drink now–2020.
Refined-description: This good Pinot reflective Sonoma Coast price make steal With low alcohol brisk acidity translucent color gleaming ruby hue The mouthfeel silky delicate yet raspberry cola buttered cinnamon toast flavor intense Drink now–2020

description: This wine has more structure and depth than most Pinot Biancos from Alto Adige, thanks to vineyard location and 20% aging in large casks. It delivers sensations of apples and exotic fruit along with a flinty note. The creamy texture is brightened by lively acidity.
Refined-description: This wine structure depth Pinot Biancos Alto Adige thanks vineyard location 20 aging large cask It delivers sensation apple exotic fruit along flinty note The creamy texture brightened lively acidity

description: Pure Alvarinho from the Monção region, it's rich, creamy and textured. Lined with great acidity, it also has intense apple, bitter orange and a strongly herbal element. While it's ready to drink, this complex wine will benefit by waiting until 2015.
Refined-description: Pure Alvarinho Monção region rich creamy textured Lined great acidity also intense apple bitter orange strongly herbal element While ready drink complex wine benefit waiting 2015

winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo
description: This wood-aged wine comes from a small parcel of old vines in the Quinta Nova vineyard. With its ripe, smooth and creamy texture, it has a full, almost Burgundian feel. Ripe peach combines with vanilla to make a wine that has concentration and richness, cut with final acidity.
Refined-description: This woodaged wine come small parcel old vine Quinta Nova vineyard With ripe smooth creamy texture full almost Burgundian feel Ripe peach combine vanilla make wine concentration richness cut final acidity

description: A great follow-up to the winery's 2011, made this time from an esteemed vineyard in one of the coldest parts of the valley. The vintage was difficult, but the wine is rich in raspberry, cranberry and persimmon flavors, brightened by crisp acidity and finishing totally dry. There's no reason not to drink it now.
Refined-description: A great followup winery 2011 made time esteemed vineyard one coldest part valley The vintage difficult wine rich raspberry cranberry persimmon flavor brightened crisp acidity finishing totally dry There reason drink

description: Here's a delicious Soave with depth and character. Floral aromas of Spanish Broom and chamomile take center stage, accented by a smidge of exotic fruit and graphite. The juicy palate offers honeydew melon, white peach, ripe pear, citrus and mineral purity balanced by fresh acidity.
Refined-description: Here delicious Soave depth character Floral aroma Spanish Broom chamomile take center stage accented smidge exotic fruit graphite The juicy palate offer honeydew melon white peach ripe pear citrus mineral purity balanced fresh acidity

description: Classic varietal aromas include stone fruit, crushed tomato vine, freshly cut grass and green melon. The palate offers a depth of flavors that include creamy white peach and ripe cantaloupe that are brightened by firm acidity. It closes on a flinty mineral note.
Refined-description: Classic varietal aroma include stone fruit crushed tomato vine freshly cut grass green melon The palate offer depth flavor include creamy white peach ripe cantaloupe brightened firm acidity It close flinty mineral note

description: The estate wine from Château du Cèdre is anything but simple. A powerful series of tannins and dense black fruits offer both a dark texture and great fruitiness. Acidity comes through strongly and, with the tannins, promises aging. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: The estate wine Château du Cèdre anything simple A powerful series tannin dense black fruit offer dark texture great fruitiness Acidity come strongly tannin promise aging Drink 2017

description: The minty aromas indicate new wood aging as well as a ripe, polished texture. They make for a wine that has presence and structure as well as rich fruitiness, blackberry flavors and a dry, solid core. It's a sophisticated wine that can age. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: The minty aroma indicate new wood aging well ripe polished texture They make wine presence structure well rich fruitiness blackberry flavor dry solid core It sophisticated wine age Drink 2017

description: Made from 100% Cabernet, this wine shows the intensity of fruit that Mount Veeder is capable of expressing. It also has excellent acidity. But the tannins are astringently strong, giving a numbing sting to the palate. This certainly needs time. Give it until 2022 and beyond.
Refined-description: Made 100 Cabernet wine show intensity fruit Mount Veeder capable expressing It also excellent acidity But tannin astringently strong giving numbing sting palate This certainly need time Give 2022 beyond

description: Right out of the bottle, this 100% Syrah delights for its overall balance and deep, rich array of cherries and blueberries. If you pay attention, you'll find more complex layers of sautéed wild mushrooms, grilled prosciutto and toast. Dry and tannic, and would be ideal with roasted lamb.
Refined-description: Right bottle 100 Syrah delight overall balance deep rich array cherry blueberry If pay attention find complex layer sautéed wild mushroom grilled prosciutto toast Dry tannic would ideal roasted lamb

description: There is a great balance here between the creamy fruit and the wood flavors. Apricots, ripe apples and melon are spiced with the right amount of toastiness. The wine has a rich, warm feel. It is still young, so wait until 2015 to drink.
Refined-description: There great balance creamy fruit wood flavor Apricots ripe apple melon spiced right amount toastiness The wine rich warm feel It still young wait 2015 drink

description: Hugely tannic at this stage, this dense and complex wine has great structure partnered with dark black fruit and licorice. There is forward bitterness, suggesting this wine needs aging. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Hugely tannic stage dense complex wine great structure partnered dark black fruit licorice There forward bitterness suggesting wine need aging Drink 2017

description: This is a ripe and smoothly textured wine. It is already finely balanced, rich with toast, apricot fruits and a tight, mineral character. It is enjoyable now but will age well until 2022.
Refined-description: This ripe smoothly textured wine It already finely balanced rich toast apricot fruit tight mineral character It enjoyable age well 2022

description: Sourced from a 15-acre vineyard on Parrett Mountain, this displays single vineyard specificity. Entry is surprisingly soft, and (perhaps influenced by the name) there seems to be a pleasing clay-like quality to the mouthfeel. Clean blueberry fruit leads into a tasty, balanced finish.
Refined-description: Sourced 15acre vineyard Parrett Mountain display single vineyard specificity Entry surprisingly soft perhaps influenced name seems pleasing claylike quality mouthfeel Clean blueberry fruit lead tasty balanced finish

description: Still firm and closed, this is a structured wine, solidly tannic with just hints of fruit. It has a dry feel to it, firm, the acidity and red fruits coming through the leathery, dark texture. The wine needs aging, so drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Still firm closed structured wine solidly tannic hint fruit It dry feel firm acidity red fruit coming leathery dark texture The wine need aging drink 2017

description: Violets, truffles and ripe black fruits are present in this structured wine. It has almost too much richness, but there is plenty to admire. Solid tannins, a dark, heavy texture and complex acidity all show aging potential. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: Violets truffle ripe black fruit present structured wine It almost much richness plenty admire Solid tannin dark heavy texture complex acidity show aging potential Drink 2018

description: Sourced from the Chalice (estate) vineyard, this aromatic and seductive wine presents a compelling mix of tree fruits, racy acidity, and a rich, textural, open mouthfeel. The flavors of pears, orange peel and snappy spices linger deliciously through a long finish.
Refined-description: Sourced Chalice estate vineyard aromatic seductive wine present compelling mix tree fruit racy acidity rich textural open mouthfeel The flavor pear orange peel snappy spice linger deliciously long finish

description: This is a gigantic Syrah, a tsunami of blackberry jam and milk chocolate, with headier notes of cassis liqueur and toasty buttered oak. That sounds sweet, but the wine is thoroughly dry. The tannins are thick, but finely ground and negotiable now. It might last in the bottle for many years, but there's no point in aging it. Enjoy now with elaborate roasts and stews.
Refined-description: This gigantic Syrah tsunami blackberry jam milk chocolate headier note cassis liqueur toasty buttered oak That sound sweet wine thoroughly dry The tannin thick finely ground negotiable It might last bottle many year point aging Enjoy elaborate roast stew

description: A ripe, wood-aged wine, it's richly smoky and fruity at the same time. The blend brings out honey, ripe apricots and peach. Acidity cuts through at the end to give a final, delicious lift. Drink now, but best wait until 2015.
Refined-description: A ripe woodaged wine richly smoky fruity time The blend brings honey ripe apricot peach Acidity cut end give final delicious lift Drink best wait 2015

description: The hue is an elegant peach just starting to blush with pink. The wine is entirely dry, with low alcohol framing intricate flavors of peaches, limes and vanilla, brightened by crisp acidity.
Refined-description: The hue elegant peach starting blush pink The wine entirely dry low alcohol framing intricate flavor peach lime vanilla brightened crisp acidity

description: A savory Sauvignon with intensity and balance, it has aromas of cantaloupe and crushed tomato vine. The vibrant palate offers juicy green melon, pineapple and citrus together with a mineral note. Fresh acidity leaves a clean, crisp finish.
Refined-description: A savory Sauvignon intensity balance aroma cantaloupe crushed tomato vine The vibrant palate offer juicy green melon pineapple citrus together mineral note Fresh acidity leaf clean crisp finish

description: This savory Pinot Grigio has a little weight on it thanks to grape selection and 20% aging in large barrels. It delivers classic Granny Smith apple, Bartlett pear, nutmeg and flint in a creamy texture brightened by fresh acidity.
Refined-description: This savory Pinot Grigio little weight thanks grape selection 20 aging large barrel It delivers classic Granny Smith apple Bartlett pear nutmeg flint creamy texture brightened fresh acidity

description: With a light, silky mouthfeel and mouthwatering acidity, this Pinot satisfies for its rich array of raspberries, cherries, spices, cola and smoky oak. It defines the Carneros style: tart, a little earthy and ageworthy. Drink now–2019.
Refined-description: With light silky mouthfeel mouthwatering acidity Pinot satisfies rich array raspberry cherry spice cola smoky oak It defines Carneros style tart little earthy ageworthy Drink now–2019

description: De Loach continues to impress with this Lake County vineyard-designate, a well-balanced Zin with plenty of density amid its brick tar and brambly blackberry fruit. With leveled acidity along with plenty of power, it'll both age and be pleasing to drink now, with smoky meats.
Refined-description: De Loach continues impress Lake County vineyarddesignate wellbalanced Zin plenty density amid brick tar brambly blackberry fruit With leveled acidity along plenty power age pleasing drink smoky meat

description: This standout Rocks District wine brings earth shaking aromas of black-olive brine, tapenade, green olive, stargazer lilies, orange peel and crushed gravel. The smoked meat, charcuterie and blue-fruit flavors don't hold back, bringing a lovely sense of texture and detail. It's an intense wine that completely demands your attention.
