description: Entirely estate grown from dry-farmed grapes, this white sparkles with waxy apricot and pear flavors and crisp, underlying mineral stoniness. Dry, with refreshing acidity, it doesn't skimp on mouthfeel, delivering a viscosity that's invitingly complex and lingering.
Refined-description: Entirely estate grown dryfarmed grape white sparkle waxy apricot pear flavor crisp underlying mineral stoniness Dry refreshing acidity nt skimp mouthfeel delivering viscosity invitingly complex lingering

description: This complex and fragrant wine opens with dried violet, black plum and cooking spice aromas. The smooth, well-structured palate doles out blackberry jam, pipe tobacco, ripe black cherry, nutmeg and licorice flavors. Velvety tannins provide elegant support. Drink through 2027.
Refined-description: This complex fragrant wine open dried violet black plum cooking spice aroma The smooth wellstructured palate dole blackberry jam pipe tobacco ripe black cherry nutmeg licorice flavor Velvety tannin provide elegant support Drink 2027

description: From a combination of dry-farmed estate fruit and grapes sourced in Carneros, this lovely white is fermented in stainless steel, which coaxes a seamless, light-bodied crispness on the palate. Exotic white peach and briny stone highlight a heady aromatic thread of honeysuckle, ginger and wild vanilla.
Refined-description: From combination dryfarmed estate fruit grape sourced Carneros lovely white fermented stainless steel coax seamless lightbodied crispness palate Exotic white peach briny stone highlight heady aromatic thread honeysuckle ginger wild vanilla

description: Winemaker Bill Brosseau hits a single vineyard home run with this bottling from one of the Central Coast's oldest sites. It shows exotic plum, tangy cranberry, pine needle, juniper and pencil shaving scents on the nose. The palate is steeped in mulberry, marjoram and curry-like Indian spices, proving dynamic and delicious in the most compelling ways.
Refined-description: Winemaker Bill Brosseau hit single vineyard home run bottling one Central Coast oldest site It show exotic plum tangy cranberry pine needle juniper pencil shaving scent nose The palate steeped mulberry marjoram currylike Indian spice proving dynamic delicious compelling way

description: Yields were down in 2015, but intensity is up, giving this medium-bodied, silky wine the potential to drink well through at least 2025. Hickory smoke outlines white peach before ending in a long flurry of lime zest.
Refined-description: Yields 2015 intensity giving mediumbodied silky wine potential drink well least 2025 Hickory smoke outline white peach ending long flurry lime zest

description: The estate's 13 acres were first planted in 1999. This lovely wine expresses itself with perfectly ripened black-cherry fruit, a dash of cola, and an underpinning of clean earth, complemented with a touch of mineral. The finish is superb.
Refined-description: The estate 13 acre first planted 1999 This lovely wine express perfectly ripened blackcherry fruit dash cola underpinning clean earth complemented touch mineral The finish superb

description: Consistently outstanding Pinot Noir producer Black Kite has done it again. This bottling comes together in a seamless symphony of aromas and flavors. Ripe fruit, subtly spicy oak and forest floor notes fill the glass. Its opulent texture unfolds into layers of baking spice, earthiness, and red and black cherry fruit, with a long, complex finish.
Refined-description: Consistently outstanding Pinot Noir producer Black Kite done This bottling come together seamless symphony aroma flavor Ripe fruit subtly spicy oak forest floor note fill glass Its opulent texture unfolds layer baking spice earthiness red black cherry fruit long complex finish

description: Powerful tannin meets subdued fruit in this layered, youthful wine. Concentrated and focused, with rose petal, sage and wild strawberry notes, it holds back teasingly before slowly unraveling to reveal velvety texture and corpulent weight.
Refined-description: Powerful tannin meet subdued fruit layered youthful wine Concentrated focused rose petal sage wild strawberry note hold back teasingly slowly unraveling reveal velvety texture corpulent weight

description: There is a darker fruit spectrum evident in the reserve, with notes of coffee, smoke, black fruits, a touch of charred wood all worked through, and without damping the core fruit flavors. Those bright flavors spotlight raspberry, plum and black cherry. A light cola flavor pokes through, with ripe tannins and proportionate acids. The barrel treatment is beautifully applied, adding sweet spice to the finish.
Refined-description: There darker fruit spectrum evident reserve note coffee smoke black fruit touch charred wood worked without damping core fruit flavor Those bright flavor spotlight raspberry plum black cherry A light cola flavor poke ripe tannin proportionate acid The barrel treatment beautifully applied adding sweet spice finish

description: From the famous site on Westside Road outside of Healdsburg, this bold red shows orange, dark cherry and pungent earth scents, remaining savory at its core. Medium-bodied and balanced with acidity, it takes on a meaty persona seasoned with pepper, clove and black tea.
Refined-description: From famous site Westside Road outside Healdsburg bold red show orange dark cherry pungent earth scent remaining savory core Mediumbodied balanced acidity take meaty persona seasoned pepper clove black tea

description: Elegant and savory, this vibrant white offers enticing Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit, wet stone and crushed thyme aromas. The vibrant, ethereal palate carries subtle, tantalizing layers of yellow peach, tangy tangerine, lemon drop and pineapple with lively acidity. A graphite note closes the lingering finish. Too elegant for some palates, it shows impressive balance and depth, despite the cool, wet vintage.

description: Hands down one of Italy's best whites, this boasts alluring white flower and yellow stone fruit scents. The enveloping, delicious palate delivers white peach, mature pear, ginger and lemon drop flavors. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors while a mineral note energizes the finish.
Refined-description: Hands one Italy best white boast alluring white flower yellow stone fruit scent The enveloping delicious palate delivers white peach mature pear ginger lemon drop flavor Fresh acidity brightens creamy flavor mineral note energizes finish

description: This impressive 100% varietal wine shows focused red fruit, a tropical edge of coconut and firm, structured tannin. Sage, cedar, tobacco and black pepper notes provide a sultry, savory counterpoint to the fruit, balanced with moderate acidity. Enjoy 2023–2033.
Refined-description: This impressive 100 varietal wine show focused red fruit tropical edge coconut firm structured tannin Sage cedar tobacco black pepper note provide sultry savory counterpoint fruit balanced moderate acidity Enjoy 2023–2033

description: This gorgeous wine deftly integrates a lively mix of currant, cherry, breakfast tea and dried leaves into a seamless and seductive whole. Produced from vines dating back to the early 1970s, it finishes with a delicious streak of milk chocolate. Drink now through 2030.
Refined-description: This gorgeous wine deftly integrates lively mix currant cherry breakfast tea dried leaf seamless seductive whole Produced vine dating back early 1970s finish delicious streak milk chocolate Drink 2030

description: From a prime site relatively high in elevation for the appellation, this wine shows beautiful, crisp acidity, as robust layers of mountain raspberry, blackberry and coffee flavor vie for attention. Full bodied and densely structured, it unfurls in wisps of black licorice and clove on the lengthy finish.
Refined-description: From prime site relatively high elevation appellation wine show beautiful crisp acidity robust layer mountain raspberry blackberry coffee flavor vie attention Full bodied densely structured unfurls wisp black licorice clove lengthy finish

description: This pretty, floral wine made entirely from Chardonnay grapes from this site is both creamy and crisp. It offers impressive length, acidity and stoniness, accenting its focused green apple flavor. As it opens, it takes on a richer honey-like tone that adds further complexity and deliciousness.
Refined-description: This pretty floral wine made entirely Chardonnay grape site creamy crisp It offer impressive length acidity stoniness accenting focused green apple flavor As open take richer honeylike tone add complexity deliciousness

description: Intensely aromatic, yet big and even chunky in the mouth, this young wine remains compressed and hard-edged. Give it ample aeration, and cranberry, blackberry and black cherry fruits come alive. Dense with fruit and detailed with wet stone minerality, this should be cellared a few years, and consumed from 2020 to 2030.
Refined-description: Intensely aromatic yet big even chunky mouth young wine remains compressed hardedged Give ample aeration cranberry blackberry black cherry fruit come alive Dense fruit detailed wet stone minerality cellared year consumed 2020 2030

description: The wine comes from the grand showpiece estate of Madiran. A blend that is dominated by Tannat produces a wine that is still so young. Bold fruits and firm tannins are right to the fore, along with acidity and a strong mineral texture. It's a powerful and impressive wine that also manages elegance as well. The wine will take several more years to soften. Drink from 2020.
Refined-description: The wine come grand showpiece estate Madiran A blend dominated Tannat produce wine still young Bold fruit firm tannin right fore along acidity strong mineral texture It powerful impressive wine also manages elegance well The wine take several year soften Drink 2020

description: The aromas pop, with notes of orange peel, ember, cured meat, black olive and wet stone, with purple fruit lurking in the background. The palate is surprisingly fruit forward, with plum and savory flavors that coat the palate from end to end. The finish glides for a full 30 seconds.
Refined-description: The aroma pop note orange peel ember cured meat black olive wet stone purple fruit lurking background The palate surprisingly fruit forward plum savory flavor coat palate end end The finish glide full 30 second

description: This is a wine that is beginning to show some fine maturity. There are ripe fruits still very present, but they are matched by the secondary flavors, spice and warm tannins along with the classic herbal character of Mourvèdre. The wine is produced from organically grown grapes, giving purity as well as some serious structure in the background. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: This wine beginning show fine maturity There ripe fruit still present matched secondary flavor spice warm tannin along classic herbal character Mourvèdre The wine produced organically grown grape giving purity well serious structure background Drink 2018

description: Spicy yet sweet aromas of sarsaparilla root, saddle leather and earthy berry fruits precede a rich dense palate. This tastes of dark cherry and berry fruit, with an herbal shading adding complexity. Chocolaty oak takes hold on a solid long finish. Drink through 2024.
Refined-description: Spicy yet sweet aroma sarsaparilla root saddle leather earthy berry fruit precede rich dense palate This taste dark cherry berry fruit herbal shading adding complexity Chocolaty oak take hold solid long finish Drink 2024

description: This is one of the classics among Provence rosés. Produced from organically grown grapes and coming from an impressive red-wine producing estate east of Aix-en-Provence, the wine is structured and ageworthy with its blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon. Rich and full of red fruits, the wine should be drunk from late 2017.
Refined-description: This one classic among Provence rosés Produced organically grown grape coming impressive redwine producing estate east AixenProvence wine structured ageworthy blend includes Cabernet Sauvignon Rich full red fruit wine drunk late 2017

description: Ripe pure black-fruit aromas are touched up by notes of malty chocolate and mocha. This is proportionally big, with cheek-grabbing tannins, but it's not overly hard or unbalanced— just the opposite. Flavors of mocha, coffee, hazelnut and ripe berry fruits finish flush, dense and firm, with toasty notes and powerful but controlled residual tannins. Drink through 2030.
Refined-description: Ripe pure blackfruit aroma touched note malty chocolate mocha This proportionally big cheekgrabbing tannin overly hard unbalanced— opposite Flavors mocha coffee hazelnut ripe berry fruit finish flush dense firm toasty note powerful controlled residual tannin Drink 2030

description: This single-vineyard estate wine is made by Nils Venge and Tom Rinaldi, who have somehow managed to capture quiet elegance and powerful fruit at the same time. Red-fruit driven, it's round and rich, with moderate tannin and cassis, clove and black pepper highlights.
Refined-description: This singlevineyard estate wine made Nils Venge Tom Rinaldi somehow managed capture quiet elegance powerful fruit time Redfruit driven round rich moderate tannin cassis clove black pepper highlight

description: This is an impressively rich, still very young wine. Dominated by Bandol's own Mourvèdre grape, it is dense and concentrated. Spice and dark red fruits are shot through with a wonderful herbal character that conjures the southern warmth. The wine is still just setting out and will not be ready to drink before 2019.
Refined-description: This impressively rich still young wine Dominated Bandol Mourvèdre grape dense concentrated Spice dark red fruit shot wonderful herbal character conjures southern warmth The wine still setting ready drink 2019

description: Open-grain oak aromas are out front, followed by sweeter scents of marzipan, prune and chocolate. A full, tannic palate is deep and dense, while toasty blackened flavors of cassis and blackberry finish with notes of mocha, chocolate and pepper. This is a bit rough and tannic, so cellaring will help it calm down. Drink through 2023.
Refined-description: Opengrain oak aroma front followed sweeter scent marzipan prune chocolate A full tannic palate deep dense toasty blackened flavor cassis blackberry finish note mocha chocolate pepper This bit rough tannic cellaring help calm Drink 2023

description: This is a serious wine with a lighter brighter side. Its wood aging adds spice to the ripe red fruits and brings out the concentration and intensity. It is, in its way, an unexpected side of Provence rosé, emphasizing richness and complexity. But it all comes together: a fine wine that, after a year of aging, is ready to drink.
Refined-description: This serious wine lighter brighter side Its wood aging add spice ripe red fruit brings concentration intensity It way unexpected side Provence rosé emphasizing richness complexity But come together fine wine year aging ready drink

description: From old vines in a tree-enclosed vineyard on the third terrace above the River Lot, this wine forms part of a range of wines featuring the soils and terraces of the Cahors vineyard. Named in homage to Marguerite de Massaut, a 16th-century owner of the estate, the wine is aged in new wood that gives it a minty character. That is balanced by the rich black-plum and truffle flavor and the intense acidity. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2021.
Refined-description: From old vine treeenclosed vineyard third terrace River Lot wine form part range wine featuring soil terrace Cahors vineyard Named homage Marguerite de Massaut 16thcentury owner estate wine aged new wood give minty character That balanced rich blackplum truffle flavor intense acidity The wine need age drink 2021

description: Polished in every way, this brings an enticing potpourri of almond paste, apple and white pepper. Wild yeast fermentation in oak (30% new) marries complex components in perfect precise balance. As with all the Ponzi 2014 Chardonnays, the acids are bright but not biting, and the wines are built for both near-term enjoyment and medium-term aging.
Refined-description: Polished every way brings enticing potpourri almond paste apple white pepper Wild yeast fermentation oak 30 new marries complex component perfect precise balance As Ponzi 2014 Chardonnays acid bright biting wine built nearterm enjoyment mediumterm aging

description: Scents of woodland berry, rose petal, grilled herb, anisette and a balsamic note emerge on this firmly structured wine. On the robust palate, white pepper, licorice, sage and a hint of toast weave through the black cherry core. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close. Drink 2018–2028.
Refined-description: Scents woodland berry rose petal grilled herb anisette balsamic note emerge firmly structured wine On robust palate white pepper licorice sage hint toast weave black cherry core You also detect warmth alcohol close Drink 2018–2028

description: Juicy, sun-kissed grapefruits and apple blossoms explode from this buoyantly fresh, off-dry Kabinett. Invigorating acidity lends backbone and a steely focus that resonates long on the finish. It's beautiful now, but should hold nicely, and perhaps improve, through 2020.
Refined-description: Juicy sunkissed grapefruit apple blossom explode buoyantly fresh offdry Kabinett Invigorating acidity lends backbone steely focus resonates long finish It beautiful hold nicely perhaps improve 2020

description: Dense, rich red fruit belies an elegant wine that finds balance despite the concentration of vanilla and berry. Soft, approachable and integrated tannin and oak let the whole exist as one, instead of separate parts. This shows off the appellation's mountain fruit and rocky minerality.
Refined-description: Dense rich red fruit belies elegant wine find balance despite concentration vanilla berry Soft approachable integrated tannin oak let whole exist one instead separate part This show appellation mountain fruit rocky minerality

description: Lightly leesy aromas of vanilla cookie are offset by crisp minerally apple and stone-fruit scents. This is pure and lifted by fine acidity, while flavors of apple, pineapple and lemon-lime end fresh, with a distant note of citrus pith. Drink immediately.
Refined-description: Lightly leesy aroma vanilla cookie offset crisp minerally apple stonefruit scent This pure lifted fine acidity flavor apple pineapple lemonlime end fresh distant note citrus pith Drink immediately

description: From the Lovall Valley section of the Napa Valley quite near Sonoma, this lovely wine is awash in tropical mango, with lilts of pear and vanilla. Creamy, it's made in a fuller-bodied style but never gets ridiculous, instead offering balance and elegance, finishing with a squeeze of grapefruit.
Refined-description: From Lovall Valley section Napa Valley quite near Sonoma lovely wine awash tropical mango lilt pear vanilla Creamy made fullerbodied style never get ridiculous instead offering balance elegance finishing squeeze grapefruit

description: The top wine in the Rocim range is produced from selected Alicante Bouschet grapes. It is huge and powerful, perhaps too much in its concentration, richness and density. Dark and brooding, it is super everything and certainly needs to calm down. Drink from 2019.
Refined-description: The top wine Rocim range produced selected Alicante Bouschet grape It huge powerful perhaps much concentration richness density Dark brooding super everything certainly need calm Drink 2019

description: There's a cantaloupe-like ripeness on the nose of this blend of 37% Grenache Blanc, 33% Viognier and 30% Roussanne, but not overdone, layered with seared white peach, caramelized pear, poached apple and almond aromas. The palate is more restrained and quite grippy, with flavors of green-apple skins, Bosc pear and a touch of honey.
Refined-description: There cantaloupelike ripeness nose blend 37 Grenache Blanc 33 Viognier 30 Roussanne overdone layered seared white peach caramelized pear poached apple almond aroma The palate restrained quite grippy flavor greenapple skin Bosc pear touch honey

description: This lush offering opens with appealing aromas of rose petals and fresh strawberries, then glides into a smooth-as-silk midpalate. The berry/cherry fruit is nicely adorned with toasty barrel flavors, and it's as satiny as new sheets. You'll find it hard to keep from gulping this by the glassful.
Refined-description: This lush offering open appealing aroma rose petal fresh strawberry glide smoothassilk midpalate The berrycherry fruit nicely adorned toasty barrel flavor satiny new sheet You find hard keep gulping glassful

description: A pretty salmon-pink in color, and a lovable quaffer, this wine is dry, crisp and brightly refreshing in succulent waves of grapefruit and tangerine, remarkably light in alcohol but not shy in flavor. Enjoy it on its own or with a range of foods—its lightness begets versatility.
Refined-description: A pretty salmonpink color lovable quaffer wine dry crisp brightly refreshing succulent wave grapefruit tangerine remarkably light alcohol shy flavor Enjoy range foods—its lightness begets versatility

description: Aromas of slightly stewed fruit, steeped berry, spice and menthol unfold in the glass. The firm palate delivers juicy cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice, ground pepper and a mint note while bracing tannins and racy acidity provide the backbone. This needs a few more years to calm down and will continue to age well for a decade or more. Drink 2018–2026.
Refined-description: Aromas slightly stewed fruit steeped berry spice menthol unfold glass The firm palate delivers juicy cherry crushed raspberry licorice ground pepper mint note bracing tannin racy acidity provide backbone This need year calm continue age well decade Drink 2018–2026

description: Pretty aromas of blue flower, rose, wild berry and graphite lead the way. The firm palate delivers mature black cherry, raspberry, star anise, black pepper and chopped sage alongside bright acidity and tightly knit tannins that need to unwind. Drink 2018–2026.
Refined-description: Pretty aroma blue flower rose wild berry graphite lead way The firm palate delivers mature black cherry raspberry star anise black pepper chopped sage alongside bright acidity tightly knit tannin need unwind Drink 2018–2026

description: Bittersweet at first, with sizable tannins, this Cab also contains 13.8% Petit Verdot. Red and black berries give it a juicy palate atop dusty, chalky tannins and a richness of leather and clove on the finish.
Refined-description: Bittersweet first sizable tannin Cab also contains 138 Petit Verdot Red black berry give juicy palate atop dusty chalky tannin richness leather clove finish

description: Aromas of perfumed berry, mint, baking spice and a whiff of oak emerge on this structured wine. The firm palate offers wild red cherry, crushed raspberry, mint, grilled sage and a touch of oak-driven spice alongside bracing tannins and nervous acidity. Give it time to soften and fully develop. Drink 2019–2031.
Refined-description: Aromas perfumed berry mint baking spice whiff oak emerge structured wine The firm palate offer wild red cherry crushed raspberry mint grilled sage touch oakdriven spice alongside bracing tannin nervous acidity Give time soften fully develop Drink 2019–2031

description: Aromas and flavors of sandalwood and grenadine layer around this velvety, seductive wine. It offers black tea, truffle and forest floor, the body sinewy and complex. Savory in cinnamon and clove on the finish, it needs more time to open; decant or cellar through 2021.
Refined-description: Aromas flavor sandalwood grenadine layer around velvety seductive wine It offer black tea truffle forest floor body sinewy complex Savory cinnamon clove finish need time open decant cellar 2021

description: A classic northern Rhône valley blend of Syrah with a touch of Viognier, this massive wine is made from grapes grown on granite soil, which leaves its mark in dense minerality and great power. It is a wine for lovers of the big stuff, concentrated and needing to age. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: A classic northern Rhône valley blend Syrah touch Viognier massive wine made grape grown granite soil leaf mark dense minerality great power It wine lover big stuff concentrated needing age Drink 2018

description: This is a rich, full-bodied wine that is ready to drink now. It still has a dry core of tannins, although they are overwhelmed by the rich, juicy black fruits and generous texture. It's a concentrated wine, high in alcohol, although that is really balanced by the fresh aftertaste.
Refined-description: This rich fullbodied wine ready drink It still dry core tannin although overwhelmed rich juicy black fruit generous texture It concentrated wine high alcohol although really balanced fresh aftertaste

description: Warm vanilla notes are laid across ripe nectarine, apple skin and a twist of lemon rind on this single-vineyard study by the Los Gatos-based winery. Pencil lead kicks off the palate, which then opens into poached apples and lemon oil, laid across a sizzling acidity that lasts long.
Refined-description: Warm vanilla note laid across ripe nectarine apple skin twist lemon rind singlevineyard study Los Gatosbased winery Pencil lead kick palate open poached apple lemon oil laid across sizzling acidity last long

description: Lemony and light on entry, this tropically kissed, textured white develops body and weight over time, finding a balance and elegance that's hard to ignore. A touch of white peach wraps up the finish.
Refined-description: Lemony light entry tropically kissed textured white develops body weight time finding balance elegance hard ignore A touch white peach wrap finish

description: Often herbal and a bit green in nature, Silvaner is a much maligned grape. Yet at Thörle, it seems to blossom into something perfumed and quite fruity, redolent of peaches and fresh pears. Characteristic herb notes are fresh and nuanced, highlighted against brisk citrus and apple flavors and a silken supple mouthfeel.
Refined-description: Often herbal bit green nature Silvaner much maligned grape Yet Thörle seems blossom something perfumed quite fruity redolent peach fresh pear Characteristic herb note fresh nuanced highlighted brisk citrus apple flavor silken supple mouthfeel

description: Engaging aromas of red rose, iris, wild berry, cinnamon and a balsamic note waft out of the glass while juicy cherry, white pepper, anise and chopped mint drive the spicy, polished palate. Firm but refined tannins provide structure. Drink 2017–2021.
Refined-description: Engaging aroma red rose iris wild berry cinnamon balsamic note waft glass juicy cherry white pepper anise chopped mint drive spicy polished palate Firm refined tannin provide structure Drink 2017–2021

description: Caramelized white peach, salted lemon, pear skin, red apple and the hint of white flowers show on the nose of this wine by these longtime but under-the-radar producers. The palate blends orange skins and grapefruit pith with buttered toast, sea salt and a dill-like herb character.
Refined-description: Caramelized white peach salted lemon pear skin red apple hint white flower show nose wine longtime undertheradar producer The palate blend orange skin grapefruit pith buttered toast sea salt dilllike herb character

description: A limited, popular entry in Winderlea's extensive single-vineyard lineup, this suggests cherry kirsch with streaks of coffee and tobacco. The pretty fruit leads into darker notes of tar and espresso. Still young and primary, the Juliard may be among the vintage's most long-lasting wines.
Refined-description: A limited popular entry Winderlea extensive singlevineyard lineup suggests cherry kirsch streak coffee tobacco The pretty fruit lead darker note tar espresso Still young primary Juliard may among vintage longlasting wine

description: This is a very lively wine with a creamy mousse. The wine is towards dry, bringing out great white and citrus fruit flavors with a burst of tangy acidity. It comes from the village of Chouilly in the Côte des Blancs, which gives the wine a tight mineral texture at the end.
designation: Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Chouilly Brut
Refined-description: This lively wine creamy mousse The wine towards dry bringing great white citrus fruit flavor burst tangy acidity It come village Chouilly Côte de Blancs give wine tight mineral texture end

description: A Garrafeira wine is a special selection and this wine, which was aged for 30 months after bottling before being released, shows its quality quickly. Now reaching drinkability, its tannins have softened leaving rich full black currant and fresh acidity along with a more mature leathery character. Drink now and until 2020.
Refined-description: A Garrafeira wine special selection wine aged 30 month bottling released show quality quickly Now reaching drinkability tannin softened leaving rich full black currant fresh acidity along mature leathery character Drink 2020

description: Principally Pinot Noir, the blend includes 25% Pinot Meunier and a splash of Chardonnay. It's a light and pretty salmon pink in hue, with hints of honeysuckle and moist earth in the nose. Flavors suggest tart raspberries and Bing cherries, with impressive minerality in the crisp, lingering finish.
Refined-description: Principally Pinot Noir blend includes 25 Pinot Meunier splash Chardonnay It light pretty salmon pink hue hint honeysuckle moist earth nose Flavors suggest tart raspberry Bing cherry impressive minerality crisp lingering finish

description: Restrained aromas of black plum barely set the stage for flavors of dark plum, cherry-vanilla, mint eucalyptus and ground black pepper. Fruit flavors are soft, but the minty notes never overpower brightness and acidity. Tannins are just shy of opulent, and the finish is marked by a note of tart apple crispness.
Refined-description: Restrained aroma black plum barely set stage flavor dark plum cherryvanilla mint eucalyptus ground black pepper Fruit flavor soft minty note never overpower brightness acidity Tannins shy opulent finish marked note tart apple crispness

description: Creamy on the nose, this wine shows seared pineapple, apple custard, lemon oil and faint iodine aromas. The flavors are evenly placed between lemon yogurt and salted apples, mixing a bit of tang and ripe fruit with a savory sea salt.
Refined-description: Creamy nose wine show seared pineapple apple custard lemon oil faint iodine aroma The flavor evenly placed lemon yogurt salted apple mixing bit tang ripe fruit savory sea salt

description: Lush aromatics conjure up dreams of strawberry cream. This is quite pretty, with perfect balance among its components of fruit, acid and tannin, set comfortably in a compact frame.
Refined-description: Lush aromatics conjure dream strawberry cream This quite pretty perfect balance among component fruit acid tannin set comfortably compact frame

description: Enticing aromas of crushed rose, red berry, wild mint, menthol and a hint of oak come together. The linear, focused palate offers raw red cherry, strawberry, white pepper, licorice and chopped sage accompanied by tightly knit, close-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2019–2026.
Refined-description: Enticing aroma crushed rose red berry wild mint menthol hint oak come together The linear focused palate offer raw red cherry strawberry white pepper licorice chopped sage accompanied tightly knit closegrained tannin bright acidity Drink 2019–2026

description: Ripe berry aromas blend nicely with earthy leathery scents. With a full and easy palate, this generous Crianza delivers blackberry and chocolate flavors that veer toward raisin and prune, especially on the finish, which is lightly toasted and dense in feel. Drink through 2019.
Refined-description: Ripe berry aroma blend nicely earthy leathery scent With full easy palate generous Crianza delivers blackberry chocolate flavor veer toward raisin prune especially finish lightly toasted dense feel Drink 2019

description: Cedar, cherry, black olive, wet earth, green olive and freshly plucked plum pop on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows lots of ripe black cherry down the middle, but is surrounded by a tangy green olive and an underripe-berry character, whose tartness enlivens the mouth.
Refined-description: Cedar cherry black olive wet earth green olive freshly plucked plum pop nose bottling The palate show lot ripe black cherry middle surrounded tangy green olive underripeberry character whose tartness enlivens mouth

description: One of the few in California to use this grape, winemaker Ryan Pease makes a great case for more in this bottling, which shows broad lemon curd, soft apple flesh and Anjou pear on the nose. There is ripe stone fruit on the tangy palate, but it's bone dry and grippy with chalky texture.
Refined-description: One California use grape winemaker Ryan Pease make great case bottling show broad lemon curd soft apple flesh Anjou pear nose There ripe stone fruit tangy palate bone dry grippy chalky texture

description: Much like its companion from the Revelation & Sorek Bloc, this offers well-endowed flavors of melon and white peach, along with a touch of citrus. There is a sense of higher acidity, along with lower listed alcohol, rather counter-intuitive as this is the reserve. Pick either one and you'll be pleased.
Refined-description: Much like companion Revelation Sorek Bloc offer wellendowed flavor melon white peach along touch citrus There sense higher acidity along lower listed alcohol rather counterintuitive reserve Pick either one pleased

description: The Pinot-ness of this wine is undeniable: its structure is of velvet, and its aromas convey freshly turned earth, autumnal oak leaf and subdued red-cherry fruit. There is a depth that evokes deep forests. Have this with furred or feathered game.
Refined-description: The Pinotness wine undeniable structure velvet aroma convey freshly turned earth autumnal oak leaf subdued redcherry fruit There depth evokes deep forest Have furred feathered game

description: This is a blend from most parts of the village, with fruit from 14 different parcels. It is solid and firm while also having great swathes of raspberries and red plums laced together with acidity. The aftertaste is perfumed with a fresh lift. Drink from 2018
Refined-description: This blend part village fruit 14 different parcel It solid firm also great swathe raspberry red plum laced together acidity The aftertaste perfumed fresh lift Drink 2018

description: This new sister label from Elk Cove offers 100% Willamette Valley Pinot Noir at an everyday price. Fresh cranberry and raspberry fruit is framed by herb-tinged tannins. The immaculate craftsmanship and clean direct flavors are light years beyond budget Pinot Noir from most other regions. This is your perfect salmon wine.
Refined-description: This new sister label Elk Cove offer 100 Willamette Valley Pinot Noir everyday price Fresh cranberry raspberry fruit framed herbtinged tannin The immaculate craftsmanship clean direct flavor light year beyond budget Pinot Noir region This perfect salmon wine

description: Red berry, rose and clove are some of the aromas you'll find on this bright, supple red. The smooth palate offers juicy black cherry, crushed strawberry and white pepper alongside fresh acidity. A mineral vein underscores the savory flavors and energizes the finish. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon. Drink through 2018.
Refined-description: Red berry rose clove aroma find bright supple red The smooth palate offer juicy black cherry crushed strawberry white pepper alongside fresh acidity A mineral vein underscore savory flavor energizes finish It made drunk young enjoy soon Drink 2018

description: Ruddy black plums and blackberries scent this lusciously ripe, rich Lemberger. It's irresistibly fruity, yet anchored by a savory edge of bramble and dried herb along with crisp cranberry acidity freshening the finish. Drink now through 2021.
Refined-description: Ruddy black plum blackberry scent lusciously ripe rich Lemberger It irresistibly fruity yet anchored savory edge bramble dried herb along crisp cranberry acidity freshening finish Drink 2021

description: Translucent, fresh aromatics, like green pears glimpsed through clear water, characterize this wine. There's also an herbal edge of fresh, green foliage on this slender and refreshing wine. The limpid purity is very convincing.
Refined-description: Translucent fresh aromatics like green pear glimpsed clear water characterize wine There also herbal edge fresh green foliage slender refreshing wine The limpid purity convincing

description: The slightest whiff of pepper on the nose leads to a spiced, leesy and slender palate on this unusual Alsace resident: it's Switzerland's Chasselas making an appearance. This is slender and while the nose is shy, the palate provides ample textures. Make as a local and have this with fresh white asparagus. The wine has a great acidic spine and luminous freshness.
Refined-description: The slightest whiff pepper nose lead spiced leesy slender palate unusual Alsace resident Switzerland Chasselas making appearance This slender nose shy palate provides ample texture Make local fresh white asparagus The wine great acidic spine luminous freshness

description: The nose is like pear juice spilled onto warm earth, while the palate is more citrus-focused. A seam of almost tropical acidity links lemon to notes of pineapple, lifted by joyful freshness.

description: Fresh cut pear fruit flavors carry this wine. It's crisp and clean, with fresh fruit balanced against natural acidity. Drink it now while the freshness is paramount.
Refined-description: Fresh cut pear fruit flavor carry wine It crisp clean fresh fruit balanced natural acidity Drink freshness paramount

description: Planted with eight grapes, including the three Pinot “sisters”—Blanc, Gris and Noir—this site is located just below Archery Summit in the heart of the Dundee Hills. The pale, pretty rosé hue introduces this most elegant and restrained of the winery's vineyard selections. It's a velvety, finesse wine, with delicate flavors of rhubarb, cinnamon, cardamom and cocoa.

description: With some firm structure, this wine also has great fruitiness. It offers plenty of raspberry fruits, good acidity and a solid texture of tannins. The acidity keeps the wine perfumed and fresh. Drink the wine from 2019.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines
Refined-description: With firm structure wine also great fruitiness It offer plenty raspberry fruit good acidity solid texture tannin The acidity keep wine perfumed fresh Drink wine 2019

description: Enticing scents of spring flower, beeswax and orchard fruit come together in the glass. The elegant, linear palate shows juicy lemon, nectarine, hazelnut and a saline note framed in firm acidity. It closes crisp and clean.

description: Made with 60% Moscato di Alessandria and 40% Albanello, this earthy, intriguing white offers penetrating aromas of pressed wild flower, vineyard dust, orchard fruit and dried aromatic herb. The pervasive floral scent follows through to the mineral-driven palate along with dried peach, candied nectarine zest and chopped sage. Quality has improved immensely since the producer transferred to her spacious new cellars.

description: Not such a rarity these days, Albariño is turning heads in California and Oregon. This tart, juicy, and deliciously fresh effort is loaded with tangy citrus and green apple fruit. It's leesy and textural, tasting of wet stones: in sum, a wonderfully refreshing summer white.
Refined-description: Not rarity day Albariño turning head California Oregon This tart juicy deliciously fresh effort loaded tangy citrus green apple fruit It leesy textural tasting wet stone sum wonderfully refreshing summer white

description: Lightly scented, this opens with aromas of yellow stone fruit, citrus and a whiff of aromatic herb. The bright, medium-bodied palate offers creamy peach, mature green apple and a hint of nectarine while a mineral note fills in the juicy finish.

description: Apple, pear and stone-fruit flavors are vibrant and fresh from nose to finish of this delicately sweet Kabinett. It offers uncomplicated refreshment, but is anchored with taut acidity and honed, steely minerality. The finish is long and persistent.

description: A slightly herbal, minty character gives personality to this full-bodied, generous and richly textured wine. It is attractively dry, nicely tannic, layered with black cherry, wild berry and rosemary notes. Great to drink now through 2020 with rich meats or mushrooms.
Refined-description: A slightly herbal minty character give personality fullbodied generous richly textured wine It attractively dry nicely tannic layered black cherry wild berry rosemary note Great drink 2020 rich meat mushroom

description: An ambitious, concentrated, but not oaky wine, this has a very dark color, aromas of black cherries, and ripe but dry flavors of blackberries and dark chocolate. It is medium to full bodied, framed by lots of fine-grained tannins and finishing with more dark fruit. It's a good wine to lay down and drink after 2019.

description: Made at an attractive price point, this wine delivers value and plenty of flavor, from blackberry jam to oak and black pepper. It's sturdy and structured, ready for the table or larger gathering.

description: From a valley-floor site, this blend of 70% Zinfandel and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon delights in a depth of blackberry and cedar, reflecting well on both varieties. Firm tannin and restrained oak provide room for a touch of gun smoke and pencil lead, with a lengthy finish.

description: Aromas of plum, wild herbs and tobacco are mature and suggest that this is ready to drink. In the mouth, this is medium-bodied, with clarity and a sense of freshness. Plum, berry and cherry flavors finish in harmony. Drink through 2020.

description: Quite rare in the U.S. market, this ripe richly berried wine is an excellent example of Frühburgunder, an early ripening mutation of Pinot Noir. Blackberry and plum flavors are fleshy and rich, offset by soft, sunny acidity and a supple silken mouthfeel. It's just faintly tannic and approachable now.

description: Aromas of mulled black fruits, vanilla, tobacco, orange peel and earth are a touch jumbled, but compartmentalized—this smells nice. Wiry and fresh in feel, but with a slightly hollow midsection, this tastes peppery, oaky and like cherry and black plum. A toasty finish with snappy acidity solidifies this medium-weight La Mancha Tempranillo. Drink through 2019.

description: From several vineyard sites and combining all five red Bordeaux varieties, this wine is fermented in stainless steel before it rests over two years in both French and American oak. Powerful, it retains an elegance amid a tannic, grippy entry of toasted oak and black cherry, and a rich textured finish accented in cinnamon and chocolate.
Refined-description: From several vineyard site combining five red Bordeaux variety wine fermented stainless steel rest two year French American oak Powerful retains elegance amid tannic grippy entry toasted oak black cherry rich textured finish accented cinnamon chocolate

description: Grippy leather and tobacco provide a gravelly texture and burly nature to this medium-bodied wine, which finds its groove in the glass. Concentrated and dense, it offers smoother elements of black currant, cassis and leather on the finish.

description: A deep color and oodles of blackberry and boysenberry flavors lend a lot of impact to this full-bodied, ripe and almost jammy-tasting wine. It is generous, layered and concentrated but not overly serious in terms of tannins. Call it big but friendly.
Refined-description: A deep color oodles blackberry boysenberry flavor lend lot impact fullbodied ripe almost jammytasting wine It generous layered concentrated overly serious term tannin Call big friendly

description: Seductive, spicy oak in the aromas and flavors puts a great spin on this medium-bodied, velvety smooth wine from a promising new winery in Northern California. Some ripe black-cherry and cranberry flavors chime in as well, supporting the toasted baguette, cedar and nutmeg nuances and layering seamlessly.

description: This is the Hearst family's run at a luxury-level Chardonnay, and it's a promising start, with creamy aromas of honeysuckle, light butter and citrus rinds. There's a touch of vanilla bean on the palate, which also shows apple ice cream, flashes of cinnamon and a firmly wound texture. It's delicate, clean, light and quaffable.

description: Juicy blackberry and blackcurrant mix with cocoa, cola and peppercorns on the nose of this densely layered wine. Flavors are deep and dark with tar, pencil shavings, dried blueberry, street asphalt and a strong umami character, still tightly wound at five years old. Let it breathe, or wait another couple years for optimal drinking.
designation: Cabovation Destiny Vineyards Mt. Christo Block Reserve

description: Tilled earth, ripe dark-skinned berry, leather and menthol aromas show this wine's Sangiovese pedigree. The robust, concentrated palate doles out crushed black cherry, raspberry jam, cinnamon, licorice and the warmth of evident alcohol—the latter a common characteristic of this hot vintage. Firm, ripe tannins provide the framework. Drink 2017–2021.

description: Aromas of fresh dill and other green herbs leap up from the glass. The plum flavors are pure and persistent. It's a unique expression of the variety.

description: This Bordeaux-style blend is comprised of 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, 43% Merlot and 13% Cabernet Franc. The fruit flavors of raspberry and blackberry are light and tangy, the tannins mellow. A note of dark chocolate highlights the finish.

description: Apple, lime and mineral aromas lend freshness to a mature nose. This feels round and plump, but well balanced due to fine acidity. Peach and citrus flavors are stony and finish with tropical notes of lychee and mango. Drink now.

description: This is a finely perfumed wine, rich in both structure and ripe fruits. It is smoothly textured, a full-bodied wine that has dark cherry flavors as well as a balanced layer of acidity. The wine is still young, juicy and will develop further, so drink from 2017.

description: Aromas of underbrush, charred earth, truffle, star anise and a hint of menthol come together in the glass. The ripe palate shows dried black cherry, blackberry jam, licorice and mocha alongside solid, assertive tannins. Drink 2019–2025.

description: The aromas that come together are those of scorched earth, grilled porcini, roasted coffee bean and a bit of burnt rubber. The mature palate offers dried cherry, blackberry confiture, mocha, vanilla and a hint of game alongside tongue-drying tannins that clench the finish. Give this a few years to unfold then drink sooner rather than later.

description: Grilled herb, forest floor, scorched earth, cured meat and menthol aromas lead the way. The ripe palate offers juicy wild cherry, fleshy black raspberry, cinnamon, pipe tobacco and a confectionary note alongside firm, enveloping tannins. It's already accessible and will make fine near- to mid-term drinking.

description: The nose on this creative blend of 52% Gewürztraminer, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 23% Chenin Blanc is quite showy with peach, baked orange, apple blossom and honeysuckle notes. But the real star is the palate that is racy with sizzling energy and flavors of cut grass, lemongrass and sour-apple peels.

description: Sourced from 50+ year-old vines in the commune of Sorgues, this aromatic blend of 60% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre boasts hints of rosemary, bay leaf and clove. It's reasonably full bodied, with a long, drying finish that demands another year or two in the cellar or (preferably) some rare beef or lamb.

description: This Costco brand has become a reliable source for bargain Châteauneuf-du-Pape. This vintage is a bit firmer and more tannic than others, but it still weaves together cherry and leather notes into a pleasing whole. It might need a year or two to soften, but it should provide good drinking through 2025.

description: Malbec, Merlot and Petit Verdot are included in this wine that's black-purple in color, with a thick density to its dusty black fruit. Cedar, tar and tobacco weave in between blackberry and currant, finishing in a powerful grip of tannin.

description: Grapes are sourced from both Stagecoach and Hyde vineyards in this wine that takes its time in the glass coming around. In the mouth, this is full, resiny and grabby. Oak-driven flavors of vanilla, lees, peach and white pepper finish long, with elegance and a woody aftertaste.

description: Given about a year in French oak, less than half of it new, this is a cohesive blend of 53% Grenache, 29% Mourvèdre, 12% Syrah and 6% Counoise. It's brawny in meat and leather, blackberry and tar, with a velvety mouthfeel benefiting from integrated oak.

description: Round and ripe, this opens with aromas that recall baked plum, vanilla, anise and a whiff of leather. The approachable, juicy palate doles out mature black cherry, blackberry, mocha, dried sage, baking spice and licorice. Polished, fine-grained tannins provide support.
