description: This uniquely tan-colored Torrontés is “orange” in style. Aromas of orange peel, peach, apricot and floor polish are challenging but complex. This immediately turns grabby and astringent on the palate, while stone-fruit and pithy flavors are short, quick and dry.
Refined-description: This uniquely tancolored Torrontés “ orange ” style Aromas orange peel peach apricot floor polish challenging complex This immediately turn grabby astringent palate stonefruit pithy flavor short quick dry

description: Gritty aromas of herbal berry fruits and coffee grounds lead to a hard tannic, compact palate with loud acidity. Disparate flavors of burnt coffee, tomato and stewed plum finish with scraping tannins and herbal notes that reflect the nose and palate.
designation: Familia Navarro Torrre Grand Gold Medal
Refined-description: Gritty aroma herbal berry fruit coffee ground lead hard tannic compact palate loud acidity Disparate flavor burnt coffee tomato stewed plum finish scraping tannin herbal note reflect nose palate

description: This opens with scents of green melon rind, strawberry hull and lime that carry through to the palate alongside an additional note of peach. A pleasant grassy tone gives interest to the finish, while ample acidity keeps the palate fresh and clean. Drink now.
Refined-description: This open scent green melon rind strawberry hull lime carry palate alongside additional note peach A pleasant grassy tone give interest finish ample acidity keep palate fresh clean Drink

description: While light in color, this wine is flavorful and easy to enjoy. Its smoothly textured, medium-bodied palate carries generous red cherry and plum flavors.
Refined-description: While light color wine flavorful easy enjoy Its smoothly textured mediumbodied palate carry generous red cherry plum flavor

description: This pale rosé blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is fruity with crisp strawberry fruits and acidity. It has a soft perfumed aftertaste that makes it immediately attractive. Drink now.
Refined-description: This pale rosé blend Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot fruity crisp strawberry fruit acidity It soft perfumed aftertaste make immediately attractive Drink

description: This is the second label from this Gaillac estate. It is a fine mix of red fruits and spice—all fruitiness and with a strong shot of acidity. The wine is made to be drunk young; enjoy this summer.
Refined-description: This second label Gaillac estate It fine mix red fruit spice—all fruitiness strong shot acidity The wine made drunk young enjoy summer

description: A hint of maple syrup in the aromas and flavors gives this medium-bodied red a touch of sweetness. Oak flavors dominate the modest fruit on the palate.
Refined-description: A hint maple syrup aroma flavor give mediumbodied red touch sweetness Oak flavor dominate modest fruit palate

description: A blend of 30% Pinot Noir and 70% Gamay, this is a fruity wine with the softest tannins and red cherry flavor. Made to drink young, it's somewhat spoiled by a banana-like edge that comes from its vinification.
Refined-description: A blend 30 Pinot Noir 70 Gamay fruity wine softest tannin red cherry flavor Made drink young somewhat spoiled bananalike edge come vinification

description: This informal red has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of black-skinned fruit and a suggestion of cooking spice. The simple palate delivers black cherry and vanilla alongside laid-back tannins. Drink soon.
Refined-description: This informal red shy nose eventually reveals whiff blackskinned fruit suggestion cooking spice The simple palate delivers black cherry vanilla alongside laidback tannin Drink soon

description: This is a light wine with plenty of acidity and soft tannins that come together in a juicy, crisp, red fruit-flavored medley. Ready to drink.
Refined-description: This light wine plenty acidity soft tannin come together juicy crisp red fruitflavored medley Ready drink

description: A light orange pink color sets the scene for a fruity wine that has raspberry flavors, soft acidity and an attractive, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
Refined-description: A light orange pink color set scene fruity wine raspberry flavor soft acidity attractive crisp aftertaste Drink

description: Named after the series of vineyard terraces that rise steeply from the Lot river, this wine is soft and easily accessible. It does have the Malbec structure although this is comfortably balanced by the black fruit and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Named series vineyard terrace rise steeply Lot river wine soft easily accessible It Malbec structure although comfortably balanced black fruit acidity The wine ready drink 2017

description: Fresh grass, gooseberry, lime leaf and a touch of melon rind appear on the nose and mouth of this straightforward wine. It's lightweight and easygoing, with brisk acidity and a crisp, refreshing finish. Drink now.
Refined-description: Fresh grass gooseberry lime leaf touch melon rind appear nose mouth straightforward wine It lightweight easygoing brisk acidity crisp refreshing finish Drink

description: This wine veers slightly sweet, like many overripe red blends. It's deep in color, soft in and makes a good counterpoint to spicy foods.
Refined-description: This wine veers slightly sweet like many overripe red blend It deep color soft make good counterpoint spicy food

description: This is bold for a boxed wine, showing ripe, lightly spicy flavors supported by a firm and moderately tannic texture. It's nearly dry, too.
Refined-description: This bold boxed wine showing ripe lightly spicy flavor supported firm moderately tannic texture It nearly dry

description: Raspy berry and plum aromas lead to a palate dominated by tartaric acid. That, in turn, leads to sharp berry and plum flavors backed by a bracing finish.
Refined-description: Raspy berry plum aroma lead palate dominated tartaric acid That turn lead sharp berry plum flavor backed bracing finish

description: This opens with aromas of resin and a whiff of dried flower that follow through to the lean palate along with hints of citrus and dried stone fruit. But it's cut short by extremely bitter sensations that recall walnut skin.
Refined-description: This open aroma resin whiff dried flower follow lean palate along hint citrus dried stone fruit But cut short extremely bitter sensation recall walnut skin

description: Basic white-fruit aromas are a bit dusty and yeasty. This feels plump, soft and creamy, with bitter-leaning green melon and papaya flavors. Notes of onion and grape skins rise up on the finish. This is a mix of Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay and Viognier.
Refined-description: Basic whitefruit aroma bit dusty yeasty This feel plump soft creamy bitterleaning green melon papaya flavor Notes onion grape skin rise finish This mix Sauvignon Blanc Chardonnay Viognier

description: This is an earthy blend of Touriga Nacional, Jaen and Trincadeira. Unencumbered by wood aromas, it's full of structured red berry fruit and balanced acidity and is ready to drink.
Refined-description: This earthy blend Touriga Nacional Jaen Trincadeira Unencumbered wood aroma full structured red berry fruit balanced acidity ready drink

description: This is soft and accessible now, with plush notes of baked apple, creamed pear and oaky spice on the attack. The medium-weight palate is broad in feel, begging for a bit more lift to the rich fruit and buttered toast flavors. Drink now.
Refined-description: This soft accessible plush note baked apple creamed pear oaky spice attack The mediumweight palate broad feel begging bit lift rich fruit buttered toast flavor Drink

description: Narrow berry aromas are angular and punchy. This feels high in acidity, with hard tannins. That sharp acidity makes for tart unyielding black plum flavors.
Refined-description: Narrow berry aroma angular punchy This feel high acidity hard tannin That sharp acidity make tart unyielding black plum flavor

description: An aromatic opening of compost and vinegar might suggest casting this aside. But flavors of strawberry and chocolate, along with an admitted weedy note, amount to something decent. Finishing notes of brown sugar and berry syrup are chocolaty and ensure that this finishes better than it begins.
designation: Colección Vivanco Dulce de Invierno Late Harvest
Refined-description: An aromatic opening compost vinegar might suggest casting aside But flavor strawberry chocolate along admitted weedy note amount something decent Finishing note brown sugar berry syrup chocolaty ensure finish better begin

description: This is a fresh and lively white, with some green bean and herbaceous notes to support the core of gooseberry and lime rind aromas and flavors. It's light and straightforward, but clean and so easy to enjoy. Drink now.
Refined-description: This fresh lively white green bean herbaceous note support core gooseberry lime rind aroma flavor It light straightforward clean easy enjoy Drink

description: Already a bit light in color and showing some rust at the rim, this medium-weight, silky-textured wine features aromas of sun-baked clay and cherries. There's not much depth or richness, but the tart fruit makes for an easy quaff. Drink now.
Refined-description: Already bit light color showing rust rim mediumweight silkytextured wine feature aroma sunbaked clay cherry There much depth richness tart fruit make easy quaff Drink

description: This Pinot Noir-heavy sparkler opens with aromas of briny citrus and bready yeast. The palate is fresh and low on weight, with a dominating flavor of pink grapefruit. Overall, this is basic but easy to drink.
Refined-description: This Pinot Noirheavy sparkler open aroma briny citrus bready yeast The palate fresh low weight dominating flavor pink grapefruit Overall basic easy drink

description: This is a simple, tart red, crisp in cranberry and red currant fruit and perfumed with spicy oak. Despite the high acidity on the front palate, it hangs heavy in full-bodied ripeness.
Refined-description: This simple tart red crisp cranberry red currant fruit perfumed spicy oak Despite high acidity front palate hang heavy fullbodied ripeness

description: This straw-colored Chardonnay has aromas of apple and citrus blossom with flavors of creamy apple, vanilla and citrus pith. It has nice weight on the palate with a clean acidic finish.
Refined-description: This strawcolored Chardonnay aroma apple citrus blossom flavor creamy apple vanilla citrus pith It nice weight palate clean acidic finish

description: A clean nose of citrus paves the way for flavors of grapefruit and Sevilla orange. This wine is soft and pleasing on the palate, but it may be touch tart for some tastes.
Refined-description: A clean nose citrus pave way flavor grapefruit Sevilla orange This wine soft pleasing palate may touch tart taste

description: Seduction may be an odd word to use for a Malbec-based wine that is dark and drily tannic. It is structured and firm, with a dry core and black currant fruits. Drink this solid wine from 2017.
Refined-description: Seduction may odd word use Malbecbased wine dark drily tannic It structured firm dry core black currant fruit Drink solid wine 2017

description: Concentrated aromas of blackened oak, blackberry, cassis, licorice and hickory smoke are clarion calls that this is a fully oaked, modern wine. In the mouth, it's heavy and tannic but doesn't trip over itself. Blackberry, cassis, burnt toast and campfire flavors finish equally toasted, peppery, charred and lemony, with chewy tannins. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: Concentrated aroma blackened oak blackberry cassis licorice hickory smoke clarion call fully oaked modern wine In mouth heavy tannic nt trip Blackberry cassis burnt toast campfire flavor finish equally toasted peppery charred lemony chewy tannin Drink 2020

description: With fresh green-apple aromas, and juicy apple and citrus flavors, this is a lively, crisp and well-balanced wine. Instead of going for overt oaky, buttery flavors and a fat mouthfeel, it stays nicely lean and refreshing, even with relatively full body.
Refined-description: With fresh greenapple aroma juicy apple citrus flavor lively crisp wellbalanced wine Instead going overt oaky buttery flavor fat mouthfeel stay nicely lean refreshing even relatively full body

description: Coming from a vineyard near Solvang, this wine by Mikael Sigouin shows orange sponge cake, honey and the slightest twist of petrol on the nose. The palate boasts orange blossoms and bright acidity, gaining complexity from chalky white rocks and the slight bitterness of Japanese pear peels.
Refined-description: Coming vineyard near Solvang wine Mikael Sigouin show orange sponge cake honey slightest twist petrol nose The palate boast orange blossom bright acidity gaining complexity chalky white rock slight bitterness Japanese pear peel

description: Slightly oxidized aromas of marzipan, pressed yellow flowers, dried lemon rinds and apricot cream entice the nose on this wine from the historic vineyard by Joshua Klapper. The palate shows woody spice and a unique iodine character, with cinnamon, salt, sour yeastiness and a touch of tart citrus peel.
Refined-description: Slightly oxidized aroma marzipan pressed yellow flower dried lemon rind apricot cream entice nose wine historic vineyard Joshua Klapper The palate show woody spice unique iodine character cinnamon salt sour yeastiness touch tart citrus peel

description: A hint of honey gives this wine richness while keeping every bit of freshness. It has tangy acidity, a mineral character and apricot and mango fruit flavors. Drink now, although the wine will be better from early 2016.
Refined-description: A hint honey give wine richness keeping every bit freshness It tangy acidity mineral character apricot mango fruit flavor Drink although wine better early 2016

description: Rick Longoria's light winemaking touch even plays into this Spanish grape, which is daintier than regional counterparts. Red and Bing cherries mix with purple flowers, some dried fruit and vanilla paste on the nose. The palate leans herbal, with anise and chopped Italian herbs, also showing brick minerality and oak on the finish. The wine would definitely shine brighter with food.
Refined-description: Rick Longoria light winemaking touch even play Spanish grape daintier regional counterpart Red Bing cherry mix purple flower dried fruit vanilla paste nose The palate lean herbal anise chopped Italian herb also showing brick minerality oak finish The wine would definitely shine brighter food

description: Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah come together to offer scents of red currant, toast, cedar and spice. It's firm and savory, with notes of white pepper, aniseed and dried aromatic herbs alongside assertive tannins. Drink 2016–2020.
Refined-description: Sangiovese Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot Syrah come together offer scent red currant toast cedar spice It firm savory note white pepper aniseed dried aromatic herb alongside assertive tannin Drink 2016–2020

description: A black plum-extract character marks the nose of this wine from the folks behind Los Angeles' historic San Antonio Winery, but it's brown spice that dominates, particularly uncrushed cloves and anise seeds. Dried sour cherry and uncracked peppercorns show on the palate that is presented on rather chewy tannins.
Refined-description: A black plumextract character mark nose wine folk behind Los Angeles historic San Antonio Winery brown spice dominates particularly uncrushed clove anise seed Dried sour cherry uncracked peppercorn show palate presented rather chewy tannin

description: Blueberry, chocolate, mint and clove aromas lead the nose of this blend of 50% Syrah, 35% Cabernet Franc and 15% Petit Verdot. The palate offers dried black cherries, coffee, cinnamon, black pepper and cocoa. Fine-grained tannins provide the framework.
Refined-description: Blueberry chocolate mint clove aroma lead nose blend 50 Syrah 35 Cabernet Franc 15 Petit Verdot The palate offer dried black cherry coffee cinnamon black pepper cocoa Finegrained tannin provide framework

description: Solid berry and cassis aromas are a touch baked on the nose. This is firm, moderately tannic on the palate, with baked plum, blackberry, vanilla and spice flavors. A woody note of maple gains prominence on the finish.
Refined-description: Solid berry cassis aroma touch baked nose This firm moderately tannic palate baked plum blackberry vanilla spice flavor A woody note maple gain prominence finish

description: Full bodied and bold flavored, this is not overwhelmingly dark in color nor pumped up in ripeness. It does emphasize aromas of anise and dried plums, adding flavors of blackberrry juice and a sense of alcoholic strength. It is moderately tannic, while the texture is mouthfilling and the finish rather warm.
Refined-description: Full bodied bold flavored overwhelmingly dark color pumped ripeness It emphasize aroma anise dried plum adding flavor blackberrry juice sense alcoholic strength It moderately tannic texture mouthfilling finish rather warm

description: One barrel was new French oak, the other neutral. The cranberry fruit here is subdued and tart, while the barrel aging brings in popcorn, walnuts and even a trace of butter brickle. Give this bottle until 2017–2017 to open up.
Refined-description: One barrel new French oak neutral The cranberry fruit subdued tart barrel aging brings popcorn walnut even trace butter brickle Give bottle 2017–2017 open

description: Fruity and almost off dry, this appealing wine goes heavy on flavors of spicy pear and apricot jam. A streak of honey runs through, and a hint of wintergreen. It's already drinking well, so dive in.
Refined-description: Fruity almost dry appealing wine go heavy flavor spicy pear apricot jam A streak honey run hint wintergreen It already drinking well dive

description: This fruity, friendly Pinot opens with ripe berry aromas mixed with touches of minerality and latex. It feels fresh and sturdy, with black cherry and raspberry flavors. A pure, sweet, lightly chocolaty finish wraps things up.
Refined-description: This fruity friendly Pinot open ripe berry aroma mixed touch minerality latex It feel fresh sturdy black cherry raspberry flavor A pure sweet lightly chocolaty finish wrap thing

description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 25% Petit Verdot offers aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, blue flowers, vineyard dust and dark cooking spices. The firm palate delivers black currants, licorice, cinnamon, ground pepper and Mediterranean herbs. Bracing tannins offer support and leave an astringent, drying finish.
Refined-description: This blend 50 Cabernet Sauvignon 25 Merlot 25 Petit Verdot offer aroma ripe blackskinned fruit blue flower vineyard dust dark cooking spice The firm palate delivers black currant licorice cinnamon ground pepper Mediterranean herb Bracing tannin offer support leave astringent drying finish

description: Creamy oak, herbal blackberry, vanilla and mild green notes make for an intriguing, spicy nose. A heavy, tannic palate brings the weight and thickness, while flavors of blackberry and boysenberry come with salty notes and a briny, herbal finish.
Refined-description: Creamy oak herbal blackberry vanilla mild green note make intriguing spicy nose A heavy tannic palate brings weight thickness flavor blackberry boysenberry come salty note briny herbal finish

description: Despite the name, this is the value offering, not the reserve, from Soléna. Young, tart and tight, it displays primary fruit flavors of strawberry and raspberry, with sharp, lemony acids. Holding until 2016–2017 may help to smooth it out, but it's perfectly delightful already.
Refined-description: Despite name value offering reserve Soléna Young tart tight display primary fruit flavor strawberry raspberry sharp lemony acid Holding 2016–2017 may help smooth perfectly delightful already

description: Deep purple fruit aromas of dried blackberries and pressed plums benefit from a fresh dill edge as well as a umami element on the nose of this wine from the Rice family, which started making wine in 1990. The acidity and alcohol combine for a tongue-tantalizing sip, with flavors of black cherries and dark herbs.
Refined-description: Deep purple fruit aroma dried blackberry pressed plum benefit fresh dill edge well umami element nose wine Rice family started making wine 1990 The acidity alcohol combine tonguetantalizing sip flavor black cherry dark herb

description: Made entirely from Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of green bell pepper, cedar and an herbaceous whiff of grass. The palate offers mature red currants, raspberries, exotic spice, toasted oak, herb and vanilla alongside bracing tannins. It has a tart, drying finish.
Refined-description: Made entirely Cabernet Franc open aroma green bell pepper cedar herbaceous whiff grass The palate offer mature red currant raspberry exotic spice toasted oak herb vanilla alongside bracing tannin It tart drying finish

description: Brambly cassis and raspberry aromas are warm and a touch cooked. This is bullish, heavy and grabby in feel, with big tannins. Blackberry, cassis, herb and chocolate flavors finish ripe and dark. Drink through 2017.
Refined-description: Brambly cassis raspberry aroma warm touch cooked This bullish heavy grabby feel big tannin Blackberry cassis herb chocolate flavor finish ripe dark Drink 2017

description: The Riesling remains the highlight of this value-oriented lineup, and it's now in a pretty floral package. Bright fruit flavors of orange, tangerine and apricot jam abound, with a clean and fresh mouthfeel. There's a hint of sweetness, but not enough to render it incompatible with most foods.
Refined-description: The Riesling remains highlight valueoriented lineup pretty floral package Bright fruit flavor orange tangerine apricot jam abound clean fresh mouthfeel There hint sweetness enough render incompatible food

description: This is 100% varietal, quite pretty in shades of pale pink, and perfectly dry without turning sour. Flavors of watermelon, pink grapefruit, rosewater and Jonathan apples all come into play. Drink it while the wine retains its youthful freshness.
Refined-description: This 100 varietal quite pretty shade pale pink perfectly dry without turning sour Flavors watermelon pink grapefruit rosewater Jonathan apple come play Drink wine retains youthful freshness

description: Deep blueberry, prune and dried purple aromas are made even more delicious by hints of bacon fat on this blend of 60% Petite Sirah, 30% Syrah, 9% Mourvèdre and 1% Grenache. The vintner lives in the historic Uvas Valley between Gilroy and Morgan Hill. Purple fruit juiciness is balanced by a sharp licorice edge, framed by judicious acidity and tannins.
Refined-description: Deep blueberry prune dried purple aroma made even delicious hint bacon fat blend 60 Petite Sirah 30 Syrah 9 Mourvèdre 1 Grenache The vintner life historic Uvas Valley Gilroy Morgan Hill Purple fruit juiciness balanced sharp licorice edge framed judicious acidity tannin

description: Aromas of underbrush, black fruit, toast and espresso lead the nose on the blend of Sangiovese and 15% Malvasia Nera. The palate is still resting heavily on its oak, showing coffee, coconut, vanilla and mocha, along with dried black cherry, prune and clove. The raspy tannins need to soften up but the fruit richness is already drying up.
Refined-description: Aromas underbrush black fruit toast espresso lead nose blend Sangiovese 15 Malvasia Nera The palate still resting heavily oak showing coffee coconut vanilla mocha along dried black cherry prune clove The raspy tannin need soften fruit richness already drying

description: This is a serious, wood-aged wine whose ripe fruits are dominated at the moment by heavy toast flavors. The fruit does offer weight and good potential, making it a structured, dark wine that is beginning to suggest a juicy future. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: This serious woodaged wine whose ripe fruit dominated moment heavy toast flavor The fruit offer weight good potential making structured dark wine beginning suggest juicy future Drink 2017

description: This is a herbal, earthy wine with as many tannins as fruit at this stage. That gives it a dense, dusty texture that seeps into the ripe, sweet plum flavors. With the wood giving an extra push of richness as well as spice, it needs to age. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: This herbal earthy wine many tannin fruit stage That give dense dusty texture seeps ripe sweet plum flavor With wood giving extra push richness well spice need age Drink 2017

description: To judge by the weight of the bottle, this is regarded as an important wine by the producer. The wine inside is attractive and fruity, ripe with berry fruits and considerable freshness. The tannins give the power for the bottle, dry and dense at this young stage. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: To judge weight bottle regarded important wine producer The wine inside attractive fruity ripe berry fruit considerable freshness The tannin give power bottle dry dense young stage Drink 2017

description: Briny aromas of bell pepper, jalapeño and canned pea are green-leaning but not overly vegetal. This has a round mouthfeel and ample body to absorb the wine's acidity, while flavors of celery, bell pepper, lime and tangerine come with a strong grassy accent and a persistent, briny tasting finish.
Refined-description: Briny aroma bell pepper jalapeño canned pea greenleaning overly vegetal This round mouthfeel ample body absorb wine acidity flavor celery bell pepper lime tangerine come strong grassy accent persistent briny tasting finish

description: This is a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier (CSV). From estate vineyards in the Cahors region, it is a young wine, still developing its potentially aromatic character, fragrant acidity and rich pineapple and red apple flavors. Hold this wine and drink from late 2016.
Refined-description: This blend Chardonnay Sauvignon Blanc Viognier CSV From estate vineyard Cahors region young wine still developing potentially aromatic character fragrant acidity rich pineapple red apple flavor Hold wine drink late 2016

description: This opens with aromas of toast, weedy underbrush and tobacco. The palate offers stewed plum marinated in spirits, anisette and coffee but not much fruit richness. Bracing tannins give it an astringent finish.
Refined-description: This open aroma toast weedy underbrush tobacco The palate offer stewed plum marinated spirit anisette coffee much fruit richness Bracing tannin give astringent finish

description: Pretty aromas of violet, rose and wild berry lead the nose. The bright but rather lean palate offers raw red berry, peppercorn and saline together with notes of dried sage. Astringent tannins create an abrupt finish.
Refined-description: Pretty aroma violet rose wild berry lead nose The bright rather lean palate offer raw red berry peppercorn saline together note dried sage Astringent tannin create abrupt finish

description: Aromas are dominated by oak with accents of vanilla, cocoa and woodspice along with cranberries, rose hips, herbs and raspberries. The palate is elegant with herb and cherry flavors that lead to a tart, cranberry-filled finish.
Refined-description: Aromas dominated oak accent vanilla cocoa woodspice along cranberry rose hip herb raspberry The palate elegant herb cherry flavor lead tart cranberryfilled finish

description: Warm and robust, this has aromas of underbrush, spiced plum, grilled sage, leather and a balsamic note. The tightly wound palate offers dried berry, fig, menthol and licorice alongside super-astringent tannins and the heat of alcohol. A note of roasted coffee bean signals the close.
Refined-description: Warm robust aroma underbrush spiced plum grilled sage leather balsamic note The tightly wound palate offer dried berry fig menthol licorice alongside superastringent tannin heat alcohol A note roasted coffee bean signal close

description: Though just five years old, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Merlot already seems quite tired, with notes of leather, dried red fruit and mushroom taking the lead. It has a pleasing, silky feel but the tart fruit flavors seem past their prime.
Refined-description: Though five year old blend Cabernet Sauvignon Petit Verdot Merlot already seems quite tired note leather dried red fruit mushroom taking lead It pleasing silky feel tart fruit flavor seem past prime

description: Big, fresh and juicy, this is a bright and forward wine. Attractive smoky tannins are layered with fresh acidity and black currant flavors. The wine is already attractive, although there are enough tannins for it to age. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Big fresh juicy bright forward wine Attractive smoky tannin layered fresh acidity black currant flavor The wine already attractive although enough tannin age Drink 2017

description: This wine is all fruit, crisp and with plenty of herbaceousness. A smoother character comes from the Sémillon in the blend that also gives richness. The wood aging shows only lightly, leaving fruitiness at the end.
Refined-description: This wine fruit crisp plenty herbaceousness A smoother character come Sémillon blend also give richness The wood aging show lightly leaving fruitiness end

description: Produced from young vines, this is the third wine of Larrivet Haut-Brion. As such, it is very accessible with its ripe, red exuberant fruits. The tannins are in the background, giving the necessary structure to a wine that will age quickly. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Produced young vine third wine Larrivet HautBrion As accessible ripe red exuberant fruit The tannin background giving necessary structure wine age quickly Drink 2017

description: The dryness and tannins of this wine are on the outside. Inside it has plenty of juicy fruit, sweet acidity and black plum flavors. Put the two together and this ripe wine offers plenty of potential. Drink from 2019.
Refined-description: The dryness tannin wine outside Inside plenty juicy fruit sweet acidity black plum flavor Put two together ripe wine offer plenty potential Drink 2019

description: Hugely ripe Merlot is at the core of this rich wine. It is opulent, rounded and packed with dark plum-juice flavors. It verges on too much, too rich and too generous. What redeems it is the Bordeaux structure and final dry aftertaste.
Refined-description: Hugely ripe Merlot core rich wine It opulent rounded packed dark plumjuice flavor It verge much rich generous What redeems Bordeaux structure final dry aftertaste

description: Nearly equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this wine is perfumed in lavender and awash in juicy red cassis. The acidity is medium to high, while the tannins are rough and chewy, suggesting the need for assimilation time.
Refined-description: Nearly equal part Cabernet Sauvignon Cabernet Franc Merlot wine perfumed lavender awash juicy red cassis The acidity medium high tannin rough chewy suggesting need assimilation time

description: The nose isn't very expressive, but the palate offers mature blackberry, dried cherry, ground pepper, espresso and anise alonside assertive, astringent tannins. The dried fruit shows the heat of the vintage so best to drink soon.
Refined-description: The nose nt expressive palate offer mature blackberry dried cherry ground pepper espresso anise alonside assertive astringent tannin The dried fruit show heat vintage best drink soon

description: Oodles of black cherry and boysenberry fill the aromas and flavors of this bold but not-too-big wine. The rich, ripe fruit shows right away in the nose, and continues on the palate but gets reined in a bit (in a good way) by a firm texture created by good acidity and tannins.
Refined-description: Oodles black cherry boysenberry fill aroma flavor bold nottoobig wine The rich ripe fruit show right away nose continues palate get reined bit good way firm texture created good acidity tannin

description: Extremely fruity and rich, this stops just short of sweetness while delivering delicious cherry, mixed berry and plum flavors with just a touch of tannin and acidity to keep it fresh. It is quite full bodied and ready to drink now.
Refined-description: Extremely fruity rich stop short sweetness delivering delicious cherry mixed berry plum flavor touch tannin acidity keep fresh It quite full bodied ready drink

description: This 100% varietal wine offers aromas of fresh-ground coffee, chocolate, herbs and plum along with barrel accents. It's soft in feel with an elegant styling, trailing toward the finish.
Refined-description: This 100 varietal wine offer aroma freshground coffee chocolate herb plum along barrel accent It soft feel elegant styling trailing toward finish

description: The 60% Cabernet in the blend gives a dark fruit character. At this young stage, the wood aging still dominates with its burnt toast and chocolate character. For the future, while the wine will be dry, it also has plenty of fresh fruit. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: The 60 Cabernet blend give dark fruit character At young stage wood aging still dominates burnt toast chocolate character For future wine dry also plenty fresh fruit Drink 2018

description: This single-vineyard wine offers wild blueberry with vanilla and herb accents. It's full bodied and high-octane in feel with the flavors running straight down the fairway.
Refined-description: This singlevineyard wine offer wild blueberry vanilla herb accent It full bodied highoctane feel flavor running straight fairway

description: Grass and gooseberry are prominent on the nose and palate in this crisp SB, bright in dialed-high acidity. That sense of vibrant freshness mellows somewhat midway through the wine, allowing it to finish with a lushness on the tongue.
Refined-description: Grass gooseberry prominent nose palate crisp SB bright dialedhigh acidity That sense vibrant freshness mellows somewhat midway wine allowing finish lushness tongue

description: Generous sweet-tasting oak flavor coats the fresh plum and red cherry flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It has a broad, velvety texture, and shows good balance between ripeness, acidity and firm tannins. It finishes with a soft touch.
Refined-description: Generous sweettasting oak flavor coat fresh plum red cherry flavor mediumbodied wine It broad velvety texture show good balance ripeness acidity firm tannin It finish soft touch

description: This wine hails from Lawrence and Antoine Creek vineyards and was barrel-fermented in new French oak before being moved to stainless steel. It starts out quite reduced and then opens to show notes of peach, pear and mineral. It's rounded and lightly oily in feel, tapering on the back half.

description: Tech sheets hint at Stagecoach Vineyard being involved somehow in this Syrah, a chewy expression of coconut, smoke and game around a dense, concentrated body and well-integrated tannins. The finish is all about mocha.

description: This straightforward wine from the Riboli family portfolio goes down very easy, making it perfect for backyard barbecues. Cherries, dried rose petals and anise greet the nose. The palate isn't too complex, but delivers dark red fruits and pepper spices.

description: There are a lot of varieties in this blend, from Merlot, which makes up the majority, to handfuls of Syrah, Zinfandel and Petit Verdot. Sizable tannins wrap themselves around flavors of tobacco, juicy plum and oaky vanilla, finishing dry and ripe.

description: Among the well-differentiated single vineyard selections from Soléna in 2014, this may be the most instantly enjoyable. It's a big, mouth-coating wine, a full-flavored burst of chocolate-covered cherries. Lighter notes of coffee and tobacco filter in through the extended finish.

description: Aromas of iris, rose, dark-skinned berry and a whiff of baking spice lead nose. The juicy, easy-drinking palate doles out fleshy wild cherry, black raspberry and black pepper alongside bright acidity and supple tannins. Chill this down for the perfect summer red.

description: Aromas of this wine show considerable wood. On the palate, the wood is very present, giving acidity as well as layers of toast and spice. Hints of yellow fruit show through, suggesting the possibility of a ripe, rich wine in the future. Drink from 2019.

Refined-description: A soft stony scent pebble faintest melon signal fresh clean wine The palate play aroma softly also precision That stoniness lingers dry gentle finish lasting flavor fresh apple peel

description: Subtle hints of ripe, winter-stored apple on the nose lead to an equally apple-dominated palate that shows soft pepper spice. A wonderful midpalate texture and baked-apple richness are countered by lemon freshness. This is very appetizing and cries out for soft cheeses.

description: The Dead Arm is always firmly structured, making it one of the more challenging Shiraz to judge in its youth. The 2010 is full-bodied and chewy, characterized by dark, earthy and umami notes of roasted meat, asphalt and grilled mushrooms. The length and ripely tannic nature of the finish is reassuring. Drink 2018–2030.
Refined-description: The Dead Arm always firmly structured making one challenging Shiraz judge youth The 2010 fullbodied chewy characterized dark earthy umami note roasted meat asphalt grilled mushroom The length ripely tannic nature finish reassuring Drink 2018–2030

description: Chocolate and blackberry form an impressively generous and full-bodied personality in this 100% varietal wine aged 22 months in a hearty percentage of new oak. Big tannin and traces of cigar and espresso continue on the brawny theme.

description: An earthy wine that offers complexity around a full-bodied juiciness of blackberry and bitter black tea, this is made in a big style and will appeal to fans of concentration and decisive use of oak.

description: Opulent blackberry aromas and a mouthful of jammy, grapey but dry fruit flavors put a lot of oomph into this focused, concentrated and well-balanced wine. It is just tart and tannic enough to pair easily with rich food, and those same qualities should help it mellow with age through 2020.

description: This full-bodied and densely textured wine has a deep color, aromas like wood smoke and blackberries, and flavors that saturate the palate with berries, clove and dark chocolate notes. It's bold in body, has plenty of tannins for grip, and a lingering, rich finish.

description: Allowing Zinfandel to take the 60% lead in this marriage with Cabernet Sauvignon, this is an impressive mingling of the two. Black pepper, clove and leathery cigar fuel a high-powered succulence of black and red fruit accented by a smoky drawl.

description: Generous fruit and spice flavors and a full, chewy mouthfeel make this an appetizing wine to pair with big food. It smells like black cherries, tastes ripe and berry-like and has accents of cinnamon and cardamom. The texture is supportive and lightly astringent, with fine tannins.

description: Spicy, herbal plum and cassis aromas mix in notes of olive and wet dog fur. This is more spunky and fresh than dense. Leafy berry, plum and olive are the key flavors on this Carmenère-led blend that finishes herbal and spicy, with high-toned residual acidity.

description: Smoky, oaky, charred flavors of savory plum and berry lead to a full, layered palate with slightly abrasive tannins. This tastes of grilled beef, lemon peel, toast, cassis and chocolate. A toasted character remains on a solid finish. Drink through 2020.

description: Dried purple flowers and dark cardamom spices are layered across aromas of blackberry, roast beef, soy, jerky and peppercorn on the nose of this blend of 52% Syrah, 40% Mourvèdre and 8% Grenache. A solid, nearly chewy structure unveils dark flavors of beef char, pencil lead, blueberries and a touch of asphalt.

description: Aromas of gingerbread cookies with a black-cherry glaze meet black gravel and a touch of asphalt on the nose of this complex and flavorful bottling. The palate blends the brightness of red cherry and strawberry fruit with a rocky minerality, spiced up by black pepper and settling into a plum-skin groove toward the finish.

description: While relatively full-bodied and tannic, this wine also has friendly, fresh berry and cherry flavors that are held in place by very firm acidity and tannins. It feels and tastes generous but also strong and taut, so it should improve with a little time. Best to drink now through 2020.

description: A dusting of crushed slate and saffron accents this zesty lime and honey kissed Kabinett. It's dancingly light on the palate, but concentrated with swirls of marmalade and orange-peel flavors that extend through a long finish. Drink now through 2025.
Refined-description: A dusting crushed slate saffron accent zesty lime honey kissed Kabinett It dancingly light palate concentrated swirl marmalade orangepeel flavor extend long finish Drink 2025

Along the road are aromas of burnt banana and toasted bread along with flavors of arugula, lime and dried apple. An elegant finish with stone-fruit and green-herb notes is sophisticated.

description: Fresh whiffs of strawberry and blossom go hand-in-hand with more evolved complexities of mushroom and yeast in this invigorating rosé sparkling. While delicately moussed, it's Pinot-Noir heavy blend lends a satisfyingly voluminous feel to the palate.

description: Brilliantly fresh, this wine is tight with acidity and textured with zingy citrus. Layers of apple and toast are already integrated in this bright wine. It's tangy, lively and likely to be ready to drink from 2017. The wine comes from the highest vineyard in Chassagne.
Refined-description: Brilliantly fresh wine tight acidity textured zingy citrus Layers apple toast already integrated bright wine It tangy lively likely ready drink 2017 The wine come highest vineyard Chassagne

description: Produced from the rare Romorantin grape, this wine is honeyed as well as crisp and fragrantly fruity. The 50-year-old vines give extra concentration to this lightly wood-aged wine that is ripe while also light and poised. Drink now, although it would be better to keep it until 2017.

description: Part of the same family business as Philippe Girard's wines (Benoît is his brother), this is a ripe, pure and clean wine. Perfumed acidity and zesty flavors are integrated into the rich green fruit. Apples and green plums dominate this refreshing wine that will develop. Drink from 2017.

description: This is a spicy, earthy and medium-bodied selection, lengthy and concentrated in cardamom and forest pine. The fruit tends dark and brooding, with a brambly character balanced against the crispness of acidity. The spiciness persists through the finish.

description: Damp sagebrush, dark cranberry, buttered black cherries, fresh plucked marjoram and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling. The tip of the sip shows great thyme, bay leaf and anise character, then settles into rich cranberry fruit, all held together by a decent tannic grip. The dark fruit flavors linger deep in the finish.

description: This amontillado smells complete, with a tight aromatic mix of raw wood, brine, citrus and dried stone fruits. The palate is racy, with razor-like acidity. Intense flavors of dried apricot, tart nectarine and almond skins finish full  and lasting, with cutting acidity.

description: Wild cherry, rose, spice and chopped sage aromas come together on this round, savory wine. The juicy palate offers fleshy black cherry, raspberry, star anise and a coffee note set in a framework of polished tannins. Drink through 2018.

description: A blend of 85% Sangiovese, 10% Colorino and 5% Canaiolo, this offers pretty aromas of pressed rose, violet, berry, menthol and a whiff of ground cooking spice. The linear palate offers mature black cherry, orange zest, clove, white pepper, licorice and a hint of pipe tobacco alongside firm, fine-grained tannins.

description: Black fruits, fine herbs and horsehide carry the aromas of this offering. In the mouth, this is firm and well built, with integrated tannins. Savory flavors of soy sauce and roast plum share space with bolder, riper cherry notes, while a warm, earthy finish tastes of roasted plum and berry. Drink through 2021.

description: Mostly Sangiovese with 5% Colorino and made by refermenting with partially dried grapes, this wine offers aromas of dried plum, clove, scorched earth and a balsamic note. The concentrated palate offers dried black cherry, raisin, licorice and a note of ground pepper that lead to a firm finish.

description: Luminous and fresh, this opens with aromas of red berry, violet, chopped herb and a whiff of baking spice. The vibrant, linear palate offers red cherry, strawberry, white pepper and star anise alongside racy acidity and polished tannins. Enjoy through 2018.

description: Pressed violet, perfumed berry and a hint of baking spice aromas unfold on this sleek, savory red. The medium-bodied palate delivers ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon, clove and star anise alongside firm, polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

description: Red berry, chopped herb, blue flower and menthol all come together on this elegantly structured red. The juicy, accessible palate offers ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and a hint of vanilla alongside round tannins. Drink through 2021.

description: A dark nose of black tobacco, condensed violets, soy, black pepper, black plum and aromatic wood shows on the nose of this wine from a longtime Paso estate, now owned by the Foley family. The palate offers an intriguing sense of black pepper and dried violets, followed by lavender, thyme, rosemary and elderberry laid across fine-grained but structured tannins.

description: Winemaker Mark McNeilly from Mark Ryan Winery makes this estate grown Viognier, and works it in the same strong, substantial, concentrated style as his own release. The mix of concrete and neutral oak fermentation brings out some nice floral highlights and a light hint of toast. The length and flavor development through the long finish are exceptional.
