description: Unctuous and ripe in caramel and toasty aromas, this is deep golden in color but completely crisp and balanced in the glass. The nose is so overwhelming that the flavors take time to show. Once they do, it's a celebration of green apple and melon enveloped in complex minerality and a supple body.
Refined-description: Unctuous ripe caramel toasty aroma deep golden color completely crisp balanced glass The nose overwhelming flavor take time show Once celebration green apple melon enveloped complex minerality supple body

description: The aromas of this Chardonnay are zesty and fresh yet rich, with barrel smoke, caramelized pear and vanilla tones. The integration continues on the palate, with a bit of oak followed by apple, white peach, nectarine and lime zest. It's flavorful and enjoyable now.
Refined-description: The aroma Chardonnay zesty fresh yet rich barrel smoke caramelized pear vanilla tone The integration continues palate bit oak followed apple white peach nectarine lime zest It flavorful enjoyable

description: Deep, pure cassis and red berry aromas are integrated and thorough. This Bordeaux-style blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Merlot is racy, tight and hard-driving, with bold berry, pepper, baking spice and chocolate flavors. A toasty, peppery finish is juicy, forward and long. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: Deep pure cassis red berry aroma integrated thorough This Bordeauxstyle blend Cabernet Sauvignon Petit Verdot Cabernet Franc Merlot racy tight harddriving bold berry pepper baking spice chocolate flavor A toasty peppery finish juicy forward long Drink 2020

description: An enticing fragrance of rose, blue flower, incense and truffle wafts out of the glass. On the palate, accents of black pepper, espresso and licorice add depth to the bright cherry-berry fruit, while polished tannins give it a smooth, silky texture. It's well balanced and fresh. Drink 2018–2030.
Refined-description: An enticing fragrance rose blue flower incense truffle waft glass On palate accent black pepper espresso licorice add depth bright cherryberry fruit polished tannin give smooth silky texture It well balanced fresh Drink 2018–2030

description: Pure fruitiness with a deliciously tangy texture mark this wine. It has a rich, juicy character with light spice to highlight the green fruits and zesty bitter orange flavor. At the moment, the wine is all fruit and it needs to age to bring out the greater depth. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Pure fruitiness deliciously tangy texture mark wine It rich juicy character light spice highlight green fruit zesty bitter orange flavor At moment wine fruit need age bring greater depth Drink 2017

description: Sweet oak, vanilla, plum, violet and mocha aromas lead the nose on this structured wine. The oak influence carries over to the palate together with ripe black cherry, leather and baking spice. The tightly compacted tannins need time to unwind. Drink 2020–2035.
Refined-description: Sweet oak vanilla plum violet mocha aroma lead nose structured wine The oak influence carry palate together ripe black cherry leather baking spice The tightly compacted tannin need time unwind Drink 2020–2035

description: Underbrush, tobacco leaf, leather, truffle and blackberry aromas take center stage along with whiffs of toast and fig. The palate shows black cherry, carob, bitter cocoa, white pepper and sage alongside bracing tannins that leave a drying finish.
Refined-description: Underbrush tobacco leaf leather truffle blackberry aroma take center stage along whiff toast fig The palate show black cherry carob bitter cocoa white pepper sage alongside bracing tannin leave drying finish

description: A brand new vineyard designation for the winery, Bedrock dates to the 1800s and is being made famous by proprietor Joel Peterson of Ravenswood and his son, Morgan Twain Peterson. This wine does the site justice, a smooth concoction of cherry pit and allspice, elegant and yet plenty generous in fruit and structure, measured by natural acidity.
Refined-description: A brand new vineyard designation winery Bedrock date 1800s made famous proprietor Joel Peterson Ravenswood son Morgan Twain Peterson This wine site justice smooth concoction cherry pit allspice elegant yet plenty generous fruit structure measured natural acidity

description: Buttered sourdough toast and a slight nuttiness kick off another excellent Chardonnay from the ever-reliable Talley. The palate is greeted with minerality that fades into an apple butter flavor alongside a pinch of cinnamon, culminating in a graceful vanilla finish.
Refined-description: Buttered sourdough toast slight nuttiness kick another excellent Chardonnay everreliable Talley The palate greeted minerality fade apple butter flavor alongside pinch cinnamon culminating graceful vanilla finish

description: Made entirely of Pinot Nero, this elegant, structured sparkler opens with aromas of rose, berry and yeasty sensations of freshly baked butter cookies. The palate delivers a nice depth of flavors including tart red apple, wild strawberry, sage and marjoram alongside brisk acidity and an elegant, persistent mousse. It's already delicious but will also age well over the next few years. Drink through 2019.
Refined-description: Made entirely Pinot Nero elegant structured sparkler open aroma rose berry yeasty sensation freshly baked butter cooky The palate delivers nice depth flavor including tart red apple wild strawberry sage marjoram alongside brisk acidity elegant persistent mousse It already delicious also age well next year Drink 2019

description: Fresh and refined, this has an intensely fruity nose of wild berry, forest floor, pine and rose petal. The bright palate doles out crushed strawberry, Morello cherry, vanilla and cinnamon alongside smooth, supple tannins and bright acidity. Nicely balanced and focused. Drink through 2025.
Refined-description: Fresh refined intensely fruity nose wild berry forest floor pine rose petal The bright palate dole crushed strawberry Morello cherry vanilla cinnamon alongside smooth supple tannin bright acidity Nicely balanced focused Drink 2025

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is slightly austere in style, with plum and blackberry tones providing weight. Some tannins and acidity accompany its fine, fruity core, giving a more serious note to this wine. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: This lightly woodaged wine slightly austere style plum blackberry tone providing weight Some tannin acidity accompany fine fruity core giving serious note wine Drink 2018

description: Still dark and dense, this young wine has power and structure on its side. The tannins and concentrated firm texture promise aging, allowing the big black fruits to be released. Made from vines in the Douro Superior; drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Still dark dense young wine power structure side The tannin concentrated firm texture promise aging allowing big black fruit released Made vine Douro Superior drink 2017

description: The wine is crisp, packed with grapefruit flavors and with a tight texture that suggests it could age. A tang and a steely acidity comes in behind the fruit and offers an austere aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: The wine crisp packed grapefruit flavor tight texture suggests could age A tang steely acidity come behind fruit offer austere aftertaste Drink 2017

description: A stellar wine at Kiona for decades, this includes 11% Gewürztraminer in the blend, and is finished at 83 g/L residual sugar. The palate impression is more juicy than sweet, with rich fruit flavors of ripe grapefruit, peach and apricot. The balance, acidity, length and texture are spot on.
Refined-description: A stellar wine Kiona decade includes 11 Gewürztraminer blend finished 83 gL residual sugar The palate impression juicy sweet rich fruit flavor ripe grapefruit peach apricot The balance acidity length texture spot

description: Jet-black aromatics of creosote, charred meats, pepper and plum-blackberry jam make an excellent entry point for this wine from a vineyard in the new Ballard Canyon appellation. Blackberry sauce leads the palate, with espresso bitterness and strong acidity throughout. A powerful but beautiful Syrah.
Refined-description: Jetblack aromatics creosote charred meat pepper plumblackberry jam make excellent entry point wine vineyard new Ballard Canyon appellation Blackberry sauce lead palate espresso bitterness strong acidity throughout A powerful beautiful Syrah

description: Lightly toasted tobacco, blueberry pie and cedar scents lead the way on this single-vineyard Cab. Fresh blueberry on the palate combines with a great arc of flavors that ends in a chewed cigar finish.
Refined-description: Lightly toasted tobacco blueberry pie cedar scent lead way singlevineyard Cab Fresh blueberry palate combine great arc flavor end chewed cigar finish

description: Pure Merlot from the Stillwater Creek Vineyard, this finished its fermentation in concrete egg, then spent 20 months in 100% new French oak, and another two years in bottle prior to release. Tightly wound and dense with cherry and chocolate layered throughout, it brings in flavors of red licorice and baking spices. The tannins are silky and the structure and flavors are bold.
Refined-description: Pure Merlot Stillwater Creek Vineyard finished fermentation concrete egg spent 20 month 100 new French oak another two year bottle prior release Tightly wound dense cherry chocolate layered throughout brings flavor red licorice baking spice The tannin silky structure flavor bold

description: Many red wines from Epiphany, run by the family of the late actor Fess Parker, have a nose-tickling singed-cedar aroma. It works great on this blend of 57% Syrah and 43% Cabernet Sauvignon, leading into a palate heavy with espresso and dark chocolate-dipped cherries, culminating in a mocha finish.
Refined-description: Many red wine Epiphany run family late actor Fess Parker nosetickling singedcedar aroma It work great blend 57 Syrah 43 Cabernet Sauvignon leading palate heavy espresso dark chocolatedipped cherry culminating mocha finish

description: This is the second vintage release for the estate vineyard, which occupies the highest planted portion of Red Mountain. Precise, sharp-edged, high-acid red-fruit flavors of berry and cherry seem stacked vertically, with a strong mineral underpinning. The alcohol is a bit high, but overall the structure holds together and would support further aging; drink now–2022.
Refined-description: This second vintage release estate vineyard occupies highest planted portion Red Mountain Precise sharpedged highacid redfruit flavor berry cherry seem stacked vertically strong mineral underpinning The alcohol bit high overall structure hold together would support aging drink now–2022

description: An aromatic profile of crushed mint, hot gravel and red fruit introduces this blend of 83% Grenache and 17% Mourvèdre. It's lightweight on the palate, but with complex flavors of herb and spice that swirl around a core of blackberry fruit and finish with mouthwatering acidity.
Refined-description: An aromatic profile crushed mint hot gravel red fruit introduces blend 83 Grenache 17 Mourvèdre It lightweight palate complex flavor herb spice swirl around core blackberry fruit finish mouthwatering acidity

description: Reedy, berry aromas come with a shot of eucalyptus, which is very Chilean. A tight, tannic, dry palate is exact and intense. Flavors of leafy and slightly herbal black fruits are matched by licorice and coffee notes, while the finish is long, dry, snappy and loaded with earthy spice notes and hints of olive and mint. Drink through 2019.
Refined-description: Reedy berry aroma come shot eucalyptus Chilean A tight tannic dry palate exact intense Flavors leafy slightly herbal black fruit matched licorice coffee note finish long dry snappy loaded earthy spice note hint olive mint Drink 2019

description: An aromatically vibrant wine with notes of slate, peach, apricot and citrus. It drinks off dry, with exquisitely balanced acidity and a lot of depth and richness to the fruit flavors. Impressive stuff.
Refined-description: An aromatically vibrant wine note slate peach apricot citrus It drink dry exquisitely balanced acidity lot depth richness fruit flavor Impressive stuff

description: This blend of 50% Syrah, 23% Petite Sirah, 17% Mourvèdre and 10% Grenache presents a delicious strawberry cake nose, backed up with dried purple flowers and cigar box backbone. On the palate, elegant purple fruits are laced with leather and pepper, finishing with a cleansing tartness.
Refined-description: This blend 50 Syrah 23 Petite Sirah 17 Mourvèdre 10 Grenache present delicious strawberry cake nose backed dried purple flower cigar box backbone On palate elegant purple fruit laced leather pepper finishing cleansing tartness

description: This is the first vintage for this blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Sangiovese. Ripe, lush and complex, it offers flavors of plum and cassis, with an appealing texture and moderately gripping tannins. There's life and snap to the finish, and though it's already delicious just two years after the vintage, another year or two of bottle age should see it continue to improve.
Refined-description: This first vintage blend 75 Cabernet Sauvignon 25 Sangiovese Ripe lush complex offer flavor plum cassis appealing texture moderately gripping tannin There life snap finish though already delicious two year vintage another year two bottle age see continue improve

description: This is balanced and elegant in subtle pear, ginger and lemon. A fine food wine, it's ideal for roast chicken in herbes de Provence or ratatouille. Located in the Petaluma Gap and the source of grapes for several wines, Sun Chase was bought in 2013 by Guarachi Family Wines.
Refined-description: This balanced elegant subtle pear ginger lemon A fine food wine ideal roast chicken herbes de Provence ratatouille Located Petaluma Gap source grape several wine Sun Chase bought 2013 Guarachi Family Wines

description: This cloudy, amber-colored wine isn't for the faint of heart. Made from ancient Grecanico, Carricante and Catarratto vines on the slopes of Mt. Etna and aged in terra cotta amphorae, it's mineral-driven with intense flint, smoke, nectarine, citrus, ginger, white pepper and balsamic sensations supported by an acidic backbone. Boasting great depth and complexity, it evolves continuously in the glass.
Refined-description: This cloudy ambercolored wine nt faint heart Made ancient Grecanico Carricante Catarratto vine slope Mt Etna aged terra cotta amphora mineraldriven intense flint smoke nectarine citrus ginger white pepper balsamic sensation supported acidic backbone Boasting great depth complexity evolves continuously glass

description: Aromas of crushed plum, asphalt, oak, toast, exotic spice and forest floor lead the nose. The palate delivers black cherry, mocha, licorice and mineral alongside bracing, tightly woven tannins that need time to unwind. Drink 2017–2031.
Refined-description: Aromas crushed plum asphalt oak toast exotic spice forest floor lead nose The palate delivers black cherry mocha licorice mineral alongside bracing tightly woven tannin need time unwind Drink 2017–2031

description: This is a wonderfully balanced wine, bursting with ripe spice as well as acidity. It's a rich wine, now showing maturity without losing its fruit. The depth of flavor, drilling right down to the mineral structure, is impressive. Drink now, although also wait until 2016.
Refined-description: This wonderfully balanced wine bursting ripe spice well acidity It rich wine showing maturity without losing fruit The depth flavor drilling right mineral structure impressive Drink although also wait 2016

description: The color of this Malbec and the legs it gives off help separate it from the pack. A plush nose shows unabsorbed oak and char along with deep berry and cassis notes. Total saturation on the palate matches the nose, and this tastes of chocolate, mocha, wood spice and rich berry fruits. Oak is currently speaking the loudest on the finish. Drink through 2023.
Refined-description: The color Malbec leg give help separate pack A plush nose show unabsorbed oak char along deep berry cassis note Total saturation palate match nose taste chocolate mocha wood spice rich berry fruit Oak currently speaking loudest finish Drink 2023

description: The floral perfume of this cool-climate bottling is intense—all lavender accented with black pepper, white pepper and thyme. Tart black plum skin flavors lead the palate, building towards savory elements that recall dried purple flowers, thyme, rosemary and black pepper. Medium bodied and dense, it will be versatile with food.
Refined-description: The floral perfume coolclimate bottling intense—all lavender accented black pepper white pepper thyme Tart black plum skin flavor lead palate building towards savory element recall dried purple flower thyme rosemary black pepper Medium bodied dense versatile food

description: Sourced from the producer's Stanly Ranch Estate Vineyard and Hyde Vineyard, both in Carneros, this is a stunning effort. Its baked pear fruit provides hefty body and texture, while honeysuckle and apple blossom notes and a squeeze of lemon-like acidity keep it balanced and fresh.
Refined-description: Sourced producer Stanly Ranch Estate Vineyard Hyde Vineyard Carneros stunning effort Its baked pear fruit provides hefty body texture honeysuckle apple blossom note squeeze lemonlike acidity keep balanced fresh

description: This is an impressively ripe and solidly fruity wine. Blending mainly Tannat with Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon, it is certainly structured. But it is the brilliant black fruit that gives this wine its real character and density. It is impressive, and obviously made for the long haul. Drink from 2021.
Refined-description: This impressively ripe solidly fruity wine Blending mainly Tannat Cabernet Franc Cabernet Sauvignon certainly structured But brilliant black fruit give wine real character density It impressive obviously made long haul Drink 2021

description: Bob Lindquist shows his mastery of cool-climate fruit with this bottling, which is redolent of asphalt, cracked black pepper, rosemary, lavender and damson plum. It's fairly light in body but strong in tarry structure, offering loads of cracked peppercorn flavor with its juicy purple fruit.
Refined-description: Bob Lindquist show mastery coolclimate fruit bottling redolent asphalt cracked black pepper rosemary lavender damson plum It fairly light body strong tarry structure offering load cracked peppercorn flavor juicy purple fruit

description: This feral and gamy wine shows roast lamb, rosemary, dried fennel, rose petal and forest floor aromas on its dynamic nose. The palate leads with explosive acidity, before waves of Concord grape and blackberry flavor take hold. It's light on its feet but has some textural firmness, finishing on rosemary, lavender and game notes.
Refined-description: This feral gamy wine show roast lamb rosemary dried fennel rose petal forest floor aroma dynamic nose The palate lead explosive acidity wave Concord grape blackberry flavor take hold It light foot textural firmness finishing rosemary lavender game note

description: Light gold in color, this wine is focused and bright. A jasmine aroma and succulent green-apple flavor pairs with steely minerality, offering power and grace in one satisfying package.
Refined-description: Light gold color wine focused bright A jasmine aroma succulent greenapple flavor pair steely minerality offering power grace one satisfying package

description: Aged in wood, this wine is rich and spicy. Its fruit though is beautifully in balance, ripe with raspberry and red-currant fruits that are shot through with lemon acidity. This is a full-bodied wine, impressively structured and likely to age for a year or two. It is named after the 946 steps up the mountain behind the estate. Drink from late 2017.
Refined-description: Aged wood wine rich spicy Its fruit though beautifully balance ripe raspberry redcurrant fruit shot lemon acidity This fullbodied wine impressively structured likely age year two It named 946 step mountain behind estate Drink late 2017

description: This lightly wood-aged wine, from an estate that has only changed hands three times in 400 years, is crisp, tight and very young. It has fine potential for the future. There are elegant fruits, spice and intense acidity that needs to soften. Produced from selected high-altitude parcels, the wine is balanced between the tangy texture and mineral fruitiness. Drink from early 2018.
Refined-description: This lightly woodaged wine estate changed hand three time 400 year crisp tight young It fine potential future There elegant fruit spice intense acidity need soften Produced selected highaltitude parcel wine balanced tangy texture mineral fruitiness Drink early 2018

description: The estate wine from this Cahors showpiece property, it shows the rich intensity that can be conjured from Malbec, packed with tannins but also with dark, ripe-berry fruit and great intensity. It is a wine with potential—with a tannic structure that will see the wine starting to drink from 2020.
Refined-description: The estate wine Cahors showpiece property show rich intensity conjured Malbec packed tannin also dark ripeberry fruit great intensity It wine potential—with tannic structure see wine starting drink 2020

description: Named after the year 2008, when Provence's La Londe became its own appellation, the wine is an impressive selection from specific parcels in the dry coastal slip between Toulon and Saint-Tropez. It is textured, full of ripe fruit, red berries and a squeeze of lemon juice. The wine is full bodied, rich and likely to age for a few more months. Drink from early 2018.
Refined-description: Named year 2008 Provence La Londe became appellation wine impressive selection specific parcel dry coastal slip Toulon SaintTropez It textured full ripe fruit red berry squeeze lemon juice The wine full bodied rich likely age month Drink early 2018

description: The top cuvée from Roubine, this unusual blend of Tibouren and Clairette is intensely perfumed and ripe and with a fine stylish character. It is an impressive wine with yellow fruits as well as red currant and citrus. This food friendly wine should age a bit, so drink from late 2017.
Refined-description: The top cuvée Roubine unusual blend Tibouren Clairette intensely perfumed ripe fine stylish character It impressive wine yellow fruit well red currant citrus This food friendly wine age bit drink late 2017

description: The Daou brothers have become increasingly known for their rich, unctuous and lavish high-end wines, but this bottling offers a taste of that opulence for just $30. Plump blueberry and soft, cedar-like spice scents show on the nose, while the palate bursts with black cherry, dark chocolate and caramel flavors, powered by ample acidity. It will age gracefully, but is already delicious.
Refined-description: The Daou brother become increasingly known rich unctuous lavish highend wine bottling offer taste opulence 30 Plump blueberry soft cedarlike spice scent show nose palate burst black cherry dark chocolate caramel flavor powered ample acidity It age gracefully already delicious

description: From the producer's estate vineyard on Mount Veeder, this 100% varietal vineyard designate is oaky, viscous and intensely flavored with green apple, melon and peach. Delicious honeysuckle and grapefruit peel aromas make it all the more compelling, balancing its voluptuous weight and ripeness.
Refined-description: From producer estate vineyard Mount Veeder 100 varietal vineyard designate oaky viscous intensely flavored green apple melon peach Delicious honeysuckle grapefruit peel aroma make compelling balancing voluptuous weight ripeness

description: From an aptly named vineyard, this whopper of a wine blends 37% Zinfandel, 32% Syrah, 16% Grenache and 15% Mourvèdre with 24% new oak and 20% whole-cluster fermentation. The result is a perfume that's both tart with boysenberry and rich with caramel, oak and cola. Black plum, gravel and bay leaf flavors surround its meaty core, persisting deep into the finish.
Refined-description: From aptly named vineyard whopper wine blend 37 Zinfandel 32 Syrah 16 Grenache 15 Mourvèdre 24 new oak 20 wholecluster fermentation The result perfume tart boysenberry rich caramel oak cola Black plum gravel bay leaf flavor surround meaty core persisting deep finish

description: Multiple vineyards contribute to this standout blend. It feels open and accessible, yet carries the structure to age gracefully. You'll find interesting threads of freshly picked herb, lemon oil, pimiento and olive supporting citrus and fresh apple fruit.
Refined-description: Multiple vineyard contribute standout blend It feel open accessible yet carry structure age gracefully You find interesting thread freshly picked herb lemon oil pimiento olive supporting citrus fresh apple fruit

description: Earthy with dusty loam and forest scents, this wine is intensely rich, with grippy, chewy tannins. Fine-grained oak notes support dark chocolate, clove and tobacco flavors, accented with fruit-forward elements that recall wild blueberry and blackberry. Structured to age, it will be best from 2023 through 2030.
Refined-description: Earthy dusty loam forest scent wine intensely rich grippy chewy tannin Finegrained oak note support dark chocolate clove tobacco flavor accented fruitforward element recall wild blueberry blackberry Structured age best 2023 2030

description: The first vintage of this small-production wine, this is meaty, full of smoky pepper and dense red and blue fruit. It's powerfully built and structured, packing a finishing punch of roasted coffee and chocolate flavors. A worthwhile new discovery and a producer to watch.
Refined-description: The first vintage smallproduction wine meaty full smoky pepper dense red blue fruit It powerfully built structured packing finishing punch roasted coffee chocolate flavor A worthwhile new discovery producer watch

description: Domaine is the winery's top Pinot Noir: all-estate grown, from grapes now certified biodynamic. It's an accessible, pretty wine, with rich flavors of pastry fillings—think raspberry scones. It's got a tart, tangy grip and the length and structure to age at least a decade.
Refined-description: Domaine winery top Pinot Noir allestate grown grape certified biodynamic It accessible pretty wine rich flavor pastry fillings—think raspberry scone It got tart tangy grip length structure age least decade

description: Flawless on the nose, this amontillado purchased from the solera of Señor González Obregón is full of lift, power and toffee on the nose. There's zero excess weight to the palate, which features flavors of nuts, salt, caramel and dried apricot. On the finish, a hint of buttered toast offers an umami offset to acid-driven raciness.
designation: Almancenista José Luis González Obregón Amontillado del Puerto
Refined-description: Flawless nose amontillado purchased solera Señor González Obregón full lift power toffee nose There zero excess weight palate feature flavor nut salt caramel dried apricot On finish hint buttered toast offer umami offset aciddriven raciness

description: Textural and beautifully detailed, this offers front-loaded flavors of cola, cocoa, graphite and tobacco, wrapped around blackberry and black-cherry fruits. Despite the relatively steep alcohol, this drinks in a lighter, more elegant, yet quite showy style.
Refined-description: Textural beautifully detailed offer frontloaded flavor cola cocoa graphite tobacco wrapped around blackberry blackcherry fruit Despite relatively steep alcohol drink lighter elegant yet quite showy style

description: Made entirely from Chardonnay grapes grown in one site, the inaugural vintage of this cuvée is delicious. It offers a rich core of almond paste flavor, with inviting peach, apple and pear fruit tones, all while remaining light, bright and highlighted with wet stone and gravel.
Refined-description: Made entirely Chardonnay grape grown one site inaugural vintage cuvée delicious It offer rich core almond paste flavor inviting peach apple pear fruit tone remaining light bright highlighted wet stone gravel

description: The wine comes from a parcel of land planted with both Merlot and Tannat. In its structure, this great wine has a strong connection to the Madirans that are the hallmark of this producer. With maturity, the wine has developed fine secondary flavors and undergrowth and dried-fruit flavors. The wine, named after a standing stone found in the area, is very ready to drink.
Refined-description: The wine come parcel land planted Merlot Tannat In structure great wine strong connection Madirans hallmark producer With maturity wine developed fine secondary flavor undergrowth driedfruit flavor The wine named standing stone found area ready drink

description: From the cool plains of the Petaluma Gap, this wine shines in violet and blueberry crumble aromas. Light bodied, it reveals deeper, darker pepper steak-like flavors as it opens, finishing on an elegant aftertaste of clove.
Refined-description: From cool plain Petaluma Gap wine shine violet blueberry crumble aroma Light bodied reveals deeper darker pepper steaklike flavor open finishing elegant aftertaste clove

description: This modern-style Tempranillo is registering at max ripeness. Aromas of black fruits, raisin, tire rubber and toasty French oak project a dark outlook. In the mouth, this is tight and gripping. Flavors of blackened oak, cassis and blackberry finish firm and closed, with manageable tannins. Drink through 2025.
Refined-description: This modernstyle Tempranillo registering max ripeness Aromas black fruit raisin tire rubber toasty French oak project dark outlook In mouth tight gripping Flavors blackened oak cassis blackberry finish firm closed manageable tannin Drink 2025

description: Bryan Babcock heads to Bentrock Vineyard on the southwestern edge of the appellation to deliver this wine redolent of red cherry, plum, mulberry, peppery spice and sagebrush. The palate is rich and full bodied, with tangy red plum skin and eucalyptus touches, finishing on a fresh, menthol-like note.
Refined-description: Bryan Babcock head Bentrock Vineyard southwestern edge appellation deliver wine redolent red cherry plum mulberry peppery spice sagebrush The palate rich full bodied tangy red plum skin eucalyptus touch finishing fresh menthollike note

description: This is one of the most beloved Chardonnays from Santa Barbara County, and for good reason: Bryan Babcock manages to imbue his wine with buttery richness yet also balance it with acidity and smoke. Honeysuckle, almond and Gravenstein apple aromas lead into energetic yet creamy marshmallow and poached pear flavors, all cut with citrusy acidity.
Refined-description: This one beloved Chardonnays Santa Barbara County good reason Bryan Babcock manages imbue wine buttery richness yet also balance acidity smoke Honeysuckle almond Gravenstein apple aroma lead energetic yet creamy marshmallow poached pear flavor cut citrusy acidity

description: Unusual aromatics conjure ruby red grapefruit, Douglas fir needles, green tea and a touch of cola. The site, which is rather cool, fills in the main palate with grapes offering sleek subtle flavors of mountain berry.
Refined-description: Unusual aromatics conjure ruby red grapefruit Douglas fir needle green tea touch cola The site rather cool fill main palate grape offering sleek subtle flavor mountain berry

description: This herb-laced wine comes from a 1,100-feet elevation outpost five miles from the ocean and shows both feral notes and robust fruit. Tart cranberry flavor dominates, complemented by orange peel nuances. Its tannins are in full force, calling for more time in the glass if not in the cellar. Best the second day after opening, if one can wait.
Refined-description: This herblaced wine come 1100feet elevation outpost five mile ocean show feral note robust fruit Tart cranberry flavor dominates complemented orange peel nuance Its tannin full force calling time glass cellar Best second day opening one wait

description: This hearty and heavily spiced take on the grape offers fascinating black cherry, cardamom, chai spice and sanguine, meaty scents on the nose. The flavors may strike some palates as too intense, brimming with dried red cherry, Indian spice and kalamata olive, bound by energetic acidity and tactile grip.
Refined-description: This hearty heavily spiced take grape offer fascinating black cherry cardamom chai spice sanguine meaty scent nose The flavor may strike palate intense brimming dried red cherry Indian spice kalamata olive bound energetic acidity tactile grip

description: Aromas of underbrush, black fruit, toast and espresso lead the nose on the blend of Sangiovese and 15% Malvasia Nera. The palate is still resting heavily on its oak, showing coffee, coconut, vanilla and mocha, along with dried black cherry, prune and clove. The raspy tannins need to soften up but the fruit richness is already drying up.
Refined-description: Aromas underbrush black fruit toast espresso lead nose blend Sangiovese 15 Malvasia Nera The palate still resting heavily oak showing coffee coconut vanilla mocha along dried black cherry prune clove The raspy tannin need soften fruit richness already drying

description: This is a serious, wood-aged wine whose ripe fruits are dominated at the moment by heavy toast flavors. The fruit does offer weight and good potential, making it a structured, dark wine that is beginning to suggest a juicy future. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: This serious woodaged wine whose ripe fruit dominated moment heavy toast flavor The fruit offer weight good potential making structured dark wine beginning suggest juicy future Drink 2017

description: This is a herbal, earthy wine with as many tannins as fruit at this stage. That gives it a dense, dusty texture that seeps into the ripe, sweet plum flavors. With the wood giving an extra push of richness as well as spice, it needs to age. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: This herbal earthy wine many tannin fruit stage That give dense dusty texture seeps ripe sweet plum flavor With wood giving extra push richness well spice need age Drink 2017

description: To judge by the weight of the bottle, this is regarded as an important wine by the producer. The wine inside is attractive and fruity, ripe with berry fruits and considerable freshness. The tannins give the power for the bottle, dry and dense at this young stage. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: To judge weight bottle regarded important wine producer The wine inside attractive fruity ripe berry fruit considerable freshness The tannin give power bottle dry dense young stage Drink 2017

description: Made to celebrate their 30th vintage, the Cazottes have produced a ripe, full-bodied wine that is still smooth and rich. Raspberries and fresh acidity give fruitiness with a delicious juicy aftertaste. Drink this wine soon, from early 2016.
Refined-description: Made celebrate 30th vintage Cazottes produced ripe fullbodied wine still smooth rich Raspberries fresh acidity give fruitiness delicious juicy aftertaste Drink wine soon early 2016

description: Deep blueberry, prune and dried purple aromas are made even more delicious by hints of bacon fat on this blend of 60% Petite Sirah, 30% Syrah, 9% Mourvèdre and 1% Grenache. The vintner lives in the historic Uvas Valley between Gilroy and Morgan Hill. Purple fruit juiciness is balanced by a sharp licorice edge, framed by judicious acidity and tannins.
Refined-description: Deep blueberry prune dried purple aroma made even delicious hint bacon fat blend 60 Petite Sirah 30 Syrah 9 Mourvèdre 1 Grenache The vintner life historic Uvas Valley Gilroy Morgan Hill Purple fruit juiciness balanced sharp licorice edge framed judicious acidity tannin

description: Briny aromas of bell pepper, jalapeño and canned pea are green-leaning but not overly vegetal. This has a round mouthfeel and ample body to absorb the wine's acidity, while flavors of celery, bell pepper, lime and tangerine come with a strong grassy accent and a persistent, briny tasting finish.
Refined-description: Briny aroma bell pepper jalapeño canned pea greenleaning overly vegetal This round mouthfeel ample body absorb wine acidity flavor celery bell pepper lime tangerine come strong grassy accent persistent briny tasting finish

description: This is a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier (CSV). From estate vineyards in the Cahors region, it is a young wine, still developing its potentially aromatic character, fragrant acidity and rich pineapple and red apple flavors. Hold this wine and drink from late 2016.
Refined-description: This blend Chardonnay Sauvignon Blanc Viognier CSV From estate vineyard Cahors region young wine still developing potentially aromatic character fragrant acidity rich pineapple red apple flavor Hold wine drink late 2016

description: A mix of tropical and citrus aromas is balanced by classic Leyda scents of bell pepper and jalapeño. This is crystal clear and zesty on the tongue, with cutting acidity. Lemon, tangerine and briny notes create a citrusy flavor profile, while the finish is juicy, crisp and cleansing.
Refined-description: A mix tropical citrus aroma balanced classic Leyda scent bell pepper jalapeño This crystal clear zesty tongue cutting acidity Lemon tangerine briny note create citrusy flavor profile finish juicy crisp cleansing

description: Minerally on the start, this white progresses into oaky vanilla and brioche notes with a heightened viscosity midway through, before re-finding its vibrancy at the end. In between expect a full-bodied, fruity expression of the variety highlighted by plenty of ripe apple and apricot.
Refined-description: Minerally start white progress oaky vanilla brioche note heightened viscosity midway refinding vibrancy end In expect fullbodied fruity expression variety highlighted plenty ripe apple apricot

description: Rosy cherry and plum aromas turn more rubbery and raisiny as this airs out. Solid, lifted and deep on the palate, this varietal Garnacha deals lightly herbal, floral flavors of plum and cherry cough drop, while the finish is oaky, resiny, raw, scouring and tough. Nothing about this is subtle or elegant, but it is dynamic. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: Rosy cherry plum aroma turn rubbery raisiny air Solid lifted deep palate varietal Garnacha deal lightly herbal floral flavor plum cherry cough drop finish oaky resiny raw scouring tough Nothing subtle elegant dynamic Drink 2020

description: This medium-bodied wine is fresh and fruity, but also polished and sophisticated. It smells like raspberries and black plums, then adds chocolate and blackberry in the flavors. Rich and flavorful it also has welcome firm tannins and fruit acidity to keep it lively. Grenache is the leading grape ingredient.
Refined-description: This mediumbodied wine fresh fruity also polished sophisticated It smell like raspberry black plum add chocolate blackberry flavor Rich flavorful also welcome firm tannin fruit acidity keep lively Grenache leading grape ingredient

description: Wildflower and lemon zest brighten this dry, citrusy Pinot Gris. Lip smacking white grapefruit flavors flood the palate, along with a hint of bitter almond. It's a revitalizing white that's ready to drink, but also likely to maintain its fresh, primary flavors through 2017.
Refined-description: Wildflower lemon zest brighten dry citrusy Pinot Gris Lip smacking white grapefruit flavor flood palate along hint bitter almond It revitalizing white ready drink also likely maintain fresh primary flavor 2017

description: This blend is mostly Syrah, with Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon backing it up. Dense, earthy, meaty and lightly roasted on the nose, the palate is mildly tannic, with lively acidity. Roasted, foresty plum and red-berry flavors end short and baked in character.
Refined-description: This blend mostly Syrah Merlot Cabernet Sauvignon backing Dense earthy meaty lightly roasted nose palate mildly tannic lively acidity Roasted foresty plum redberry flavor end short baked character

description: Vibrant and elegant, this delivers aromas and flavors of crushed red cherry, raspberry, cinnamon-spice and Alpine herbs. Supple tannins and bright acidity provide support. Enjoy through 2018.
Refined-description: Vibrant elegant delivers aroma flavor crushed red cherry raspberry cinnamonspice Alpine herb Supple tannin bright acidity provide support Enjoy 2018

description: Quite foamy when poured, this bubbly from the historic sparkling house offers aromas of apple flesh, ripe pears and lemon-lime soda. It presents straightforward flavors on the palate accented with apple blossoms, while white tuberose florals and a touch of guava trend toward the tropical side of the scale.
Refined-description: Quite foamy poured bubbly historic sparkling house offer aroma apple flesh ripe pear lemonlime soda It present straightforward flavor palate accented apple blossom white tuberose florals touch guava trend toward tropical side scale

description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, spice, underbrush and dried herbs emerge from this blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. The palate delivers dried black cherries, plum, clove and grilled sage alongside tightly-knit tannins. Drink 2016–2020.
Refined-description: Aromas ripe darkskinned fruit spice underbrush dried herb emerge blend Cabernet Franc Merlot Petit Verdot The palate delivers dried black cherry plum clove grilled sage alongside tightlyknit tannin Drink 2016–2020

description: Spicy and still tight, this shows a big-boned style. Penetrating pear fruit flavors are dotted with white pepper, and finished with a hint of water cracker.
Refined-description: Spicy still tight show bigboned style Penetrating pear fruit flavor dotted white pepper finished hint water cracker

description: Dense aromas of earth, berry fruits, latex and animal fur are a touch challenging at first but balance out with airing. This has a crisp, fresh feel despite coming from a hot year. Lightly herbal, leathery flavors of red currant and wild berry finish oaky, with more than adequate filling.
Refined-description: Dense aroma earth berry fruit latex animal fur touch challenging first balance airing This crisp fresh feel despite coming hot year Lightly herbal leathery flavor red currant wild berry finish oaky adequate filling

description: Subdued aromas of espresso, tobacco, cedar, tilled soil and mature black fruit waft out of the glass. Made entirely with Cabernet Sauvignon, the elegant palate offers raw red currants, dried black cherries, clove and anise alongside silky but rather fleeting tannins.
Refined-description: Subdued aroma espresso tobacco cedar tilled soil mature black fruit waft glass Made entirely Cabernet Sauvignon elegant palate offer raw red currant dried black cherry clove anise alongside silky rather fleeting tannin

description: Old vines of Tinta Francisca have produced a generous, full and concentrated wine. It is packed with forward berry fruits and as well as soft tannins that are finely integrated. The end is fresh, and always fruity.
Refined-description: Old vine Tinta Francisca produced generous full concentrated wine It packed forward berry fruit well soft tannin finely integrated The end fresh always fruity

description: Made from Sangiovese blended with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this opens with aromas of sawdust, oak, exotic spice and a whiff of black currant. The palate displays toasted oak, roasted coffee beans, menthol, ground black pepper and dried black cherries alongside grippy tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Refined-description: Made Sangiovese blended 20 Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot open aroma sawdust oak exotic spice whiff black currant The palate display toasted oak roasted coffee bean menthol ground black pepper dried black cherry alongside grippy tannin leave astringent finish

description: Fresh strawberry fruit with a bit of spice makes this an easy choice for warm-weather sipping. Tart, with lemony acidity, it's young and lively. Good as it is on its own, it would make an awesome punch.
Refined-description: Fresh strawberry fruit bit spice make easy choice warmweather sipping Tart lemony acidity young lively Good would make awesome punch

description: Offered in a half-bottle size, this estate Cab-based wine also contains 6% Merlot and 6% Petit Verdot. The blend is crisp, dry and tannic in cranberry, barely ripe cherry and dried currant, swerving savory into dried herb and clove.
Refined-description: Offered halfbottle size estate Cabbased wine also contains 6 Merlot 6 Petit Verdot The blend crisp dry tannic cranberry barely ripe cherry dried currant swerving savory dried herb clove

description: Dense and concentrated, this blend of 66% Cabernet Sauvignon, 26% Cabernet Franc and 8% Petit Verdot initially has a subdued nose that eventually reveals prune, alcohol, tobacco and leather aromas. The syrupy palate doles out blackberry extract, fig, sweet spice and soaring alcohol alongside velvety tannins. While some may like the sheer power, the dominant alcohol stunts any complexity, giving it a monolithic quality.
Refined-description: Dense concentrated blend 66 Cabernet Sauvignon 26 Cabernet Franc 8 Petit Verdot initially subdued nose eventually reveals prune alcohol tobacco leather aroma The syrupy palate dole blackberry extract fig sweet spice soaring alcohol alongside velvety tannin While may like sheer power dominant alcohol stunt complexity giving monolithic quality

description: Firm and spicy, this blend of Sangiovese and 10% Merlot opens with aromas of black plum, crushed violet and kitchen spices. The juicy palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and clove alongside a backbone of tightly wound but refined tannins. Drink 2016–2020.
Refined-description: Firm spicy blend Sangiovese 10 Merlot open aroma black plum crushed violet kitchen spice The juicy palate delivers ripe black cherry licorice clove alongside backbone tightly wound refined tannin Drink 2016–2020

description: The vineyard is in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA, though the label does not indicate it. There is a welcome purity to the fruit expression, pretty cherry flavors with a suggestion of hard candy. Although it has light herb and stem highlights, nothing overshadows the lovely fruit.
Refined-description: The vineyard EolaAmity Hills AVA though label indicate There welcome purity fruit expression pretty cherry flavor suggestion hard candy Although light herb stem highlight nothing overshadows lovely fruit

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca, this dark-colored, serious wine is concentrated and structured. It offers black fruits, giving a brooding character that's full of power. The aftertaste with its acidity and juicy fruit is elevated and leaves with a lift.
Refined-description: A blend Touriga Nacional Touriga Franca darkcolored serious wine concentrated structured It offer black fruit giving brooding character full power The aftertaste acidity juicy fruit elevated leaf lift

description: Aside from hints of dark wild raspberries, this entry-level, second-label wine by Norm Yost doesn't offer overt fruit on the nose, instead showing graphite, dark earth and crushed rocks. Earthy flavors of beet juice and juniper show a slightly sour side, making for an interesting wine, if not completely delicious
Refined-description: Aside hint dark wild raspberry entrylevel secondlabel wine Norm Yost nt offer overt fruit nose instead showing graphite dark earth crushed rock Earthy flavor beet juice juniper show slightly sour side making interesting wine completely delicious

description: This exotic white blend starts with citrus and floral aromas and offers a palate of soft lemon curd, orange and white fruit. Rich but with a cutting finish, it's a good food wine for bigger seafood flavors.
Refined-description: This exotic white blend start citrus floral aroma offer palate soft lemon curd orange white fruit Rich cutting finish good food wine bigger seafood flavor

description: Mature berry, underbrush, leather, fennel and a whiff of grilled herb meld together in the glass. The firm, vibrant palate shows ripe wild cherry, black raspberry, licorice, coffee and a balsamic note while bracing, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Give this a few years to come together. Drink after 2020.
Refined-description: Mature berry underbrush leather fennel whiff grilled herb meld together glass The firm vibrant palate show ripe wild cherry black raspberry licorice coffee balsamic note bracing finegrained tannin provide framework Give year come together Drink 2020

description: Smooth and appealing, with a smoky edge to the purple plum and berry fruits, this is a flavorful, forward and easy-drinking rendition of what may become Southern Oregon's signature grape. The tannins are silky and the length impressive.
Refined-description: Smooth appealing smoky edge purple plum berry fruit flavorful forward easydrinking rendition may become Southern Oregon signature grape The tannin silky length impressive

description: From grapes grown in the Douro Superior region, this is an open delicious fruity and ripe wine that is ready to drink. Its black currant and red berry tastes are balanced by spice, wood aged flavors and a core of tannins. The aftertaste introduces fresh juicy acidity.
Refined-description: From grape grown Douro Superior region open delicious fruity ripe wine ready drink Its black currant red berry taste balanced spice wood aged flavor core tannin The aftertaste introduces fresh juicy acidity

description: Ripe fruit flavors and a delicious spiciness combine to make this full-bodied but not very tannic wine easy to love. It smells like cherries and raspberries, tastes full but not sweet, and has a texture that spreads and softens on the palate like melting chocolate. It's made with 50% Zinfandel and almost equal parts Syrah, Carignane and Petite Sirah.
Refined-description: Ripe fruit flavor delicious spiciness combine make fullbodied tannic wine easy love It smell like cherry raspberry taste full sweet texture spread softens palate like melting chocolate It made 50 Zinfandel almost equal part Syrah Carignane Petite Sirah

description: Resiny oak and mildly stalky berry aromas muscle out cherry and raspberry scents. This feels grabby and clampy, while oaky flavors of mixed berries and baked plum end with coconut-infused oak flavors and notes of raisin and licorice. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: Resiny oak mildly stalky berry aroma muscle cherry raspberry scent This feel grabby clampy oaky flavor mixed berry baked plum end coconutinfused oak flavor note raisin licorice Drink 2020

description: Aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, blue flower and Oriental spice float out of the glass. The round, full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, blackberry jam, licorice and pipe tobacco alongside chewy tannins.
Refined-description: Aromas mature blackskinned fruit blue flower Oriental spice float glass The round fullbodied palate offer dried black cherry blackberry jam licorice pipe tobacco alongside chewy tannin

description: This wine is dark red-violet color to the eye, offering aromas of blackberry, roasted red pepper and juniper berry. It is very smooth on the palate, with flavors of black plum, blackberry, white peach, elderberry and violet. There is a slightly dominant eucalyptus flavor that backs off at the finish, replaced by a fresh cherry juice flavor.
Refined-description: This wine dark redviolet color eye offering aroma blackberry roasted red pepper juniper berry It smooth palate flavor black plum blackberry white peach elderberry violet There slightly dominant eucalyptus flavor back finish replaced fresh cherry juice flavor

description: Wild strawberry and a thicket of dense tannin belie a powerfully strong and elusive wine, still very much tightly wound, indicative of the vintage. A portion (35%) of the grapes were whole-cluster pressed, from tight-spaced, low-yielding vines. A little more oak was used than in most of the producer's other wines, helping to impart a spicy finish.
Refined-description: Wild strawberry thicket dense tannin belie powerfully strong elusive wine still much tightly wound indicative vintage A portion 35 grape wholecluster pressed tightspaced lowyielding vine A little oak used producer wine helping impart spicy finish

description: Fresh apple and pear flavors are swathed in fresh herbs and citrus peels in this bristling medium-sweet wine. It's lusciously honeyed but finishes long with honed steely precision.
Refined-description: Fresh apple pear flavor swathed fresh herb citrus peel bristling mediumsweet wine It lusciously honeyed finish long honed steely precision

description: Raisin and white pepper aromas, ripe fruit, floral and spicy anise flavors and full body add up to a big wine in which the whole-cluster fermentation method can be tasted. The hearty flavors, complexity and firm tannins paint a unique picture, and this bottling makes a dramatic contrast in style from the “regular” Anderson Valley Pinot Noir.
Refined-description: Raisin white pepper aroma ripe fruit floral spicy anise flavor full body add big wine wholecluster fermentation method tasted The hearty flavor complexity firm tannin paint unique picture bottling make dramatic contrast style “ regular ” Anderson Valley Pinot Noir

description: Dark garnet in the glass, this wine has a nose of strawberry, black plum, caramel and smoked meat. It offers a good balance of acidity and tannins, with flavors of blackberry, blueberry, smoked meat, vanilla and mocha. The vanilla flavor is extended on the palate thanks to lingering silky tannins that eventually dissolve in a note of orange zest.
Refined-description: Dark garnet glass wine nose strawberry black plum caramel smoked meat It offer good balance acidity tannin flavor blackberry blueberry smoked meat vanilla mocha The vanilla flavor extended palate thanks lingering silky tannin eventually dissolve note orange zest

description: Blue flower, mature plum, licorice, clove, mocha and menthol aromas all come together on this brawny red. The warm, bold palate delivers juicy black cherry, espresso, ground pepper and anisette alongside a backbone of fine-grained tannins. Showing the heat of the vintage, it won't need years to come around. Drink 2018–2028.
Refined-description: Blue flower mature plum licorice clove mocha menthol aroma come together brawny red The warm bold palate delivers juicy black cherry espresso ground pepper anisette alongside backbone finegrained tannin Showing heat vintage wo nt need year come around Drink 2018–2028

description: This concentrated wine was wood aged for six months, giving the lightest touch of oak along with ripe yellow fruits and a crisp tangy aftertaste. It has a touch of spice along with bright acidity at the end. Drink now.
Refined-description: This concentrated wine wood aged six month giving lightest touch oak along ripe yellow fruit crisp tangy aftertaste It touch spice along bright acidity end Drink

description: A blend of three estate-farmed vineyards, this is a velvety-smooth expression of the variety. It conveys a touch more richness and concentration than some of the producer's other wines, at least at the beginning of the glass, when almond and hazelnut rule the day. But then it takes on a lightness toward the lengthy finish, ending in a mix of lemon zest and apple.
Refined-description: A blend three estatefarmed vineyard velvetysmooth expression variety It conveys touch richness concentration producer wine least beginning glass almond hazelnut rule day But take lightness toward lengthy finish ending mix lemon zest apple

description: This wine features a bouquet of cherry, pomegranate and freshly ground black pepper. It is well-balanced on the palate with flavors of pomegranate, strawberry, mace and anise. Smooth tannins are present into the bright yet lasting finish.
Refined-description: This wine feature bouquet cherry pomegranate freshly ground black pepper It wellbalanced palate flavor pomegranate strawberry mace anise Smooth tannin present bright yet lasting finish

description: The nose on this appellation blend is full of soft tones of ripe nectarine and pluot, though cut with walnut oil and a citrus edge. It's more pithy in flavor, showing orange bitters, dried apples and more nut oils, slightly oxidative in style.
Refined-description: The nose appellation blend full soft tone ripe nectarine pluot though cut walnut oil citrus edge It pithy flavor showing orange bitter dried apple nut oil slightly oxidative style

description: Planted in 1988, this vineyard 's fruit captures the unique minerality found in this AVA. It leaves an impression of sucking on rock—not a bad thing in a wine. The black-cherry fruit grips the palate with real power and some density, with potent herbal highlights as well. Drink this now through the mid-2020s.
Refined-description: Planted 1988 vineyard fruit capture unique minerality found AVA It leaf impression sucking rock—not bad thing wine The blackcherry fruit grip palate real power density potent herbal highlight well Drink mid2020s

description: Dark black cherry in color, this wine offers a bouquet of cherry preserves, matchstick and petrol. It is far livelier on the palate than on the nose, featuring flavors of cherry, pomegranate and bell pepper with a light touch of florality. Chewy tannins make their way across the gum and tongues and are all but erased by a final note of orange zest and cranberry.
Refined-description: Dark black cherry color wine offer bouquet cherry preserve matchstick petrol It far livelier palate nose featuring flavor cherry pomegranate bell pepper light touch florality Chewy tannin make way across gum tongue erased final note orange zest cranberry

description: Dark berry, mocha, toast and cooking spice aromas emerge in the glass. The taut palate offers mature black cherry, coffee and dried herb alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins.
Refined-description: Dark berry mocha toast cooking spice aroma emerge glass The taut palate offer mature black cherry coffee dried herb alongside assertive finegrained tannin

description: Cherry-berry and vanilla surround a soft, spicy core of high-toned red fruit. Mellowed with age, the tannins linger in perceived sweetness.
Refined-description: Cherryberry vanilla surround soft spicy core hightoned red fruit Mellowed age tannin linger perceived sweetness

description: Red rose, bright berry and anisette aromas lead the way. The taut palate offers sour cherry, tobacco, clove and chopped herb alongside bracing tannins and brisk acidity.
Refined-description: Red rose bright berry anisette aroma lead way The taut palate offer sour cherry tobacco clove chopped herb alongside bracing tannin brisk acidity

description: This brawny, forward wine opens with aromas that recall spirits, steeped plum, roasted coffee bean and menthol. The dense, chewy palate offers black cherry liqueur, licorice, espresso and the warmth of evident alcohol accompanied by brooding tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.
Refined-description: This brawny forward wine open aroma recall spirit steeped plum roasted coffee bean menthol The dense chewy palate offer black cherry liqueur licorice espresso warmth evident alcohol accompanied brooding tannin Drink sooner rather later

description: Aromas of rose, red berry, espresso, grilled herb and toast lead the nose. The taut palate offers crunchy red cherry, raspberry, star anise and white pepper alongside tightly wound, assertive tannins. It closes on a note of roasted coffee bean.
Refined-description: Aromas rose red berry espresso grilled herb toast lead nose The taut palate offer crunchy red cherry raspberry star anise white pepper alongside tightly wound assertive tannin It close note roasted coffee bean

description: Earthy aromas of leather, game, sunbaked earth and mature dark-skinned berry take center stage. The tense palate offers dried black cherry, mocha, espresso licorice and tobacco alongside fresh acidity and close-grained tannins.
Refined-description: Earthy aroma leather game sunbaked earth mature darkskinned berry take center stage The tense palate offer dried black cherry mocha espresso licorice tobacco alongside fresh acidity closegrained tannin

description: Mature dark berry, crushed blue flower, spice and peppermint aromas lead the nose on this structured red. The firm palate offers ripe black cherry, white pepper, cocoa, star anise and a balsamic note accompanied by bracing tannins. Drink 2018–2016.
Refined-description: Mature dark berry crushed blue flower spice peppermint aroma lead nose structured red The firm palate offer ripe black cherry white pepper cocoa star anise balsamic note accompanied bracing tannin Drink 2018–2016

description: Cherry and plum aromas are accented by buttery oak, leather and animal notes. Solid in feel with firm tannins, this warm-vintage Tempranillo is ripe, loamy and loaded with berry and cassis flavors. A lightly raisiny finish is friendly and round. Drink through 2019.
Refined-description: Cherry plum aroma accented buttery oak leather animal note Solid feel firm tannin warmvintage Tempranillo ripe loamy loaded berry cassis flavor A lightly raisiny finish friendly round Drink 2019

description: Aromas of wild berry, dark spice, menthol and a hint of pressed flower lead the way on this straightforward Barolo. The full-bodied palate offers dark cherry, licorice and dried herb alongside firm, ripe tannins. Drink 2018–2026.
Refined-description: Aromas wild berry dark spice menthol hint pressed flower lead way straightforward Barolo The fullbodied palate offer dark cherry licorice dried herb alongside firm ripe tannin Drink 2018–2026

description: This is strongly marked by new oak on the nose at this stage, suggesting toast, brown sugar and coffee, but fruit comes through on the palate where hints of dark berries, cola, clove and cinnamon mingle. The wine is creamy and lush in texture, with ample weight and a lingering finish of dried fruit, vanilla and mocha. Drink from 2018 to 2025.
Refined-description: This strongly marked new oak nose stage suggesting toast brown sugar coffee fruit come palate hint dark berry cola clove cinnamon mingle The wine creamy lush texture ample weight lingering finish dried fruit vanilla mocha Drink 2018 2025

description: One of the most beautiful package designs in the state introduces a fresh and toasty wine that translates this cool, wet vintage into a most delicate and enjoyable bottle of Pinot. Light cranberry and cherry fruit is set in a gently proportional bed of tart acid and pretty oak, 40% new.
Refined-description: One beautiful package design state introduces fresh toasty wine translates cool wet vintage delicate enjoyable bottle Pinot Light cranberry cherry fruit set gently proportional bed tart acid pretty oak 40 new

description: Clean, crisp and bright, this was fermented in stainless (with just 10% in neutral wood), and not put through malolactic. The blend is 60/40 Chardonnay/Pinot Noir, yielding fresh fruit flavors of apple and melon that are focused and precise. A streak of ginger runs through racy acidity.
Refined-description: Clean crisp bright fermented stainless 10 neutral wood put malolactic The blend 6040 ChardonnayPinot Noir yielding fresh fruit flavor apple melon focused precise A streak ginger run racy acidity

description: Aromas of mature yellow apple and a whiff of chamomile flower lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the extremely ripe palate along with a hint of acacia and a marked note of bitter almond.
Refined-description: Aromas mature yellow apple whiff chamomile flower lead nose The aroma carry extremely ripe palate along hint acacia marked note bitter almond

description: Smoky, toasted oak aromas lead to strong char and butter flavors and a viscous texture that clings to the palate. Subtlety is not one of this wine's virtues, as its outsized flavors stand in stark relief.
Refined-description: Smoky toasted oak aroma lead strong char butter flavor viscous texture cling palate Subtlety one wine virtue outsized flavor stand stark relief

description: A clean nose of citrus paves the way for flavors of grapefruit and Sevilla orange. This wine is soft and pleasing on the palate, but it may be touch tart for some tastes.
Refined-description: A clean nose citrus pave way flavor grapefruit Sevilla orange This wine soft pleasing palate may touch tart taste

description: With its typical prickle on the tongue, this is a medium sweet wine. It's clean, crisp and citrusy, with sliced apple and orange zest flavors. Drink now.
Refined-description: With typical prickle tongue medium sweet wine It clean crisp citrusy sliced apple orange zest flavor Drink

description: Lightly spritzy, this tastes of crisp apple and finishes just off-dry. It's deliciously refreshing, bright and tangy. Drink now.
Refined-description: Lightly spritzy taste crisp apple finish offdry It deliciously refreshing bright tangy Drink

description: This is a dry sparkling wine with tannins, spice and berry fruit, giving it a deep color. Not an apéritif wine, it's perfect for cutting through rich, oily foods. Drink now.
Refined-description: This dry sparkling wine tannin spice berry fruit giving deep color Not apéritif wine perfect cutting rich oily food Drink

description: This is a soft, creamy wine with fruitiness and a yeasty edge. Made from Bical, Arinto and Maria Gomes, it's ready to drink.
Refined-description: This soft creamy wine fruitiness yeasty edge Made Bical Arinto Maria Gomes ready drink

description: This is a soft wine whose herbal character is held in check by a smooth texture. It is bright and crisp, with plenty of citrus and gooseberry flavors as well as intense acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Refined-description: This soft wine whose herbal character held check smooth texture It bright crisp plenty citrus gooseberry flavor well intense acidity The wine ready drink

description: This white wine is fruity and crisp with a deliciously refreshing herbal edge. Lemon and pink grapefruit are cut by some zingy acidity and finished with a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
Refined-description: This white wine fruity crisp deliciously refreshing herbal edge Lemon pink grapefruit cut zingy acidity finished bright aftertaste Drink

description: Dusty plum and berry aromas are clean. In the mouth, this is hard and wiry. Salty snappy plum flavors dry out and taste a bit like tin on a raw finish.

description: This yeasty wine is bone-dry, mature and ready to drink, a toasty element having replaced any fruitiness. The aftertaste is crisp and bright.

description: Buttery aromas and buttery, spicy flavors lend an outgoing personality to this medium-bodied wine. Vanilla and cream flavors add some interest, while the texture is broad and smooth.

description: A soft mouthfeel and fresh golden delicious apple flavors make this light-bodied wine easy on the palate. It has crisp and clean flavors all the way through.

description: With hints of minerality typical of any wine from the Dão, this has tight, yeasty notes that contrast with its crisp, bright apple fruit. Drink now.

description: This wine balances swathes of ripe berry fruit with hints of tannin. It's fruity, full bodied and delicious to drink now. A great barbecue wine.

description: This is a classic style of Bairrada sparkling wine—a blend of Bical, Maria Gomes and Arinto. Plenty of crisp acidity and soft white fruit flavors balance its yeasty character. Drink now.
designation: Encontro Q do E Blanco Bruto Classico
Refined-description: This classic style Bairrada sparkling wine—a blend Bical Maria Gomes Arinto Plenty crisp acidity soft white fruit flavor balance yeasty character Drink

description: Surprisingly shy and reserved in nature, this offers subtle aromas and flavors of apple core and spiced orange peel. Soft and accessible, it's direct and clean, yet short on the finish. Drink now.
Refined-description: Surprisingly shy reserved nature offer subtle aroma flavor apple core spiced orange peel Soft accessible direct clean yet short finish Drink

description: A mix of blueberry, plum and animal aromas leads to a wiry, clipped palate fueled by tartaric acid. Lightly salted plum flavors are slightly jammy, while a blueberry note is brought back on the finish.
Refined-description: A mix blueberry plum animal aroma lead wiry clipped palate fueled tartaric acid Lightly salted plum flavor slightly jammy blueberry note brought back finish

description: Bright aromas of tart apple, melon rind and fresh chrysanthemum dance in the bouquet, while the lively, lightweight palate offers notes of white peach and citrus pith. A subtle astringency graces the close. Drink now.
Refined-description: Bright aroma tart apple melon rind fresh chrysanthemum dance bouquet lively lightweight palate offer note white peach citrus pith A subtle astringency grace close Drink

description: This is a plump, broad southern Rhône white, offering subtle notes of melon, pear and wet stones. Drink it before the end of 2017 while it still retains some freshness.
Refined-description: This plump broad southern Rhône white offering subtle note melon pear wet stone Drink end 2017 still retains freshness

description: This dense, rich and ripe varietal Cabernet Sauvignon is aged in new French oak for 19 months. It shows smoked meat and bacon flavors that last into the finish.

description: Soft hints of peach, verbena and peony grace the delicate nose of this lightweight white. Touches of green banana and pear flesh out the palate, while ample acidity keeps the mouthfeel fresh through the finish. Drink now.

description: This wine's blend symbolizes the Tarn's halfway position between the Atlantic and the Mediterranean. So it is has the perfumed Syrah and the more structured local Braucol to give a bright fruity wine with some touches of tannin as well as red-berry fruits. Drink now.

description: A dry wine with a soft texture that suggests a small amount of residual sugar. It is a fruity wine with apricot and ripe pear flavors and a smooth aftertaste that still leaves plenty of room for acidity. Drink now.

description: Produced in the west of Gascony, with a strong oceanic influence, this Chardonnay is cool, fruity and with bright acidity. It does have a creamy texture that fills out the fruitiness. It is an attractive, ripe wine that is ready to drink.

description: Pretty floral and apricot aromas brighten savory apple notes on this dry, but intensely honeyed Riesling. Bright and brisk on the palate, with searing lime acidity, it finishes long, with a refreshing spray of green herbs.
designation: Niersteiner Hipping vom Rottligenden  Spätlese Trocken
Refined-description: Pretty floral apricot aroma brighten savory apple note dry intensely honeyed Riesling Bright brisk palate searing lime acidity finish long refreshing spray green herb

description: The Mark VI (similar to the above Heather's Vineyard) is a sort of reserve reserve, this one from barrels chosen to showcase the most cellar-worthy aspects of the vintage. It succeeds nicely, delivering a solid, firm, tart wine with young raspberry and cherry fruit at its center. The tannins have a lightly herbal, leafy streak, and there's little doubt this will benefit from additional years in the cellar.
Refined-description: The Mark VI similar Heather Vineyard sort reserve reserve one barrel chosen showcase cellarworthy aspect vintage It succeeds nicely delivering solid firm tart wine young raspberry cherry fruit center The tannin lightly herbal leafy streak little doubt benefit additional year cellar

description: This intriguing blend combines the structure of Chardonnay with the crushed tomato vine and cantaloupe aromatics of Sauvignon. The rich palate delivers a lovely depth of ripe apple, creamy lemon, and melon flavors, layered with hints of exotic fruit and spice.
Refined-description: This intriguing blend combine structure Chardonnay crushed tomato vine cantaloupe aromatics Sauvignon The rich palate delivers lovely depth ripe apple creamy lemon melon flavor layered hint exotic fruit spice

description: A lovely, fresh, fruit-forward Pinot, it's flush with flavors of plums and cherries as it fills the palate. It gains power and mass with dark, slightly charred flavors of espresso wrapped into the finishing tannins.

description: This rich wine has a dense core of dark, dry tannins. The fruit, still taking its time to come through, is full of dark plum flavors and will soon show a fresher acidity. Wood aging, dark chocolate and a smoky character all bode well for the future. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: This rich wine dense core dark dry tannin The fruit still taking time come full dark plum flavor soon show fresher acidity Wood aging dark chocolate smoky character bode well future Drink 2016

description: A rich wine that is made by the Abreu Callado charity foundation. It has dark black currant fruits, big tannins and an elegant feel. With its structure, minerality and ripe, juicy fruitiness, it is finely structured and ageworthy. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: A rich wine made Abreu Callado charity foundation It dark black currant fruit big tannin elegant feel With structure minerality ripe juicy fruitiness finely structured ageworthy Drink 2017

description: You can criticize this as being too full-bodied for a Pinot Noir. Some will find it Grenache-like, with its lush, jammy flavors of cherries, raspberries and oak. But what can't be denied is how delicious it is. The fruitiness, acidity and tannins suggest pairing with charbroiled lamb chops or steak. Drink now–2020.
Refined-description: You criticize fullbodied Pinot Noir Some find Grenachelike lush jammy flavor cherry raspberry oak But ca nt denied delicious The fruitiness acidity tannin suggest pairing charbroiled lamb chop steak Drink now–2020

description: Palmeri has a good history with Syrah, and this 2011 is right up there. With rich, complex blackberry and blueberry jam, cassis, salted grilled beef, black pepper and smoky oak flavors, it is sophisticated enough to drink with upscale fare. It should age well through 2020.
Refined-description: Palmeri good history Syrah 2011 right With rich complex blackberry blueberry jam cassis salted grilled beef black pepper smoky oak flavor sophisticated enough drink upscale fare It age well 2020

description: A powerfully tannic wine, full of the mineral texture and dark structure of a fine Douro wine. It has rich berry and plum skin flavors with underlining from acidity. The tannins, still young, promise aging. Drink from 2017.

winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo
description: Already impressive, this wine is rich and packed with tannins and fruit. The structure gives a dry core that is cushioned by the sweet blackberry fruit flavors. The end shows the tannins again, along with fresh acidity, both suggesting aging. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: Already impressive wine rich packed tannin fruit The structure give dry core cushioned sweet blackberry fruit flavor The end show tannin along fresh acidity suggesting aging Drink 2016

description: Dried herbs accent notes of lemon and apple on this concentrated off-dry Riesling. The palate builds in intensity, with juicy flavors of peach and tangerine glazed with streaks of honey and wax. The finish is long, with bristling lemon-lime acidity.

description: With a significant proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this is a solid, tannic wine. It is also rich, complex and fruity. Fermentation in open lagares gives extra fruitiness, soft extract and great acidity. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: With significant proportion Cabernet Sauvignon blend solid tannic wine It also rich complex fruity Fermentation open lagares give extra fruitiness soft extract great acidity Drink 2017

description: A very ripe wine with a velvet texture, cut with acidity and wood aging flavors. There is fine concentration, with delicious, juicy Merlot giving a ripe feel. It presents a fresh aftertaste, with the black currant fruit giving a lift to the more tannic structure. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: A ripe wine velvet texture cut acidity wood aging flavor There fine concentration delicious juicy Merlot giving ripe feel It present fresh aftertaste black currant fruit giving lift tannic structure Drink 2017

Refined-description: A perfumed wine structured black fruit solid texture It rich showing complexity tannin along acidity fruitiness Still surprisingly young taste drunk 2015

description: Whiffs of blackberry, bramble and granite seduce throughout this concentrated, brawny Lemberger. The palate is lush, with ripe plum and black cherry flavors anchored by brooding minerality and a bite of firm tannins on the finish. It's lovely now, but should reveal more complexity with 5–7 years in the cellar.
Refined-description: Whiffs blackberry bramble granite seduce throughout concentrated brawny Lemberger The palate lush ripe plum black cherry flavor anchored brooding minerality bite firm tannin finish It lovely reveal complexity 5–7 year cellar

description: Dark berry, shoe polish and lemony oak are at the center of the bouquet on this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. The palate feels rich to the point of syrupy, while the flavor profile offers a condensed, jammy mix of wild berries, wood, herbs, chocolate and coffee. Additional herbal notes along with spicy flavors carry a thick finish to its conclusion. Drink through 2018.

description: Black-plum and apple-skin aromas are fruity and a bit raw. In the mouth, this blend of Cabernet Franc, Syrah, Carmenère and Petit Verdot is full, properly tannic and loamy in feel. Dark-leaning flavors of licorice, peppery spice, chocolate and herbs finish with classic Chilean notes of black olive and tobacco. Drink through 2019.
Refined-description: Blackplum appleskin aroma fruity bit raw In mouth blend Cabernet Franc Syrah Carmenère Petit Verdot full properly tannic loamy feel Darkleaning flavor licorice peppery spice chocolate herb finish classic Chilean note black olive tobacco Drink 2019

description: Still youthful, it shows aromas of fragrant white flowers, stone fruit and pear. The juicy, lively palate delivers golden apples, yellow peach, almond and hints of aromatic herbs alongside fresh acidity. It boasts balance and finesse. Drink now through 2016.
Refined-description: Still youthful show aroma fragrant white flower stone fruit pear The juicy lively palate delivers golden apple yellow peach almond hint aromatic herb alongside fresh acidity It boast balance finesse Drink 2016

description: This is a lovely, balanced wine, combining grip, texture and elegant details. It starts with clean fruit flavors of berry and cherry, bringing in delicate notes of root beer, vanilla and clove. There's a suggestion of brine also, the whole delivering marvelous complexity.

description: An intriguing, well-made wine, it conveys saucy red-fruit aromas that come with notes of raw oak, leather and herbs. It smacks the palate with hard tannins and raw verve, while flavors of vanilla, mocha, licorice and berry fruits finish crisp and woody. Drink through 2017.
