description: This delicious blend of Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot opens with aromas of ripe black fruit, berries, tilled soil, blue flower and spice. The concentrated palate delivers fleshy black cherry, red currants, black pepper and graphite alongside smooth tannins. The long finish closes on a licorice note.

description: Right out of the bottle, this wine is tannic and closed. After a while in the glass, it starts to soften, showing mushroom, cola, pomegranate and raspberry flavors, but it's still resistant. Give it until 2018, and it should gradually unfold for another few years afterward.
Refined-description: Right bottle wine tannic closed After glass start soften showing mushroom cola pomegranate raspberry flavor still resistant Give 2018 gradually unfold another year afterward

description: You can call this Pinot thin, or you can call it elusive. While it does show the lean profile of the 2011 vintage, it's quite complex, offering high acid-inspired flavors of raspberry sour candy, chamomile tea and cranberries, plus minerally, dried herb complexities. Drinking through 2020.

description: Smooth, earthy, lightly herbal aromas are balanced by fresh red-berry notes. This feels racy and lean in the mouth, with nothing fat or grabby getting in the way of steady raspberry, plum and herbal flavors. A note of olive and leafy green rises up on the finish.

description: This grape variety originated in Spain and is also popular in the southern Rhône Valley of France. In this bottling, smoky, chocolaty aromas lead to blackberry and dark cherry flavors, a broad, generous texture and moderate tannins. It's rather big in structure but not heavy.

description: Quara makes good, true Cafayate Torrontés. Aromas of lychee, citrus, tropical fruits and bath oils are vital. This remains solid and clean, with upright acidity. Lime, mango, lychee and banana flavors finish round, with just enough acidity to maintain the wine's character. Drink immediately.

description: While 2010 was a great vintage in most of Spain, parts of Bierzo had a mildew problem and thus some wines are less than fully ripe. This seems to be a case in point; it's scratchy on the nose, with a sinewy, drawing mouthfeel that's only partly covered up by oak. Prickly berry and black cherry flavors finish tight, with scraping tannins. Drink now with meat or cheese.
Refined-description: While 2010 great vintage Spain part Bierzo mildew problem thus wine le fully ripe This seems case point scratchy nose sinewy drawing mouthfeel partly covered oak Prickly berry black cherry flavor finish tight scraping tannin Drink meat cheese

description: Hints of lemon curd and struck flint emerge from they lass, while the palate reveals flavors of apple, pear and citrus. With its pared-back flavors and restrained nature, this medium-bodied Chardonnay should prove versatile at the table. Drink now–2016.

description: Aromas of ripe plum, rose petals, cake spices and toasted oak lead the nose on this structured wine. The rich palate opens with a burst of dark cherry fruit followed by accents of roasted coffee bean, espresso, and vanilla. The succulent midpalate is cut short by astringent wood tannins that leave the mouth feeling dried out.

description: While the wine has plenty of the tannins typical of 2011 at this stage, it also has ripe fruit, full of blackberry and currant flavors. The balance is already there, giving a potentially rich, juicy and generous wine. Drink from 2017.

description: With aromas and flavors reminiscent of apple skin, peach skin, white pepper and pomegranate seed, this tastes crisp, tangy, slightly bitter, and has great bright acidity. description: Luminous and fresh, this opens with aromas of red berry, violet, chopped herb and a whiff of baking spice. The vibrant, linear palate offers red cherry, strawberry, white pepper and star anise alongside racy acidity and polished tannins. Enjoy through 2018.
Refined-description: Luminous fresh open aroma red berry violet chopped herb whiff baking spice The vibrant linear palate offer red cherry strawberry white pepper star anise alongside racy acidity polished tannin Enjoy 2018

description: Pressed violet, perfumed berry and a hint of baking spice aromas unfold on this sleek, savory red. The medium-bodied palate delivers ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon, clove and star anise alongside firm, polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
Refined-description: Pressed violet perfumed berry hint baking spice aroma unfold sleek savory red The mediumbodied palate delivers ripe black cherry crushed raspberry cinnamon clove star anise alongside firm polished tannin Drink 2021

description: This is made from 92% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Pinot Noir, an interesting and fulfilling combination thats robust on the palate. Pinkish-orange in color, it's both tangy and weighty, finishing dry in orange zest.
Refined-description: This made 92 Cabernet Sauvignon 8 Pinot Noir interesting fulfilling combination thats robust palate Pinkishorange color tangy weighty finishing dry orange zest

description: Black-olive tapenade is the star of this show, along with fig, black currant and cedar. Bittersweet cocoa accents the powerful tannin and integrated oak, before finishing velvety smooth.
Refined-description: Blackolive tapenade star show along fig black currant cedar Bittersweet cocoa accent powerful tannin integrated oak finishing velvety smooth

description: There is a toasty aroma in this wine that comes from a premier cru next door to Chassagne-Montrachet. This toastiness continues into a spicy, toasty note. A good sense of fruitiness gives the wine a ripe and rich character that will allow it to mature well. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: There toasty aroma wine come premier cru next door ChassagneMontrachet This toastiness continues spicy toasty note A good sense fruitiness give wine ripe rich character allow mature well Drink 2017

description: Lusciously ripe mango and lychee aromas introduce this unusually sprightly Gewürztraminer. Perfumed and delicately sweet, but not at all cloying, it's vivacious and thirst quenching, finishing on a enticingly astringent tea-leaf note. Drink now through 2018.
Refined-description: Lusciously ripe mango lychee aroma introduce unusually sprightly Gewürztraminer Perfumed delicately sweet cloying vivacious thirst quenching finishing enticingly astringent tealeaf note Drink 2018

description: From the cool plains of the Petaluma Gap, this wine shines in violet and blueberry crumble aromas. Light bodied, it reveals deeper, darker pepper steak-like flavors as it opens, finishing on an elegant aftertaste of clove.
Refined-description: From cool plain Petaluma Gap wine shine violet blueberry crumble aroma Light bodied reveals deeper darker pepper steaklike flavor open finishing elegant aftertaste clove

description: Usually the bigger, more opulent of the Kumeu River Chardonnays, the 2015 version of the Coddington is medium to full in weight, but strikingly focused and vibrant. Bacony smoke notes frame white peach flavors, finishing long.
Refined-description: Usually bigger opulent Kumeu River Chardonnays 2015 version Coddington medium full weight strikingly focused vibrant Bacony smoke note frame white peach flavor finishing long

description: This premium cuvée from Eugénie is packed both with superripe fruit and layers of wood aging flavors. The fruit of this impressive wine is still pushing through the dark tannins that give a dry dusty edge to the wine. It is powerful and rich and should age. Drink from 2020.
Refined-description: This premium cuvée Eugénie packed superripe fruit layer wood aging flavor The fruit impressive wine still pushing dark tannin give dry dusty edge wine It powerful rich age Drink 2020

description: Vines up to 50-years-old are the basis of this rich and tannic wine. While it does have some age, it still has a way to go. Big bold tannins show strongly along with ripe black-plum skins. The wood aging has given this wine a smooth elegant edge that contrasts with the still young fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
Refined-description: Vines 50yearsold basis rich tannic wine While age still way go Big bold tannin show strongly along ripe blackplum skin The wood aging given wine smooth elegant edge contrast still young fruitiness Drink 2021

description: Rich red cherry, rhubarb and alpine strawberry aromas meet rust and shaved licorice on the nose of this beautiful bottling from the Parker family's cool-climate vineyard. It's deceptively light on the palate, with airy flavors that intensify to exotic cherry, mulberry, tea leaf and maduro cigar, framed by firm, structured tannins. Drink 2020–2024.
Refined-description: Rich red cherry rhubarb alpine strawberry aroma meet rust shaved licorice nose beautiful bottling Parker family coolclimate vineyard It deceptively light palate airy flavor intensify exotic cherry mulberry tea leaf maduro cigar framed firm structured tannin Drink 2020–2024

description: This wine comes from one of the producer's oldest blocks in Carneros, where grapes retain vibrant acidity. Reduced on the nose, it opens up into a mix of fennel, preserved lemon and almond aromas that follow through on the steely palate with grace.
Refined-description: This wine come one producer oldest block Carneros grape retain vibrant acidity Reduced nose open mix fennel preserved lemon almond aroma follow steely palate grace

description: From a new, small producer, this vibrantly peppery wine captures the power and grace the variety is capable of when grown on the far reaches of the coast. That peppery quality follows through on the palate, buoyed by juicy acidity and smoothly layered blackberry, tobacco and tea flavors. Exquisitely made and worth seeking out.
Refined-description: From new small producer vibrantly peppery wine capture power grace variety capable grown far reach coast That peppery quality follows palate buoyed juicy acidity smoothly layered blackberry tobacco tea flavor Exquisitely made worth seeking

description: The biggest production and lowest priced of all the winery's vineyard designates, this is sexy, substantial and one of the best offerings from any winery sourcing fruit from this exceptional vineyard. A riot of berries, plums and Asian spices fills the mouth—well-integrated, layered and detailed right on through the extended finish. A light dusting of cocoa powder lingers and invites the next sip.
Refined-description: The biggest production lowest priced winery vineyard designates sexy substantial one best offering winery sourcing fruit exceptional vineyard A riot berry plum Asian spice fill mouth—wellintegrated layered detailed right extended finish A light dusting cocoa powder lingers invite next sip

description: Vinified by the former Margerum winemaker (who now works for Morgan Winery), this bottling from one of the appellation's most exciting vineyards is chock-full of baked red cherry, vanilla, clove and gravel aromas. Though light and bright in body, the palate packs intriguing flavors, from raspberry and rose petal to dried fennel and dill.
Refined-description: Vinified former Margerum winemaker work Morgan Winery bottling one appellation exciting vineyard chockfull baked red cherry vanilla clove gravel aroma Though light bright body palate pack intriguing flavor raspberry rose petal dried fennel dill

description: Wonderfully aromatic fruit rises from the glass: blueberry with cinnamon and violet overtones, hints of plum and pepper and a pervasive elderberry note. This is a wonderfully elegant medium-bodied wine with a distinct but unobtrusive structure that lets the fruit speak clearly and honestly. Fresh and elegant now, it's sure to develop and evolve. Drink now–2025.
Refined-description: Wonderfully aromatic fruit rise glass blueberry cinnamon violet overtone hint plum pepper pervasive elderberry note This wonderfully elegant mediumbodied wine distinct unobtrusive structure let fruit speak clearly honestly Fresh elegant sure develop evolve Drink now–2025

description: From dry-farmed estate vines, this savory, classically styled red offers nuances of cedar, dried herb and peppercorn. It's aromatically reminiscent of the forest that surrounds the estate, delivering a balanced landscape of subtle, elegant flavor and length.
Refined-description: From dryfarmed estate vine savory classically styled red offer nuance cedar dried herb peppercorn It aromatically reminiscent forest surround estate delivering balanced landscape subtle elegant flavor length

description: The floral, vanilla tone of new oak marries with ripe, red cherry notes in this wine, supported by clove and violet highlights. It's young and taut on the palate, its fine tannins still firm and crunchy, needing time to evolve and relax. Pure fruit and the pervasive freshness promise a bright future. Drink 2019–2025.
Refined-description: The floral vanilla tone new oak marries ripe red cherry note wine supported clove violet highlight It young taut palate fine tannin still firm crunchy needing time evolve relax Pure fruit pervasive freshness promise bright future Drink 2019–2025

description: This wine offers aromas of herb, tobacco, barrel spice and plum. The palate brings plush rich textured plum flavors, showing a beautiful sense of purity along with a crazy-long finish. It's a shamelessly delicious but still impeccably balanced wine that is nearly impossible to put down.
Refined-description: This wine offer aroma herb tobacco barrel spice plum The palate brings plush rich textured plum flavor showing beautiful sense purity along crazylong finish It shamelessly delicious still impeccably balanced wine nearly impossible put

description: Ripe but subtle aromas of aged balsamic vinegar, blackberry, baked plum and vanilla are alluring and feed into a flush layered palate. Spicy black plum and berry flavors are just rustic and toasty enough, while this blend of 85% Cabernet Sauvignon with Cab Franc and Merlot tastes peppery, deep, a touch hot and on the money. Drink from 2018–2026.
Refined-description: Ripe subtle aroma aged balsamic vinegar blackberry baked plum vanilla alluring feed flush layered palate Spicy black plum berry flavor rustic toasty enough blend 85 Cabernet Sauvignon Cab Franc Merlot taste peppery deep touch hot money Drink 2018–2026

description: Envoy is Spy Valley's top range of bottlings. In this case, it's a single-vineyard wine that's fermented and matured in oak for 11 months. It's medium-bodied and silky in texture, with distinctive fumé notes, hints of struck match, and layers of passion fruit and grapefruit flavors. Dry, austere and long on the finish, it's a compelling example of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc.
Refined-description: Envoy Spy Valley top range bottlings In case singlevineyard wine fermented matured oak 11 month It mediumbodied silky texture distinctive fumé note hint struck match layer passion fruit grapefruit flavor Dry austere long finish compelling example New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc

description: This wine shows a fine balance between sweetness (74 g/L) and acidity, reminiscent of a spätlese style. Striking scents of crushed stone, beeswax and lime burst from the glass, while the flavors combine peach and citrus notes. The finish shines, marrying sugar and acid into a long, tongue-tingling finale.
Refined-description: This wine show fine balance sweetness 74 gL acidity reminiscent spätlese style Striking scent crushed stone beeswax lime burst glass flavor combine peach citrus note The finish shine marrying sugar acid long tonguetingling finale

description: This blend of 35% Chardonnay, 35% Pinot Blanc and 30% Pinot Gris from La Encantada Vineyard is a stunner, starting with its crystalline brilliance in the glass. Lime blossom, pomelo, baking soda and lanolin aromas lead into a grippy palate of green apple, chalk and wet cement. Extremely tense and compelling.
Refined-description: This blend 35 Chardonnay 35 Pinot Blanc 30 Pinot Gris La Encantada Vineyard stunner starting crystalline brilliance glass Lime blossom pomelo baking soda lanolin aroma lead grippy palate green apple chalk wet cement Extremely tense compelling

description: This cuvée, says winemaker Josh Bergström, is crafted to compete with village Burgundies. Principally Temperance Hill fruit, it more than does the job, with great mouthfeel, and a succulent tangy ripe mix of citrus and stone fruits. There's a lick of caramel apple coming through also, and the wine is bursting with bright flavors across the board.
Refined-description: This cuvée say winemaker Josh Bergström crafted compete village Burgundies Principally Temperance Hill fruit job great mouthfeel succulent tangy ripe mix citrus stone fruit There lick caramel apple coming also wine bursting bright flavor across board

description: Actress Challen Cates got interested in wine when her father ran Tantara Winery. She's since hired winemaker Kevin Law to deliver great bottlings like this one. It's redolent with sarsaparilla, red plum, mulberry and cola, and shows deft balance on the palate, combining plum, cherry, licorice and ginger flavors.
Refined-description: Actress Challen Cates got interested wine father ran Tantara Winery She since hired winemaker Kevin Law deliver great bottlings like one It redolent sarsaparilla red plum mulberry cola show deft balance palate combining plum cherry licorice ginger flavor

description: Aromas of roasted earth, leather and fine oak are more out-front than berry fruit, and that's the way it should be for a Gran Reserva. This feels bold, lively and still a touch bumpy. Chocolaty oak and vanilla notes rest comfortably on top of ripe berry and black-plum flavors, while the finish is persistently earthy and chocolaty. Drink through 2028.
Refined-description: Aromas roasted earth leather fine oak outfront berry fruit way Gran Reserva This feel bold lively still touch bumpy Chocolaty oak vanilla note rest comfortably top ripe berry blackplum flavor finish persistently earthy chocolaty Drink 2028

description: A ripe fruity set of berry and cassis aromas shows a slight hint of raisin. This is a stacked saturated wine with raw tannins and plenty of power. Blackberry and earthy notes finish stout and compact: this doesn't vary or waver on the back end. Best from 2019–2026.
Refined-description: A ripe fruity set berry cassis aroma show slight hint raisin This stacked saturated wine raw tannin plenty power Blackberry earthy note finish stout compact nt vary waver back end Best 2019–2026

description: A more intense version of Carraovejas's Reserva from 2012, this also includes more than 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Thus it's spicy and prickly on the nose, with road tar and peppery notes in addition to potent berry fruit. A rich saturated rumbling palate deals coffee, toast, blackberry and herbal flavors that are much like the Reserva but more amplified. A charred finish has a lemony ring to it. Drink from 2020 through 2030.
Refined-description: A intense version Carraovejas Reserva 2012 also includes 20 Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot Thus spicy prickly nose road tar peppery note addition potent berry fruit A rich saturated rumbling palate deal coffee toast blackberry herbal flavor much like Reserva amplified A charred finish lemony ring Drink 2020 2030

description: Dominated by the local Mourvèdre grapes, this is a ripe and complex wine. Its acidity is integrated with rich yellow fruits, spice and perfume. The wine is floral, poised and very stylish. Drink from late 2017.
Refined-description: Dominated local Mourvèdre grape ripe complex wine Its acidity integrated rich yellow fruit spice perfume The wine floral poised stylish Drink late 2017

description: Savory in aroma, richly fruity and accented with butter and vanilla, this wine has a complete package of flavors and an expert balance to accompany its creamy viscosity. It combines lightly toasty, earthy notes with generous pear and citrus flavors in a way that's unusual and compelling. Best after 2020.
Refined-description: Savory aroma richly fruity accented butter vanilla wine complete package flavor expert balance accompany creamy viscosity It combine lightly toasty earthy note generous pear citrus flavor way unusual compelling Best 2020

description: Forest floor, leather, tilled soil, ripe berry and balsam are some of the aromas you'll find in this delicious red. The smooth, dense palate delivers blackberry jam, espresso, licorice and ground pepper flavors, blanketed with soft, silky tannins. Tobacco and graphite notes linger on the finish. Drink through 2020.
Refined-description: Forest floor leather tilled soil ripe berry balsam aroma find delicious red The smooth dense palate delivers blackberry jam espresso licorice ground pepper flavor blanketed soft silky tannin Tobacco graphite note linger finish Drink 2020

description: Juicy strawberry and red plum aromas meet cinnamon, sassafras and earthy scents in this bottling from winemaker Colin Murphy. Beautiful layers of sour cherry combine with dried fennel, wild mint, thyme and rose petal flavors on the palate, which finishes clean and crisp.
Refined-description: Juicy strawberry red plum aroma meet cinnamon sassafras earthy scent bottling winemaker Colin Murphy Beautiful layer sour cherry combine dried fennel wild mint thyme rose petal flavor palate finish clean crisp

description: A blend of fruit from Watermill, Funk, Lewis and Anna Marie vineyards, the aromas bring vibrant notes of flowers, ham hock, berry, tapenade, herb and ember. The palate is plush yet elegant and silky in feel, showing an exquisite mix of fruit and savory flavors along with outrageous hang time on the finish. It shows a lot of subtlety.
Refined-description: A blend fruit Watermill Funk Lewis Anna Marie vineyard aroma bring vibrant note flower ham hock berry tapenade herb ember The palate plush yet elegant silky feel showing exquisite mix fruit savory flavor along outrageous hang time finish It show lot subtlety

description: This wine's dried pear, hay and hayflower scents create an immediate impression of richness. The palate underlines all of these generous flavors with a unique, streamlined freshness that illuminates. This is what happens when good Grüner Veltliner benefits from a little bottle age: Its herbal, lifted allure comes to the fore. Savor this.
Refined-description: This wine dried pear hay hayflower scent create immediate impression richness The palate underline generous flavor unique streamlined freshness illuminates This happens good Grüner Veltliner benefit little bottle age Its herbal lifted allure come fore Savor

description: This wine's fresh, ripe red cherry and aromatic strawberry touches make for an inviting nose. The palate shows the same intense primary fruit, bolstered by freshness and a fine, filigreed structure. Its supple, pure fruit makes it very enjoyable now, but it's sure to evolve further with bottle age. Drink now–2025.
Refined-description: This wine fresh ripe red cherry aromatic strawberry touch make inviting nose The palate show intense primary fruit bolstered freshness fine filigreed structure Its supple pure fruit make enjoyable sure evolve bottle age Drink now–2025

description: From the vineyard planted by the Pisoni and Franscioni families, this wine delivers bright raspberry and strawberry aromas with sweet star anise spice. The medium-bodied palate is lively and boisterous, with ripe cranberry, tangy red plum skin and sour cherry flavors, accented with a helping of dried herbs.
Refined-description: From vineyard planted Pisoni Franscioni family wine delivers bright raspberry strawberry aroma sweet star anise spice The mediumbodied palate lively boisterous ripe cranberry tangy red plum skin sour cherry flavor accented helping dried herb

description: Firm and focused, this lightly spiced effort supports its tart cherry fruit with ample acidity. Hints of toasted coconut build in the finish. A few more years of bottle age should bring further integration.
Refined-description: Firm focused lightly spiced effort support tart cherry fruit ample acidity Hints toasted coconut build finish A year bottle age bring integration

description: A striking shade of amber/orange, this soft and fruity wine is open and loose knit, with broad flavors of mature, slightly oxidized tree fruits, plus lightly spicy notes of cinnamon and baking spices. It's very well made, but well apart from any standard approach.
Refined-description: A striking shade amberorange soft fruity wine open loose knit broad flavor mature slightly oxidized tree fruit plus lightly spicy note cinnamon baking spice It well made well apart standard approach

description: A delicate streak of honeycomb gilds layers of yellow peaches, apples and tangerines in this off-dry Riesling. Its concentrated fruitiness is lip smacking, but it's also quite elegant, reverberating long on a steely strike of acidity and minerality. Drink now through 2020.
Refined-description: A delicate streak honeycomb gild layer yellow peach apple tangerine offdry Riesling Its concentrated fruitiness lip smacking also quite elegant reverberating long steely strike acidity minerality Drink 2020

description: Mature black fruit, toast and spice aromas lead the nose. The firm palate is still tightly wound, offering baked black cherry, licorice and espresso balanced by youthfully assertive, taut tannins. Drink after 2019.
Refined-description: Mature black fruit toast spice aroma lead nose The firm palate still tightly wound offering baked black cherry licorice espresso balanced youthfully assertive taut tannin Drink 2019

description: Crushed rose, pressed violet, perfumed berry, sage and a balsamic note are just some of the aromas you'll find on this full-bodied red. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, black pepper and licorice alongside tightly knit tannins and the subtle warmth of alcohol. Give it a few more years to come together. Drink 2018–2016.
Refined-description: Crushed rose pressed violet perfumed berry sage balsamic note aroma find fullbodied red The firm palate offer dried black cherry black pepper licorice alongside tightly knit tannin subtle warmth alcohol Give year come together Drink 2018–2016

description: A nose of wild blackberry and brambles lays the groundwork for a tender dance of fruit and herbal flavors, especially blackberry, pomegranate, eucalyptus and fennel bulb. Mouth-coating tannins dissipate on the finish, joined by a burst of tart pomegranate.
Refined-description: A nose wild blackberry bramble lay groundwork tender dance fruit herbal flavor especially blackberry pomegranate eucalyptus fennel bulb Mouthcoating tannin dissipate finish joined burst tart pomegranate

description: Produced from vines grown in a boulder and fossil strewn vineyard, this is a rich smoky wine. It has a deep color from the Alicante Bouschet in the blend, with firm tannins and dark juicy plum skin flavors. It's going to be a ripe rich wine as it develops. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Produced vine grown boulder fossil strewn vineyard rich smoky wine It deep color Alicante Bouschet blend firm tannin dark juicy plum skin flavor It going ripe rich wine develops Drink 2017

description: This lovely wine captures the floral, perfumed essence of the grape in a restrained, sippable style. It's dry and crisp, with lemony fruit and the delicate sensation that you are drinking fresh flowers.
Refined-description: This lovely wine capture floral perfumed essence grape restrained sippable style It dry crisp lemony fruit delicate sensation drinking fresh flower

description: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched earth, ripe berry, leather and a funky whiff of game. The full-bodied palate offers mature black cherry, black raspberry, truffle, grilled sage, ground pepper and a hint of tobacco alongside youthfully assertive, solid tannins. Drink after 2018.
Refined-description: This open earthy aroma scorched earth ripe berry leather funky whiff game The fullbodied palate offer mature black cherry black raspberry truffle grilled sage ground pepper hint tobacco alongside youthfully assertive solid tannin Drink 2018

description: Root beer, cola nut, black cherry, black raspberry and anise seed combine for an exciting nose on this bottling from a winery near Morgan Hill. The mouthfeel is full, with graphite and lively fennel-bulb spice mixing with blackberry fruit and an earthy elegance on the pleasing palate.
Refined-description: Root beer cola nut black cherry black raspberry anise seed combine exciting nose bottling winery near Morgan Hill The mouthfeel full graphite lively fennelbulb spice mixing blackberry fruit earthy elegance pleasing palate

description: Juicy succulent tangerine and yellow peach flavors meld on the palate of this forward fruity off-dry wine. On first taste, it's quite straightforward, but added attention reveals glimmers of spice, saffron and mineral complexities. Drink now through 2024.
Refined-description: Juicy succulent tangerine yellow peach flavor meld palate forward fruity offdry wine On first taste quite straightforward added attention reveals glimmer spice saffron mineral complexity Drink 2024

description: Situated in the center of the premier crus of Puligny, Champgains produces an elegant, textured wine. This bottling, with the warmth of 2013 behind it, is fragrant with white fruits and has a soft aftertaste. It needs to age to bring it out its more complex character, so wait until 2018.
Refined-description: Situated center premier crus Puligny Champgains produce elegant textured wine This bottling warmth 2013 behind fragrant white fruit soft aftertaste It need age bring complex character wait 2018

description: With its appealing toast and fruit aromas, this is a rich wine. It does keep plenty of steely texture while allowing the yellow fruits, ripe pear and toast to shine. In style it hovers halfway between the ripe, buttery Meursault of the past and the crisper style of today, a fine compromise and ready to drink now.
Refined-description: With appealing toast fruit aroma rich wine It keep plenty steely texture allowing yellow fruit ripe pear toast shine In style hovers halfway ripe buttery Meursault past crisper style today fine compromise ready drink

description: A minuscule amount of this wine is made, coming from 45-year-old vines. Ripe, dense and dusty red and black berries combine against soft, approachable layers of integrated tannin and oak, finishing with leather and cigar.
Refined-description: A minuscule amount wine made coming 45yearold vine Ripe dense dusty red black berry combine soft approachable layer integrated tannin oak finishing leather cigar

description: Aromas of pressed rose, dried berry, leather, chopped herb, cinnamon and a balsamic note emerge in the glass. The subtle palate delivers dried black cherry, black raspberry, licorice and a hint of tobacco alongside firm, ripe tannins. Enjoy sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit richness.
Refined-description: Aromas pressed rose dried berry leather chopped herb cinnamon balsamic note emerge glass The subtle palate delivers dried black cherry black raspberry licorice hint tobacco alongside firm ripe tannin Enjoy sooner rather later capture remaining fruit richness

description: Aromas of mature black plum, espresso, wild rose and spice emerge on this full-bodied red. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, menthol, mint, white pepper, well-integrated oak and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins.
Refined-description: Aromas mature black plum espresso wild rose spice emerge fullbodied red The firm palate offer dried black cherry menthol mint white pepper wellintegrated oak licorice alongside finegrained tannin

description: Pressed rose petal, red berry, chopped herb and a whiff of exotic spice come together on this elegantly structured red. The medium-bodied palate offers juicy wild cherry, crushed raspberry, ground pepper and anise alongside firm, polished tannins. Drink 2017–2023.
Refined-description: Pressed rose petal red berry chopped herb whiff exotic spice come together elegantly structured red The mediumbodied palate offer juicy wild cherry crushed raspberry ground pepper anise alongside firm polished tannin Drink 2017–2023

description: The nose is initially rather closed but eventually reveals dark berry, blue flower and brown baking spice. The ripe palate offers mature black cherry, coffee, cocoa, star anise and chopped sage alongside tightly packed tannins. Give this another two or three years to let the tannins unfurl, then enjoy.
Refined-description: The nose initially rather closed eventually reveals dark berry blue flower brown baking spice The ripe palate offer mature black cherry coffee cocoa star anise chopped sage alongside tightly packed tannin Give another two three year let tannin unfurl enjoy

description: Rose, red berry, baked earth, forest floor and grilled herb aromas lead the nose while the firm palate offers dried black cherry, cake spice and anise. Firm, fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. Drink 2018–2026.
Refined-description: Rose red berry baked earth forest floor grilled herb aroma lead nose firm palate offer dried black cherry cake spice anise Firm finegrained tannin provide backbone Drink 2018–2026

description: Offering aromas of black cherry and green pepper with a whiff of matchstick, this wine has flavors of black cherry, raspberry, smoked meat, mace and green tea. There is a good yin and yang of fruit and savory flavors, while chewy tannins wane at the first sign of orange zest on the bright finish.
Refined-description: Offering aroma black cherry green pepper whiff matchstick wine flavor black cherry raspberry smoked meat mace green tea There good yin yang fruit savory flavor chewy tannin wane first sign orange zest bright finish

description: Blackberry and leather pouch jump from the glass from this full-bodied wine that stays light on its feet despite the generous ripeness. Cinnamon, black pepper and black licorice round out the flavors, finishing soft and with length.
Refined-description: Blackberry leather pouch jump glass fullbodied wine stay light foot despite generous ripeness Cinnamon black pepper black licorice round flavor finishing soft length

description: Although this wine is listed as a white blend, the producer says the variety is Vernaccia, not found often in California. Light in alcohol and approach, it opens in a bouquet of waxy apple and Meyer lemon, followed by a medium-powered palate of pear. The finish is crisp and lean.
Refined-description: Although wine listed white blend producer say variety Vernaccia found often California Light alcohol approach open bouquet waxy apple Meyer lemon followed mediumpowered palate pear The finish crisp lean

description: This pale-colored rosé is made from Chardonnay with the addition of Pinot Noir still wine to give the color. It is fresh and crisp, offering a lively mousse with attractive flavors of raspberry and fresh red currants. With its refreshing acidity, it is ready to drink.
designation: Rosé des Blancs Brut Premier Cru
Refined-description: This palecolored rosé made Chardonnay addition Pinot Noir still wine give color It fresh crisp offering lively mousse attractive flavor raspberry fresh red currant With refreshing acidity ready drink

description: Aromas of dark berry, tilled soil, underbrush and espresso lead the nose while the taut palate offers sour cherry, sage, white pepper and star anise. It's still tightly wound and nervous, with bracing tannins. Drink 2019–2029.
Refined-description: Aromas dark berry tilled soil underbrush espresso lead nose taut palate offer sour cherry sage white pepper star anise It still tightly wound nervous bracing tannin Drink 2019–2029

description: Aromas of oak extract, toast, red berry and espresso wrap around this structured wine. The firm palate offers up sour cherry, ground pepper and licorice alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2018–2028.
Refined-description: Aromas oak extract toast red berry espresso wrap around structured wine The firm palate offer sour cherry ground pepper licorice alongside assertive finegrained tannin Drink 2018–2028

description: Dark plum and milk chocolate are the stars of this chalky, soft wine, almost entirely varietal, with a splash of Petit Verdot. Integrated oak helps make it approachable and fruit-forward, while the finish is subtle in fireplace smoke.
Refined-description: Dark plum milk chocolate star chalky soft wine almost entirely varietal splash Petit Verdot Integrated oak help make approachable fruitforward finish subtle fireplace smoke

description: In this blend, Cabernet Sauvignon was co-fermented with Petite Sirah, with 70% of the grapes grown in the Napa Valley. There's a compelling richness of earthy truffle and red berry in the wine, supported in full-bodied breadth by a grip of tannin. Bennett Valley Syrah and Dry Creek Merlot also figure into the mix.
Refined-description: In blend Cabernet Sauvignon cofermented Petite Sirah 70 grape grown Napa Valley There compelling richness earthy truffle red berry wine supported fullbodied breadth grip tannin Bennett Valley Syrah Dry Creek Merlot also figure mix

description: The regular bottling from the estate vineyard takes the spotlight in 2013, with a lightness and delicacy that in no way means it is simple or insubstantial. There's much to admire, from the silky cherry fruit to the dusty traces of sandalwood, saffron and butter brickle.
Refined-description: The regular bottling estate vineyard take spotlight 2013 lightness delicacy way mean simple insubstantial There much admire silky cherry fruit dusty trace sandalwood saffron butter brickle

description: All Pinot Noir, fermented in neutral oak and put through partial malolactic, this belongs in the rosé category. A pretty, pale-copper color, it offers a pleasing toasted-cracker frame around stone fruit and supple acids. Drink this chilled to white wine temperature.
Refined-description: All Pinot Noir fermented neutral oak put partial malolactic belongs rosé category A pretty palecopper color offer pleasing toastedcracker frame around stone fruit supple acid Drink chilled white wine temperature

description: This blend of 71% Roussanne, 21% Grenache Blanc and 8% Picpoul Blanc offers cut Meyer lemon, tangerine and pink-grapefruit aromas on the nose, along with the promise of a creamy palate. Instead, the palate is quite tight and restrained, starting tart but opening toward lemon rinds and pear flesh, and wiping up clean on the finish.
Refined-description: This blend 71 Roussanne 21 Grenache Blanc 8 Picpoul Blanc offer cut Meyer lemon tangerine pinkgrapefruit aroma nose along promise creamy palate Instead palate quite tight restrained starting tart opening toward lemon rind pear flesh wiping clean finish

description: Still young, the wine is very mineral, smoky and tight, with considerable structure and concentration. The apple and citrus fruits are attractive, although almost a sideshow compared with the texture of the wine. Drink from 2017.

description: Creamy and lush, this offers currents of tropical coconut complemented by floral gardenia and pear. Made in a fuller style than some of the winery's other vineyard-specific wines, the generosity of fruit is expertly offset by searingly pleasant acidity, sustaining it sip after sip.

description: From winemaker Bryan Kane, who also makes the Howell Mountain Vineyards' wines, comes this tiny-production Cabernet Sauvignon from two separate Howell Mountain sources. A delight in black plum, licorice and peppery leather, it's soft and complex. Boysenberry highlights the fruit components, while the finish is deftly marked by wild vanilla.

description: Pineapple, candied apple and a touch of guava jelly on toast achieve great aromatic balance on a rare Rancho Santa Rosa Chardonnay. The flavors are lush, not racy, and evolve in a mellow fashion, from apple to nectarine and then papaya.

Sanguine and smoky, the fruit leans toward blueberry and the texture to leather, a streak of graphite in the background. Tannins are firm and sizable, with a balanced finish.

Finishing notes of tobacco, herb and oak cement this big-boned wine's ripe, beefy status. Drink through 2018.

Rich and full in flavor, it's sleek in texture, but not too full-bodied.
