description: Neutral on the nose except for a whiff of apple, this is a wine to drink now. A round, pulpy palate is balanced by citric acidity, while waxy flavors of baked apple and peach finish briny and round, with a hint of green banana.
Refined-description: Neutral nose except whiff apple wine drink A round pulpy palate balanced citric acidity waxy flavor baked apple peach finish briny round hint green banana

description: Moderately aromatic, this recalls lime leaf and mineral. It drinks off dry with tangerine and other citrus flavors.
Refined-description: Moderately aromatic recall lime leaf mineral It drink dry tangerine citrus flavor

description: A blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, this conveys aromas of vanilla, oak, red currant and cedar. The hearty palate displays mature plum, dried cherry, espresso and bell pepper alongside drying tannins. It finishes with the heat of alcohol.
Refined-description: A blend 50 Cabernet Sauvignon 30 Merlot 15 Cabernet Franc 5 Petit Verdot conveys aroma vanilla oak red currant cedar The hearty palate display mature plum dried cherry espresso bell pepper alongside drying tannin It finish heat alcohol

description: Ripe and fruity, this is packed with black currant juiciness supported by a strong tannic element. Vineyards close to the Gironde estuary give this property a fine location. The smokiness of the wood combines with bright acidity at the end.
Refined-description: Ripe fruity packed black currant juiciness supported strong tannic element Vineyards close Gironde estuary give property fine location The smokiness wood combine bright acidity end

description: Firm and dense, this is a wine with a good future. Its blackberry fruits, smoky dry tannins and touches of wood aging are joined with acidity to bring out a structured character. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: Firm dense wine good future Its blackberry fruit smoky dry tannin touch wood aging joined acidity bring structured character Drink 2016

description: This smoky wine has firm tannins and a tough core. The juicy fruit is taking its time develop, although it will provide density and ripe berry fruits in time. The vineyard, created in the early 1980s, is now at peak maturity. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: This smoky wine firm tannin tough core The juicy fruit taking time develop although provide density ripe berry fruit time The vineyard created early 1980s peak maturity Drink 2017

description: Ripe and perfumed, this is packed with the richness of 2010 along with its structure. It has weight, juicy black and red berry fruits and a tense structure that still needs time. Acidity at the end provides a fresh lift to the essentially firm wine.
Refined-description: Ripe perfumed packed richness 2010 along structure It weight juicy black red berry fruit tense structure still need time Acidity end provides fresh lift essentially firm wine

description: While the wood aging of this wine still shows, it's already balancing out with the ripe black fruits and rich structure. An attractive smoky character is followed by juicy berry flavors and acidity. This is a wine to age, so wait until 2017.
Refined-description: While wood aging wine still show already balancing ripe black fruit rich structure An attractive smoky character followed juicy berry flavor acidity This wine age wait 2017

description: One of Bordeaux's more memorable labels (orange nymphs supporting a picture of the chateau), Saransot-Dupré is one of a number of chateaus in Listrac with the Dupré suffix. This is a solid wine, chunky in a typical way for the appellation with plenty of black fruits and balanced tannins. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: One Bordeaux memorable label orange nymph supporting picture chateau SaransotDupré one number chateau Listrac Dupré suffix This solid wine chunky typical way appellation plenty black fruit balanced tannin Drink 2017

description: Big in flavor and ripeness, this full-bodied wine tastes concentrated and feels lush, almost soft. It smells like boysenberry jam, tastes like dried cherries and dried plums and has a streak of raspberry that lifts it a bit.
Refined-description: Big flavor ripeness fullbodied wine taste concentrated feel lush almost soft It smell like boysenberry jam taste like dried cherry dried plum streak raspberry lift bit

description: Crushed rocks and smoke mingle with savory dried herb and bramble in this lean, dry wine. Lemon-lime acidity reverberates against a core of fresh pear flavor. The finish is tight and brisk.
Refined-description: Crushed rock smoke mingle savory dried herb bramble lean dry wine Lemonlime acidity reverberates core fresh pear flavor The finish tight brisk

description: Potent black-plum and black-cherry aromas come with a ton of grainy, spicy oak. This is both fresh and bright as well as dark, brawny and roasted in character. Flavors of ripe blackberry and cherry share the stage with toasty, charred oak and spice flavors in front of an aggressive but tasty finish.
Refined-description: Potent blackplum blackcherry aroma come ton grainy spicy oak This fresh bright well dark brawny roasted character Flavors ripe blackberry cherry share stage toasty charred oak spice flavor front aggressive tasty finish

description: This savory blend of Sangiovese, Merlot, Alicante and a dollop of Petit Verdot and Colorino delivers core flavors of crushed plum and ripe blackberry, accented with notes of white pepper, clove and dried herbs. It's easy drinking and balanced, with fine-grained tannins.
Refined-description: This savory blend Sangiovese Merlot Alicante dollop Petit Verdot Colorino delivers core flavor crushed plum ripe blackberry accented note white pepper clove dried herb It easy drinking balanced finegrained tannin

description: This is unusual for a reserve, in that it's lower in alcohol than the regular bottling, and more cases were produced. The light fruits and herbs—green apple and lemon verbena in particular—are highlighted with tarragon and citrus peel. The complexity compensates for the just-on-the-edge ripeness, and time in 20% new oak adds a buttery note to the finish.
Refined-description: This unusual reserve lower alcohol regular bottling case produced The light fruit herbs—green apple lemon verbena particular—are highlighted tarragon citrus peel The complexity compensates justontheedge ripeness time 20 new oak add buttery note finish

description: Produced from a selection of small parcels, this perfumed wood-aged wine is big and concentrated while also keeping style and balance. It is dark, firm in the center with tannins that are surrounded by juicy acidity and black currant fruits. Keep for a few more months and drink from 2016.
Refined-description: Produced selection small parcel perfumed woodaged wine big concentrated also keeping style balance It dark firm center tannin surrounded juicy acidity black currant fruit Keep month drink 2016

description: A jammy, ripe wine that's deliciously full of plum jelly flavors. The dry, dusty tannins are in the background enhancing the structure although still leaving the rich fruit and wood flavors at the front. Drink this full-bodied wine from 2017.
Refined-description: A jammy ripe wine deliciously full plum jelly flavor The dry dusty tannin background enhancing structure although still leaving rich fruit wood flavor front Drink fullbodied wine 2017

description: This is a ripe, perfumed wine with smooth, generous texture and broad black fruits. An earthy, leathery edge gives extra character, and the suggestion of maturity comes from the wood aging and the ripe berry fruits. Drink now.
Refined-description: This ripe perfumed wine smooth generous texture broad black fruit An earthy leathery edge give extra character suggestion maturity come wood aging ripe berry fruit Drink

description: This Rogue Valley Pinot is markedly different from more familiar Willamette Valley styles. Though not at all fleshy, it has pretty, sculpted strawberry and raspberry fruit, lightly candied and fully ripened. A wash of butterscotch wraps around the pleasing finish.
Refined-description: This Rogue Valley Pinot markedly different familiar Willamette Valley style Though fleshy pretty sculpted strawberry raspberry fruit lightly candied fully ripened A wash butterscotch wrap around pleasing finish

description: Made from the oldest vines on the estate, this ripe and fruity wine is ready to drink. Its tannins are already integrated, leaving a smooth-textured wine that is accompanied by spice and red plum fruit flavors.
Refined-description: Made oldest vine estate ripe fruity wine ready drink Its tannin already integrated leaving smoothtextured wine accompanied spice red plum fruit flavor

description: Puckering lime zest and lemon notes are softened by crisp yellow peach and nectarine in this dry, light-bodied Riesling. Racy and brisk, it finishes with an elegant crush of minerals. Drink now.
Refined-description: Puckering lime zest lemon note softened crisp yellow peach nectarine dry lightbodied Riesling Racy brisk finish elegant crush mineral Drink

description: On the nose, this is challenging: gaseous, oaky aromas of wet cement also contain notes of bitter lettuce, baking spices and general grit. Raw, tannic and abrasive on the palate, this unfolds to offer herbal flavors of berry and plum. Tannic, scratchy, rugged and mildly green on the finish.
Refined-description: On nose challenging gaseous oaky aroma wet cement also contain note bitter lettuce baking spice general grit Raw tannic abrasive palate unfolds offer herbal flavor berry plum Tannic scratchy rugged mildly green finish

description: Muscular, leathery aromas of dark-berry fruits come with a can't-miss animal element. This Grenache-Carignan blend features a powerful grip and grabby texture. Earthy, jammy flavors of raspberry and plum end with herbal accents, dry spice and the taste of bitter black cherry.
Refined-description: Muscular leathery aroma darkberry fruit come cantmiss animal element This GrenacheCarignan blend feature powerful grip grabby texture Earthy jammy flavor raspberry plum end herbal accent dry spice taste bitter black cherry

description: Savory meat and vanilla on the nose lead into flavors of cherry, pepper and plum in this well-made, balanced red. Fresh but fruity, the wine has a wave of warming spice and a clean finish that will pair well with grilled meats, salmon and cheeses.
Refined-description: Savory meat vanilla nose lead flavor cherry pepper plum wellmade balanced red Fresh fruity wine wave warming spice clean finish pair well grilled meat salmon cheese

description: This is a light-tasting, dry wine with white pepper and fennel aromas, crisp green apple and lemon flavors, and a savory, earthy nuance that adds complexity. Medium bodied and mouth-filling, this interesting wine steps outside the flavor box.
Refined-description: This lighttasting dry wine white pepper fennel aroma crisp green apple lemon flavor savory earthy nuance add complexity Medium bodied mouthfilling interesting wine step outside flavor box

description: This blend of half Merlot, half Cabernet Sauvignon is rustically earthy and soft, betraying the plush, plummy Merlot. Tight on the finish and medium in weight, it has a black peppery finish that appeals and suggests pairing with well-seasoned meats.
Refined-description: This blend half Merlot half Cabernet Sauvignon rustically earthy soft betraying plush plummy Merlot Tight finish medium weight black peppery finish appeal suggests pairing wellseasoned meat

description: While this wine has an attractive honey character, it is only lightly sweet. It's more about acidity balanced with richness and a wonderful orange-zest character that gives a lift as well as bright aftertaste. The wine needs until 2016 to get its full act together.
Refined-description: While wine attractive honey character lightly sweet It acidity balanced richness wonderful orangezest character give lift well bright aftertaste The wine need 2016 get full act together

description: This has a very deep red color, spicy aromas like cedar, vanilla and cocoa, and rich, chocolaty, berrylike flavors. While quite full bodied, it's as smooth as velvet due to moderate tannins and soft acidity.
Refined-description: This deep red color spicy aroma like cedar vanilla cocoa rich chocolaty berrylike flavor While quite full bodied smooth velvet due moderate tannin soft acidity

description: The color is not too deep or too light, showing a red-brick rim. Aromas resemble red cherry and cranberry, while fresh, tart and tangy flavors like cranberry and raspberry combine with firm tannins for a bit of grip in the texture. Lean and medium bodied, it will make a versatile foil for food.
Refined-description: The color deep light showing redbrick rim Aromas resemble red cherry cranberry fresh tart tangy flavor like cranberry raspberry combine firm tannin bit grip texture Lean medium bodied make versatile foil food

description: This intriguing wine reflects the typical wild and earthy characteristics of the grape variety. It has smoky, earthy raspberry aromas, plum and pomegranate flavors, a touch of tartness, a smooth texture and medium body. It tastes mature and mellow.
Refined-description: This intriguing wine reflects typical wild earthy characteristic grape variety It smoky earthy raspberry aroma plum pomegranate flavor touch tartness smooth texture medium body It taste mature mellow

description: Here's a savory, easygoing blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Syrah that opens with aromas of red berry and cooking spice. The fresh palate offers black cherries, crushed strawberries, white pepper and a hint of clove alongside bright acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink now.
Refined-description: Here savory easygoing blend Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot Cabernet Franc Syrah open aroma red berry cooking spice The fresh palate offer black cherry crushed strawberry white pepper hint clove alongside bright acidity finegrained tannin Drink

description: A blend of 80% Nebbiolo and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon aged in barriques, this opens with aromas of bell pepper, cedar and red currant. The palate delivers dried black cherries, coffee, mocha and grilled herbs alongside firm, fine-grained tannins.
Refined-description: A blend 80 Nebbiolo 20 Cabernet Sauvignon aged barriques open aroma bell pepper cedar red currant The palate delivers dried black cherry coffee mocha grilled herb alongside firm finegrained tannin

description: From one of the great names of Port, this LBV is a richly sweet wine, full of dried fruits, balanced acidity and a soft, smooth texture. It is a generous, very accessible wine.
Refined-description: From one great name Port LBV richly sweet wine full dried fruit balanced acidity soft smooth texture It generous accessible wine

description: Made from a series of small parcels, this fruity wine shows the fresh side of Malbec. With its gushing purple color and ripe black-plum juice flavors, it's designed to drink young. Try it from 2016.
Refined-description: Made series small parcel fruity wine show fresh side Malbec With gushing purple color ripe blackplum juice flavor designed drink young Try 2016

description: A barrel-selection from multiple vineyard sources, this offers black cherry fruit highlighted by root beer and black licorice. Aging nine months in 25% new barrels adds pleasant toastiness to the finish.
Refined-description: A barrelselection multiple vineyard source offer black cherry fruit highlighted root beer black licorice Aging nine month 25 new barrel add pleasant toastiness finish

description: Bordeaux blends show promise in this region. This combination of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37.5% Merlot and 12.5% Cabernet Franc reveals rustic, leathery aromas of crushed Italian herbs, dried red cherries and fresh dill. Once sipped, flavors of fresh-ground coffee, oregano and bay leaf spice a base of cranberry fruit.
Refined-description: Bordeaux blend show promise region This combination 50 Cabernet Sauvignon 375 Merlot 125 Cabernet Franc reveals rustic leathery aroma crushed Italian herb dried red cherry fresh dill Once sipped flavor freshground coffee oregano bay leaf spice base cranberry fruit

description: There's a respectably complex nose on this pink wine, with lemonade and pressed plums blending into a wet cement minerality. The palate is very tasty, with flavors of pomegranate, dried rose petals, hibiscus, night jasmine and even a clove-laced mocha element proving quite intriguing.
Refined-description: There respectably complex nose pink wine lemonade pressed plum blending wet cement minerality The palate tasty flavor pomegranate dried rose petal hibiscus night jasmine even clovelaced mocha element proving quite intriguing

description: Almost equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon (with slightly more Merlot), this is a reduced and approachable wine. It's slightly syrupy-thick on the palate, juicy in clove, plum and blueberry. A trace of minerality fights for attention around a medium body, finishing fairly quick.
Refined-description: Almost equal part Merlot Cabernet Sauvignon slightly Merlot reduced approachable wine It slightly syrupythick palate juicy clove plum blueberry A trace minerality fight attention around medium body finishing fairly quick

description: Rose petals, violets, red cherries, plums, rhubarb and heavily peppered spices dominate the nose of this tasty wine from a little-known appellation 27 miles inland from Monterey Bay. It's softly textured upon sipping, then acidity shows up and holds through the sip, along with a stemmy tension. Fresh flavors include sour cherries and red berries.
Refined-description: Rose petal violet red cherry plum rhubarb heavily peppered spice dominate nose tasty wine littleknown appellation 27 mile inland Monterey Bay It softly textured upon sipping acidity show hold sip along stemmy tension Fresh flavor include sour cherry red berry

description: The grapes for this wine from regional pioneer Gary Eberle are nearly equally sourced from three vineyards: Steinbeck, Wine-Bush and CoCaVin. The nose is herbal with sagebrush, oregano and thyme, offering just a bit of black plum fruit. The palate is also full of crushed, dried herbs, proving a touch sour and tarry, with cooked strawberry and dried raspberry fruit.
Refined-description: The grape wine regional pioneer Gary Eberle nearly equally sourced three vineyard Steinbeck WineBush CoCaVin The nose herbal sagebrush oregano thyme offering bit black plum fruit The palate also full crushed dried herb proving touch sour tarry cooked strawberry dried raspberry fruit

description: Sourced from vines planted in the 1980s, this tart and steely wine mixes lemongrass and citrus flavors with hints of riper peach. It finishes with suggestions of fresh-brewed tea.
Refined-description: Sourced vine planted 1980s tart steely wine mix lemongrass citrus flavor hint riper peach It finish suggestion freshbrewed tea

description: Lean aromas of bell pepper and green fruits are not overly intense. This is linear, juicy and tight in frame. Flavors of lime, scallion, caper and dry cider finish racy and scouring. Good mouthfeel is a plus.
Refined-description: Lean aroma bell pepper green fruit overly intense This linear juicy tight frame Flavors lime scallion caper dry cider finish racy scouring Good mouthfeel plus

description: There is nothing bashful about this wine. It's big, bold and structured. It holds the potential of great fruitiness as well, a solid core that is surrounded by ripe black berries, just a touch of chocolate and wood. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: There nothing bashful wine It big bold structured It hold potential great fruitiness well solid core surrounded ripe black berry touch chocolate wood Drink 2017

description: Intensely aromatic in spicy black cherry and earthy leather, the Devious Primitivo is more structured than some of Macchia's Zinfandels, more savory than sweet, with tannic grip. Smooth and velvety, it'll impress alongside salumi and other charcuterie.
Refined-description: Intensely aromatic spicy black cherry earthy leather Devious Primitivo structured Macchia Zinfandels savory sweet tannic grip Smooth velvety impress alongside salumi charcuterie

description: It opens with fragrances of stone fruit, Granny Smith apple and white almonds. The succulent palate delivers juicy pear, white peach, nutmeg, white almond and mineral alongside crisp acidity. It's nicely balanced with great length and finesse.
Refined-description: It open fragrance stone fruit Granny Smith apple white almond The succulent palate delivers juicy pear white peach nutmeg white almond mineral alongside crisp acidity It nicely balanced great length finesse

description: Made from grapes grown in one of the best vineyards in the valley, this Syrah is a particular success, given the challenging vintage. It's tannic, bone dry and zesty in acidity, with deeply extracted blackberry, black currant, charred meat bone and black pepper flavors. The long, rich finish suggests aging. Hold until 2017.
Refined-description: Made grape grown one best vineyard valley Syrah particular success given challenging vintage It tannic bone dry zesty acidity deeply extracted blackberry black currant charred meat bone black pepper flavor The long rich finish suggests aging Hold 2017

description: Smoke accents ripe yellow peaches on the nose of this intensely penetrating kabinett. The palate shocks with luscious mango and melon flavors, layered with bristling mineral accents. It finishes long, with a reverberating astringency.
Refined-description: Smoke accent ripe yellow peach nose intensely penetrating kabinett The palate shock luscious mango melon flavor layered bristling mineral accent It finish long reverberating astringency

description: Rich and complex, it unfolds with aromas of graphite, barrel smoke, cured meat and berry fruits that settle on a smooth palate with layering and plush tannins. Bright flavors of blackberry, chocolate and cappuccino finish lightly herbal, with a tobacco note and zero heaviness. Drink through 2018.
Refined-description: Rich complex unfolds aroma graphite barrel smoke cured meat berry fruit settle smooth palate layering plush tannin Bright flavor blackberry chocolate cappuccino finish lightly herbal tobacco note zero heaviness Drink 2018

description: This compelling blend of Viognier, Marsanne and Roussanne—aged for three months in 20% new French oak—brings notes of barrel spices, apricot and pear. There's a touch of sweetness to the full -bodied, textured fruit flavors that provides a perfect counterbalance to the sharply defined, lingering finish.
Refined-description: This compelling blend Viognier Marsanne Roussanne—aged three month 20 new French oak—brings note barrel spice apricot pear There touch sweetness full bodied textured fruit flavor provides perfect counterbalance sharply defined lingering finish

description: Initially this wine is smooth and creamy textured. As it opens up it shows a cool, crisp character, with white apple fruits and layers of spice from wood aging. It's an elegant wine, very balanced already, but likely to age for several years. Drink now and until 2020.
designation: Quinta do Encontro Encontro I Branco
Refined-description: Initially wine smooth creamy textured As open show cool crisp character white apple fruit layer spice wood aging It elegant wine balanced already likely age several year Drink 2020

description: Rich and full in the mouth, this is a wine with structure, tight minera ltexture and beautifully juicy fruit. The acidity is a strong part of this wine, giving a citrus tang to go over the wood aging. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: Rich full mouth wine structure tight minera ltexture beautifully juicy fruit The acidity strong part wine giving citrus tang go wood aging Drink 2016

description: There's nothing shy about this Zin, which showcases both the variety's personality and the wine's terroir. The raspberry, licorice and espresso flavors have a sweet edge of brown sugar. The finish is entirely dry but hot, but that's part of Dry Creek's charm, and suggests pairing with rich, spicy, smoky meats.
Refined-description: There nothing shy Zin showcase variety personality wine terroir The raspberry licorice espresso flavor sweet edge brown sugar The finish entirely dry hot part Dry Creek charm suggests pairing rich spicy smoky meat

description: An intense and fresh wine that is packed with acidity as well as powerful red fruits. It is breathtakingly fruity at this stage, the structure still developing and giving a delicious perfumed berry character. Drink from 2015.
Refined-description: An intense fresh wine packed acidity well powerful red fruit It breathtakingly fruity stage structure still developing giving delicious perfumed berry character Drink 2015

description: Lots of purity, with acidity and stony minerality providing earthy balance to the lemon, lime and mango fruit flavors. Thoroughly dry, it's a classy wine to drink now.
Refined-description: Lots purity acidity stony minerality providing earthy balance lemon lime mango fruit flavor Thoroughly dry classy wine drink

description: This beautiful Pinot Noir is a blend of various vineyards throughout the appellation. It shows classic coastal acidity, dryness and silkiness, with appealing raspberry, red licorice, cola and pomegranate flavors, wrapped into finely ground tannins. Decant and drink now.
Refined-description: This beautiful Pinot Noir blend various vineyard throughout appellation It show classic coastal acidity dryness silkiness appealing raspberry red licorice cola pomegranate flavor wrapped finely ground tannin Decant drink

description: The cool 2011 vintage has kept this bottling from being as ripe as previous wines from this producer. It's certainly leaner, but for all that, it's dry, silky and elegantly complex in its own way, with dried raspberry, tea and white pepper flavors. It could surprise after 2017.
Refined-description: The cool 2011 vintage kept bottling ripe previous wine producer It certainly leaner dry silky elegantly complex way dried raspberry tea white pepper flavor It could surprise 2017

description: The second wine of Château Cheval Blanc is packed with wood flavors and spice. A toasty wine, it also has solid tannins plus fragrant fruitiness. Already the fruit is coming through strongly and it is for medium-term aging. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: The second wine Château Cheval Blanc packed wood flavor spice A toasty wine also solid tannin plus fragrant fruitiness Already fruit coming strongly mediumterm aging Drink 2017

description: Made from Viognier grown in the Gaillac region, this is a rich wine with tropical and yellow fruit flavors. The wood aging shows gently through the fresh fruit and attractive acidity. The wine is ready to drink, but will improve until 2018.
Refined-description: Made Viognier grown Gaillac region rich wine tropical yellow fruit flavor The wood aging show gently fresh fruit attractive acidity The wine ready drink improve 2018

description: This full-throated wine has layers of black fruits, firm tannins and a dense texture. It is rich, the black plum fruits partnered by dark chocolate and licorice. Wood aging still shows and the wine needs to broaden out even more as it ages. Drink from 2018.
Refined-description: This fullthroated wine layer black fruit firm tannin dense texture It rich black plum fruit partnered dark chocolate licorice Wood aging still show wine need broaden even age Drink 2018

description: This marks the first vintage of this Moulis estate under the ownership of the Barton family of Léoville Barton. Already the wine is showing breeding and an understated structure and richness. Lightly perfumed, full of black fruits and integrated tannins, it should age well. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: This mark first vintage Moulis estate ownership Barton family Léoville Barton Already wine showing breeding understated structure richness Lightly perfumed full black fruit integrated tannin age well Drink 2017

description: Syrah dominates the blend on this dry, complex red wine. It brings tannins and deep flavors of blackberries and charred meat. One-third of Grenache adds lightness and cherries, while oak contributes the perfect note of toast. The alcohol is high, but it never feels hot, just mouth-filling and warming. It's a polished and complex wine that brings to mind a perfect steak.
Refined-description: Syrah dominates blend dry complex red wine It brings tannin deep flavor blackberry charred meat Onethird Grenache add lightness cherry oak contributes perfect note toast The alcohol high never feel hot mouthfilling warming It polished complex wine brings mind perfect steak

description: Tannins give a dark, mineral structure. The black fruits, slowly coming through, are still part of this serious purpose, with wood flavors and dry fruits prominent. It still needs aging, so don't drink before 2016.
Refined-description: Tannins give dark mineral structure The black fruit slowly coming still part serious purpose wood flavor dry fruit prominent It still need aging nt drink 2016

description: Because strong toast aromas show through this wine, its attractive full fruit will need time to come through. The wine, with its firm, almost red-wine structure, needs to age until 2016 before drinking.
Refined-description: Because strong toast aroma show wine attractive full fruit need time come The wine firm almost redwine structure need age 2016 drinking

description: This is a powerful, rich blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It has structure, dark tannins, complex red berry fruits and just the right amount of wood aging. With its solid structured foundation that is partnered with the ripe fruits, it's going to age well. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: This powerful rich blend Merlot Cabernet Sauvignon It structure dark tannin complex red berry fruit right amount wood aging With solid structured foundation partnered ripe fruit going age well Drink 2016

description: This apricot and honey flavored wine is both rich and fresh. The balance between the sweetness, the botrytis and the acidity is just right. It will go well with blue cheese or pâté. Drink from 2015.
Refined-description: This apricot honey flavored wine rich fresh The balance sweetness botrytis acidity right It go well blue cheese pâté Drink 2015

description: Bone dry, this succulent, citrus-soaked Riesling is a textural marvel. Mixing grapefruit, lime and pear fruit flavors, its racy acidity underscores its complexity.
Refined-description: Bone dry succulent citrussoaked Riesling textural marvel Mixing grapefruit lime pear fruit flavor racy acidity underscore complexity

description: Named after a 17th-century nun who lived nearby, this wine packs impressive power and concentration. A great weight of solid tannins are paired with luscious red fruits. Its density, dry core and layers of fruit and acidity promise good aging. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Named 17thcentury nun lived nearby wine pack impressive power concentration A great weight solid tannin paired luscious red fruit Its density dry core layer fruit acidity promise good aging Drink 2017

description: This wine is made in the style of the winery's marvelous Finch Hollow Chardonnays, but is just a little less concentrated. Dry, crisp and elegantly clean, it has complex, mineral-infused flavors of tangerines, peaches and limes, enhanced with lots of smoky new oak. It should hold in the bottle through 2016.
Refined-description: This wine made style winery marvelous Finch Hollow Chardonnays little le concentrated Dry crisp elegantly clean complex mineralinfused flavor tangerine peach lime enhanced lot smoky new oak It hold bottle 2016

description: Showing richness, this wine is smooth and well balanced between ripe red berry fruits and generous tannins. The wood aging shows in a slight burnt edge, but this will pass as the wine develops. Drink from 2016.
Refined-description: Showing richness wine smooth well balanced ripe red berry fruit generous tannin The wood aging show slight burnt edge pas wine develops Drink 2016

description: This rich, youthful wine is another example of Lugana that is aging gracefully and has more to give. It opens with aromas of citrus, dried apricots and flint that carry over to the palate together with lemon drop, grapefruit and pear, plus fresh acidity. A mineral note marks the start of the long finish. Drink now through 2018.
Refined-description: This rich youthful wine another example Lugana aging gracefully give It open aroma citrus dried apricot flint carry palate together lemon drop grapefruit pear plus fresh acidity A mineral note mark start long finish Drink 2018

description: Some wood aging has rounded out this fruity wine. But it has not radically changed its inherent fresh, crisp character. It shows apples, lemon and lime juice and just a touch of spice from wood. The wine is ready to drink but will be best if left until 2015.
Refined-description: Some wood aging rounded fruity wine But radically changed inherent fresh crisp character It show apple lemon lime juice touch spice wood The wine ready drink best left 2015

description: Still firmly tannic, this wine is densely structured and shows good potential. It has dark tannins and rich berry fruits, followed by a more juicy aftertaste. With power and style combining well, it should be aged. Drink from 2017.
Refined-description: Still firmly tannic wine densely structured show good potential It dark tannin rich berry fruit followed juicy aftertaste With power style combining well aged Drink 2017

description: With a licorice, chemise and cherry-laden nose reminiscent of a hillside hike through the chaparral in the morning dew, this wine is rather tannic on entry, tending toward chamomile tea with cranberry fruit. With a strong tannic backbone, it could drink well for awhile.
Refined-description: With licorice chemise cherryladen nose reminiscent hillside hike chaparral morning dew wine rather tannic entry tending toward chamomile tea cranberry fruit With strong tannic backbone could drink well awhile

description: Raw, lightly leafy red-berry aromas properly announce what amounts to a juicy, snappy Tempranillo with berry, spice and dry oak flavors. A dry feeling, peppery tasting finish is traditional for good, basic Spanish table wine.
Refined-description: Raw lightly leafy redberry aroma properly announce amount juicy snappy Tempranillo berry spice dry oak flavor A dry feeling peppery tasting finish traditional good basic Spanish table wine

description: All stainless fermented, this seems to show some residual sugar, perhaps in order to round out the austere acidity. Lemon and tangerine fruit—all with plenty of acid—are annotated with highlights of fresh cilantro. It would be a fine match for simple, white fish.
Refined-description: All stainless fermented seems show residual sugar perhaps order round austere acidity Lemon tangerine fruit—all plenty acid—are annotated highlight fresh cilantro It would fine match simple white fish

description: Candied red-berry aromas are pasty at first, with a twinge of green. In the mouth, this is wiry and jammy feeling, with juicy acids. Herbal, slightly green flavors of olive, toast and berry fruits finish minty and a bit hot.
Refined-description: Candied redberry aroma pasty first twinge green In mouth wiry jammy feeling juicy acid Herbal slightly green flavor olive toast berry fruit finish minty bit hot

description: Tight, nervy and mineral, this crisp and fruity wine needs a few months to develop fully. It's lively with citrus fruits, an herbaceous character and steely aftertaste.
Refined-description: Tight nervy mineral crisp fruity wine need month develop fully It lively citrus fruit herbaceous character steely aftertaste

description: Blackberry liqueur, violet, cola and slight dustiness form the nose of this well-priced wine. The flavors are a bit thinner than expected, most reminiscent of ripe pomegranate.
Refined-description: Blackberry liqueur violet cola slight dustiness form nose wellpriced wine The flavor bit thinner expected reminiscent ripe pomegranate

description: Pretty aromas suggest plum, red berry, leather, graphite and eucalyptus. The understated palate isn't as expressive as the nose, but reveals subdued black cherry, black pepper, espresso and oak. Astringent tannins still need to integrate, but for now leave the mouth feeling dried out. Drink after 2020.
Refined-description: Pretty aroma suggest plum red berry leather graphite eucalyptus The understated palate nt expressive nose reveals subdued black cherry black pepper espresso oak Astringent tannin still need integrate leave mouth feeling dried Drink 2020

description: The Red Pony brand is putting out reliably distinct wines. This one smells of cranberry, oregano and barnyard. The tannins and acidity are solid, with strawberry and pomegranate flavors leading to an earthy finish. Hold until 2016 for an even smoother time.
Refined-description: The Red Pony brand putting reliably distinct wine This one smell cranberry oregano barnyard The tannin acidity solid strawberry pomegranate flavor leading earthy finish Hold 2016 even smoother time

description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, espresso and a hint of tire rubber. The palate displays sweet black cherry extract layered with milk chocolate, coffee and oak alongside bracing tannins and racy acidity. Drink after 2018.
Refined-description: This open aroma toasted oak espresso hint tire rubber The palate display sweet black cherry extract layered milk chocolate coffee oak alongside bracing tannin racy acidity Drink 2018

description: The lightest wine in the winery's well-crafted lineup, this marries grapefruity acidity to tart cherry fruit. It's nicely balanced, airy and a pleasure to drink.
Refined-description: The lightest wine winery wellcrafted lineup marries grapefruity acidity tart cherry fruit It nicely balanced airy pleasure drink

description: This tight, young wine is shot through with steely acidity and minerality. It tastes of the flinty soil of Pouilly, full in the mouth and concentrated. Give it until 2015 before drinking.
Refined-description: This tight young wine shot steely acidity minerality It taste flinty soil Pouilly full mouth concentrated Give 2015 drinking

description: Crafted entirely from estate-grown fruit, this tart, citrus-flavored rosé is anchored in rhubarb and strawberry flavors. It offers medium concentration and length, with a subtle suggestion of cola woven into the finish.
Refined-description: Crafted entirely estategrown fruit tart citrusflavored rosé anchored rhubarb strawberry flavor It offer medium concentration length subtle suggestion cola woven finish

description: Raspberry and plum aromas start with a resiny oak covering that turns foresty and briary with airing. This is raisiny and ripe in feel, with a complex mix of berry, fennel and anise flavors. A lush, dense-feeling finish is minty and herbal.
Refined-description: Raspberry plum aroma start resiny oak covering turn foresty briary airing This raisiny ripe feel complex mix berry fennel anise flavor A lush densefeeling finish minty herbal

description: This tastes of warmer Russian River Valley climes, darker and riper in black cherry and berry fruit character with a layering of toasty cinnamon and oak. The aroma tends to the earthy/pastoral.
Refined-description: This taste warmer Russian River Valley clime darker riper black cherry berry fruit character layering toasty cinnamon oak The aroma tends earthypastoral

description: As is often the case with Oregon's 2011 Pinots, this remains stubbornly tight, and shows herbal and stem flavors rather than pretty fruit. That said, it also displays the excellent structure of the better wines from the vintage. Underpinnings of acid and tannin, plus the still sharp-edged pomegranate fruit, may carry it up to 2024.
Refined-description: As often case Oregon 2011 Pinots remains stubbornly tight show herbal stem flavor rather pretty fruit That said also display excellent structure better wine vintage Underpinnings acid tannin plus still sharpedged pomegranate fruit may carry 2024

description: This comes from estate-grown fruit in the Chehalem Mountains AVA. Spicy and sharp-toned, it brings tart acidity and highlights of orange peel to flavors of wild mountain berries. The tannins are still a bit rough, but should smooth out with more bottle age.
Refined-description: This come estategrown fruit Chehalem Mountains AVA Spicy sharptoned brings tart acidity highlight orange peel flavor wild mountain berry The tannin still bit rough smooth bottle age

winery: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle
description: It's the hard, granite rock of the vineyards that gives this wine its tight, firm texture. It is very crisp, structured with tense acidity and strong lemon-lime flavors. The wine, with its intense freshness, is very much made to partner food.
Refined-description: It hard granite rock vineyard give wine tight firm texture It crisp structured tense acidity strong lemonlime flavor The wine intense freshness much made partner food

description: A new label for MacMurray Ranch, this Pinot Gris is stony in fresh nectarine, pear and mango, wrapped in a creamy texture that develops fleshy flavors of fig in the glass. The fruit is sourced from both MacMurray Ranch and Gallo's cooler Russian River Valley outpost, Two Rock, near Petaluma.
Refined-description: A new label MacMurray Ranch Pinot Gris stony fresh nectarine pear mango wrapped creamy texture develops fleshy flavor fig glass The fruit sourced MacMurray Ranch Gallo cooler Russian River Valley outpost Two Rock near Petaluma

description: This wine offers a lighter side of Petite Sirah. It conveys more red fruit than brooding black and blue, a taste of red licorice and lean, balanced red cherries sleekly layered over earthy plum and spice. Its structure and acidity make it food-friendly, ready to accent a black pepper steak or similarly seasoned roast.
Refined-description: This wine offer lighter side Petite Sirah It conveys red fruit brooding black blue taste red licorice lean balanced red cherry sleekly layered earthy plum spice Its structure acidity make foodfriendly ready accent black pepper steak similarly seasoned roast

description: Exotic incense, sandalwood and ripe berry aromas waft from the glass of this single-vineyard Barbaresco. The palate is initially closed but slowly reveals crunchy Morello cherry, toast and espresso alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2018.
Refined-description: Exotic incense sandalwood ripe berry aroma waft glass singlevineyard Barbaresco The palate initially closed slowly reveals crunchy Morello cherry toast espresso alongside assertive tannin Drink 2018

description: Floral and pretty in ripe peach and pineapple/mango, it unwinds with a finish of vanilla.
Refined-description: Floral pretty ripe peach pineapplemango unwinds finish vanilla

description: Finished (apparently) off-dry, this seems to show some residual sugar in a leesy, yeasty style. The fruit suggests pears and cotton candy, with juicy acidity supporting the sweetness. Don't look for your standard dry Pinot Gris, but what's here is generous and enjoyable.
Refined-description: Finished apparently offdry seems show residual sugar leesy yeasty style The fruit suggests pear cotton candy juicy acidity supporting sweetness Do nt look standard dry Pinot Gris generous enjoyable

description: This is a smooth, easy-drinking and rather light-bodied wine, not unusual in the tricky vintage of 2011. Relatively light in color, this offers scents of sweet cherry, vanilla and cinnamon, while the flavors recall cherry and raspberry. The texture is almost delicate but livened up with a good touch of acidity.

description: Varietally specific aromas of wild flowers, honey and lemon verbena set up an unctuous, creamy palate with modest acidity and lots of weight. Honey, mango, vanilla and other sweet, tropical flavors finish thick but not quite cloying. This is a unique wine for Navarra that deserves to be judged on its own.
designation: Vendimia Tardia Single Vineyard Finca El Bosque
Refined-description: Varietally specific aroma wild flower honey lemon verbena set unctuous creamy palate modest acidity lot weight Honey mango vanilla sweet tropical flavor finish thick quite cloying This unique wine Navarra deserves judged

description: Plum, vanilla, chocolate and subtle oak aromas carry over to the palate. The palate displays chocolate-covered cherries, fig and coffee alongside bracing tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink 2018–2025.
Refined-description: Plum vanilla chocolate subtle oak aroma carry palate The palate display chocolatecovered cherry fig coffee alongside bracing tannin leave drying finish Drink 2018–2025

description: This is aggressively tart and herbal, but shows good density and concentration. Flavors of lemon verbena mixed with lime-ade run true and full on through an extended, focused finish.

description: Pastoral and earthy, it's straightforward and tightly woven in tannins, with balanced acidity that offers a sense of wild strawberries. A well-made wine priced attractively; stock up for midweek needs.
Refined-description: Pastoral earthy straightforward tightly woven tannin balanced acidity offer sense wild strawberry A wellmade wine priced attractively stock midweek need

description: This delicate Hungarian white wine is a blend of 86% Furmint, 9% Yellow Muscat and 5% Kabar. It has enticing aromas of white flowers, botrytis, gardenia, apple blossom and apricot that prepare your palate for flavors of peach juice, citrus zest, grapefruit juice, caramelized pineapple and a crisp clean finish.

description: In a classic combination of ripe flavors and lip-smacking structure, this full-bodied wine wraps concentrated black cherry and mint aromas and generous cherry and blackberry flavors in muscular tannins that keep the texture fresh.

There's a strong blackberry-balsamic reduction flavor once sipped, as well as beef char, elderberry and more tar.

description: Loads of clove, allspice, cinnamon and nutmeg spice show up the strawberry, blueberry and red cherry aromas of this lavish bottling, which also offers scents of crushed rock and turned earth. Similar elements entertain the palate, culminating with a minty pine needle note, proving to be a very dynamic sip.

description: Huckleberry and dark cherry mingle around a viscosity of velvety texture and tannin, dusted in notions of black tea, tar and red currant. Light in color, but bold in flavor, this wine speaks to both the cool nature of its vineyard site, and to the style of the winemaker.

description: The grapes for this full-bodied wine hail from the Luvisi Vineyard in the heart of Calistoga old-vine country—a warm and welcome site for the variety. Baked blackberry and black olive combine around a taste of charred meat before brawny spins of brown sugar and nutmeg play on the palate with jolts of chocolate and vanilla.

description: This is a creamy, thick and food friendly white with highlights of honey and green apple and a lingering decadence of ginger, just hinting at anise. Medium-bodied, it represents the vintage and the appellation well, at a price that's nice.
Refined-description: This creamy thick food friendly white highlight honey green apple lingering decadence ginger hinting anise Mediumbodied represents vintage appellation well price nice

description: A majority of Grenache and tiny bit of Mourvèdre from Kick Ranch and McGah Vineyard were racked to concrete egg for fermentation, with the intent of preserving freshness. Successful in that quest, this orange-pink wine is dry, tangy and well-integrated in terms of acidity, subtle in cranberry, dried cherry and orange, with a light, refreshing finish.

description: The slightest notes of angelica and kiwi fruit lend perfume to a slender, almost weightless body. This slinky Sylvaner runs rings around you, intriguing with its weightless charm. It's dry, lithe and refreshing.

description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned berry, fennel, toast and baking spice come together in the glass. The taut, focused, palate shows ripe black cherry, red raspberry, mineral and licorice while fresh acidity and firm tannins provide balance. Drink 2019 through 2024.

description: Here is the most engaging offering of the winery's 2013 single vineyard Pinots. It's bright with red-berry fruit and tropical-candy highlights. Meyer lemon peeks in, and the tangy fruit flavors continue into a finish of medium weight and length. Drink now and over the next couple of years.

description: A bit stiff, this expresses its terroir with accents of earth and clay around muted red fruits. Streaks of sassafras, coconut and vanilla emerge as the wine breathes open. Decant this one for at least an hour or two.

description: This is a real tongue-stainer, earthy and packed with purple fruits. Flavors of blueberries, plums, bitter chocolate and charred wood abound. The wine remains lively with ample acidity and smooth, though dense tannins.

description: This well-made wine blends in a hearty 17% Petite Sirah, providing additional power and dusty berry flavor. Sultry and velvety on the palate, it's spicy and peppery in subtle measure, with a juicy cheeriness on the lengthy finish.

description: A new offering made entirely from estate fruit, this is a selection of the best blocks and barrels of the vintage, with its core component being 90% Howell Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon. The remainder is Zinfandel. Together they provide black color and a whiff of bay leaf and peppercorn, around well-integrated layers of black cherry, vanilla and black tea.

description: Typical for this winery, this smells a bit herbal, with tomato and earthy plum aromas leading the way. Scratchy, grabby tannins support savory, herbal berry flavors. Hard tannins struggle to resolve themselves on a firm, muscular finish.

description: This is a ripe, earthy, modern-leaning Rioja with aromas of blackberry, raisin and rubber. Soft and fleshy on the palate, what this easygoing number lacks in structure is made up for in charm. Ultraripe flavors of plum and berry come with a chocolaty accent, while the finish is smooth and tastes earthy and spicy. Drink through 2019.

description: Brilliant, pure fruit flavors light up this full-bodied but easy-to-drink wine. Cherry, strawberry and something deeper like black currant dance through the aromas and coat the tongue with their richness. The texture is smooth and plush due to fine tannins and mild acidity.

description: Dark shades of bramble and smoked nuts lend a shadowy mystique to this unusual Schwartzriesling, otherwise known as Pinot Meunier. Full bodied yet elegant, the palate boasts tart blackberry and raspberry flavors framed in finely grained tannins. A rare chance to experience this grape as a single varietal wine.

description: Earthy berry and raisin aromas announce a warm, ripe wine. This feels plump, grapy and chunky, with moderate acidity. Grapy, bold flavors of raspberry, prune and cherry are earthy and loamy, while ripeness and a raisiny element carry onto the finish. Drink through 2019.
Refined-description: Earthy berry raisin aroma announce warm ripe wine This feel plump grapy chunky moderate acidity Grapy bold flavor raspberry prune cherry earthy loamy ripeness raisiny element carry onto finish Drink 2019

description: A blend of 60% Syrah, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot, this inky garnet-colored wine offers aromas of cassis and elderberry. On the palate, there is a combination of cooked fruit and cool spice flavors yet there is no lack of accompanying acidity. Flavors of cassis, elderberry, anise, orange peel and vanilla are backed by silky tannins that stay smooth into the cooling finish.

description: Scorched earth, cured meat, toasted nut and grilled herb aromas lead the nose on this full-bodied red. The warm, ripe palate doles out raspberry jam, mature black cherry, vanilla and star anise framed in firm, velvety tannins.

description: The aromas of herbs, pencil lead and blue and red fruit are forward, fresh and appealing. The flavors follow similarly, showing depth and balance uncommon for a wine this price.

description: The picturesque name of the wine, the vineyard where God sits, comes from a monopole—a walled property in the hills behind Beaune, wholly owned by the Château de Santenay. Ripe and smooth with an attractive, crisp texture, the wine is ready to drink. A touch of toast gives extra interest.

description: Tilled soil, forest floor, mature black-skinned fruit, leather and a truffle note come together in the glass. The firmly structured palate presents juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon, vanilla and an earthy hint of game while assertive, close-grained tannins provide support. Give it a few years for the tannins to relax then enjoy. Drink 2019–2023.
Refined-description: Tilled soil forest floor mature blackskinned fruit leather truffle note come together glass The firmly structured palate present juicy black cherry crushed raspberry cinnamon vanilla earthy hint game assertive closegrained tannin provide support Give year tannin relax enjoy Drink 2019–2023

description: A majority of Grenache plays lead here, with an accompaniment of 35% Syrah and 12% Mourvedre. Concentrated in a grip of leather, there's further integration of earth and black fruit that stays bright and vibrant on the palate, a medium-bodied coming-together of savory with ripe.

description: Produced from 25-year-old vines, this is a fresh as well as ripe wine, well balanced between herbal flavors and white and citrus fruitiness. It has a rounded texture that is juicy as well as full in the mouth. The wine is ready to drink.

description: Complexities of mushroom, caramel and brioche lend a haze of maturity over delicate strawberry and cherry notes in this Champagne-style sparkling,which was aged for eight years over lees. Tiny, persistent bubbles spread seamlessly on the palate, accentuated by streaks of racy acidity.

description: Always an eye-opening bottling, this blends 50% Sangiovese with 50% Syrah. This vintage shows cooked blackberries, baked plums, balsamic vinaigrette and black rocks on the nose. The palate is juicy and energetic, blending dark fruit with bright acidity, coffee and caramel flavors, with strong tannins for structure.
Refined-description: Always eyeopening bottling blend 50 Sangiovese 50 Syrah This vintage show cooked blackberry baked plum balsamic vinaigrette black rock nose The palate juicy energetic blending dark fruit bright acidity coffee caramel flavor strong tannin structure

description: Buy this for its balance and welcome sense of restraint that gives way to richness on the finish. Crisp apple and light citrus aromas, then nicely concentrated and similar flavors, put an attractive spin on this medium-bodied, fresh and appealing wine.
Refined-description: Buy balance welcome sense restraint give way richness finish Crisp apple light citrus aroma nicely concentrated similar flavor put attractive spin mediumbodied fresh appealing wine

description: What Baumard describes as a “secret blend” from its vineyards, this wine is both sweet and fresh. Honey and intense acidity are filled out with baked apple and lemon-marmalade flavors. It is ready to drink in all its fresh glory.
Refined-description: What Baumard describes “ secret blend ” vineyard wine sweet fresh Honey intense acidity filled baked apple lemonmarmalade flavor It ready drink fresh glory

description: Guigal does a terrific job with its regional wines, and this rosé is no exception. Notes of crushed stone and underripe pineapple broaden out into red berries and white chocolate on the weighty but balanced palate.

description: Layered aromas and rich but vibrant flavors help this medium-bodied wine stand out. It has a medium color with a brickish rim, while aromas suggest black tea and black cherry. A dry, tangy, but ripe fruit expression on the tongue lingers on the finish.
Refined-description: Layered aroma rich vibrant flavor help mediumbodied wine stand It medium color brickish rim aroma suggest black tea black cherry A dry tangy ripe fruit expression tongue lingers finish

description: Aromas of earthy, nutty, mature berry fruits come with a hint of raisin and a touch of compost. This saturated Vino de Cádiz is composed of 80% Syrah, with Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's a heavy wine with flavors of vanilla, burnt wood, blackened spices and stewed berries. The finish tastes peppery, dark and outright woody. Drink through 2019.

description: This blend from Cádiz features Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's big, ripe and minty on the nose, with hints of animal fur and leather. A blocky, full palate weighs in at 15.5%, while flavors of oak and vanilla blend well with spiced berry fruit. A drying finish tastes mostly of oak. Drink through 2025.
